loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: E. is 36 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has three children; all of them are single and attend school. She is married to Ra, 39, who works as a motor taxi driver. E. has been a fish seller since 1999. She gets up early every morning to buy the fishes from the fishermen along the riverside and takes them to the market. She uses a bicycle for her business but it is difficult for her as she is now becoming older. E. is looking for a loan to buy one motorbike for her business and her family. The loan will help the family have a better living standard.

loans.use: To buy one motorbike for her business and her family

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Jocelyn A. is 39 years old. She is married to a chainsaw operator, who also makes chairs out of  native materials. They have three children and they presently live in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

It was never Jocelyn's ambition to become a fish vendor but due to financial problems of her parents she was not able to finish college.  Such life experience made her realize that she needs to do her part to help make ends meet and  to be able to send their children in school and have a descent life.  These eagerness urged her to be in the business. Lack of financial assistance is a problem then.  A relative informed her of the services of PMPC. Without hesitation she grabbed the opportunity and became a bonafide member enjoying the benefits such as the insurance and savings services. Now she is requested for her third loan to be used to increase her working capital for her fish vending business.

Her earnest desire is to have a bigger stall to display the fish in order to sell a wider range of products and have plenty of customers.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Lara

texts.en:
Lara Z., 43, of Lurogan, Valencia City is one of HSPFI's pioneer clients--a member for years. Lara and her daughter live with her parents. She tried to graduate from high school studies yet failed. Her husband's salary is not enough to paid for school expenses plus other priorities in the family.

She is engaged in retailing (grocery items) with a beginning capital of PHP 2000. Her business has become larger and the demand for goods has increased. So,she is longing for the additional financial support of PHP 25,000 to realize her dreams and establish a "carenderia" (food cafe). This is to accommodate the customers from the Day Care Center, Barangay Hall and Health Center which will be constructed at the back of their house. Lara aspires to better her children's future.

loans.use: To purchase bulk grocery items for sale

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: S. is 61 years old and a resident of the Pursat Province in Cambodia. She is a widow and has one child who works as a garment worker. S. works as a local farmer. Her nephew even helps her work because she is old. She is tired of hiring her neighbor's ox to plow her field. So, S. is looking for a loan to buy her own ox to plow her farmland. The loan will improve the family income.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow her farmland

loans.name: Ederlyn

texts.en:
Canitoan,Cagayan de Oro City is one of the barangay (villages) hit by the calamity last January and most of the agricultural plants washed out. But despite the calamity, Mrs. Ederlyn R. stands firm and continues her plans without any discouragement.

Ederlyn has had a sari-sari (variety) store for quite a number of years. She was able to send her daughter and son to school, and she's very happy because she still survives in the midst of crises. She has 3 college students and 1 in the elementary grades. Ederlyn wants all of her children to finish college and land a decent job afterward. At this time, she needs to have additional capital for her variety store, amounting to PHP 11,000 to purchase a bulk quantity of basic commodities.

loans.use: to purchase a bulk quantity of basic commodities

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chiv

texts.en: S. is 24 years old and a resident of the Pursat Province. She has two children, both of whom are under her care. She is married to Pech, 26, who is a motor-taxi driver. S. is a pig raiser which enables her to earn good profits. She always sells to the slaughter every four months when they are big enough to be sold. S. is a responsible mother and neighbor, and she wants to increase her income through her business. S. is applying for a loan to buy more piglets for her pigpen.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia C., in her 50s, still believes her income-generating project (grocery retailing) would be progressing for the next 2 years.  She is a "Cebuano" (a Philippine ethnicity and language), migrated to Bukidnon, looking for a greener pastures. Before, the couple was dependent on being  laborers on their master's farm.  The income is not convincing so she shifted to business (retailing) and it works since she was assisted by HSPFI for years. She wishes for an increment of  business stocks. Hence, she is in need of PHP 24,000 to realize this business outlook.

loans.use: To purchase big quantities of grocery items for sale

loans.name: Busingye Allen Group

texts.en:
Allen Businyge is 32 years of age and married with four children. She also cares for additional family members. She rents a one-room house, where she stays with her children and husband. She has access to piped water and electricity and the family has three meals a day. Her greatest expense every month is feeding the family and paying tuition for her children.

Allen Businyge sells tomatoes to make a living for herself. She works seven days a week and pays rent for the premises on which she operates her business. She has been doing this business for five years now and prior to this she was selling groundnuts. The main challenge she finds in her business is the rainy season, which affects the number of customers she receives in a day. She sells in an open market and the rain disrupts her business.

This is her tenth loan with MCDT and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because it is near her home so she doesn’t have to spend money on transport. She hopes to use this loan to increase her stock. She aspires to expand her business to improve her income.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Me

texts.en: Me S is 41 years old and a resident of the Kompong Tom Province. She has six children; two are single and attend school, and the other four are married and living separately. Me S is married to Khim, 55, who is a local farmer. Me S has also been a local farmer since 2005. To help the family income, she raises pigs in a pigpen behind her house which she sells to the slaughter every three months. Recently the price of rice became cheaper than usual; Me S wants to have it in her stock for some time while waiting for better prices. So, she is asking for a loan to buy rice to stock in her house for the next season.

loans.use: To buy rice to stock for next season

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en: S. is 55 years old and a resident of the Pursat Province in Cambodia. She has five children. Three of them are married and live separately. The other two are single and live with her; one is a teacher and the other is a motor-taxi driver. S. has been a rice trader since 2000. She is recognized as a hard-working mother and a responsible neighbor. Recently, she faced a problem with the transportation. So, S. is looking for a loan to buy a motorbike for herself and her family. The loan will help the family achieve a better living standard.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for herself and her family

loans.name: Khabib

texts.en:
M. Khabib first applied to MicroInvest in 2006 for a business development loan. Khabib is married and has 7 children. Khabib dreams of having a big family flock and livestock farm. He also produces milk which his wife sells in the local bazaar. Thanks to previous loans, he improved his existing livestock business and purchased one more cow and 4 rams. His wife and children are involved in the livestock business.

Today Khabib is applying to KIVA with the request for a business develpoment loan of 3800 STJ for 10 months to build a big summer cow barn. This permits him to make the livestock comfortable and to take suitable care of the animals. Khabib thanks KIVA for its suport.

loans.use: Build a big summer cow barn

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: C. is 21 years old and a resident of the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. He has three children, all of whom are single and under his care. He is married to Saran, 21, who is a firewood provider to their community. C. has been working with his wife since 2002. He uses his cart with oxen for his business and earns a good profit. To make a greater income for the family, C. is requesting a loan of $ 300 to buy one more ox for his business. He dreams of having a bigger house and degrees for his children.

loans.use: To buy one more ox for his business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and has requested a loan to help her expand her business.  Mary is 38 years old and married; her husband is a medical doctor. They have 4 children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, Mary hopes to improve their home economy by saving some money. 


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: Improve home economy by saving profits from her business

loans.name: Nakayza Ziyada Group

texts.en:
Ziyada N. is 30 years of age and married. She rents a one-room house where she stays with her two children and husband. They have access to piped water and electricity. Ziyada has two meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is that of feeding and paying tuition for her children.

Ziyada runs a food kiosk in the market and must pay market dues for operating there. She receives about 15 clients a day and they are both men and women. She has done this kind of business for over 10 years now and has not done any other type of business before. The main challenges she faces while doing her business are the rainy season and petty thieves, who are many in the market in which she operates.

She has worked with MCDT for seven years now. She chose to work with MCDT because through MCDT she receives enough money to boost her business. She will use this loan to pay school fees for her children and use the balance to pay rent for the house in which she stays. Ziyada hopes to continue expanding her business to improve on her income.

loans.use: To pay school fees and rent for her house.

loans.name: Uon

texts.en: Uon O., 43, is married and lives with her husband in the Bati, Takeo province. She raises pigs from her home and sells palm sugar at the market. From these activities, she makes USD $20 in revenue per day. Her husband is a rice farmer and earns $1 per day. This couple has four children, three of whom are employed and one who is a student. Mrs. Uon O. would like to take out a loan to be able to raise more pigs.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Soeurm

texts.en: H. is 35 years old and lives in the Siem Reap Province. She cares for three children, all of whom are students. She is married to Rath, 47, who is in the armed force military. H. is a local construction worker and works hard in her field. She has gained a better profit from her work and can surely responsd to all the demands. Due to her work, H. faces difficulty with transportation to her field because it’s a little bit far than usual as she has changed her living place. H. is now requesting a loan of $250 to buy a motor for her transport to the field. The loan will help her family achieve a better living.

loans.use: To buy a motor for her transport to the field

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda C., 52 years old, a resident of Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City, started her sand and gravel business on a consignment arrangement which she got from her uncle. Rosalinda was grateful to HSPFI for the financial assistance that it extend to her which enabled her to grow her business. She is now on her fourth loan cycle and she is requesting for an additional loan of PHP14000 to further expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sand and gravel for sale.

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam N., 64, is a cow dealer who lives with his wife and two school-aged children in Bati, Takeo province. He purchases and re-sells cows to earn a living and is able to make US$ 6 in revenue a day. His wife is a good housewife who stays at home, cooking for her family members. Mr. Sam N. would like to take out a loan to purchase more cows to re-sell.

loans.use: To purchase cows for re-sale

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia B. is a member of HSPFI Airbus Center under the supervision of Mr. Jhon Andrew Igot. Herminia is 49 years old and married to Reginald B.. They are blessed with four children. Two of her children are married and her youngest are in fourth year college.  The family lives in Lumbia, near Cagayan de Oro City airport, in Southern Philippines. She in engaged in hog-raising and retailing. She buys piglets at PHP1,500 and sells then at PHP 2,000 earning a profit of PHP500 for her. Most of her customers are her "suki" (regular customers) and neighbors and residents in the nearby villages. To expand her business, she wants to buy more piglets and she needs a loan amounting to PHP20,000. If granted, this will be her 6th loan cycle with HSPFI.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for sale

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: S. owns a small alcohol distilling hall and raises piglets as well. She runs this business very well and has been earning a good profit from this work since 2007. She is recognized for her skill in distilling alcohol, and she earns her daily income of $4 per day. S. has been married to Mao, 28, for a number of years. Mao is a local construction worker and a hard-working husband. Lately, the family has been facing problems with the business’ transportation. So, S. is applying for a loan of $400 to buy a motorbike for the business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the business

loans.name: Mork

texts.en: Mork K., 51, is a widow and a farmer who lives in Takeo, Cambodia. She grows rice, sell palm fruit, and frogs. On average, she makes US$ 20 in revenue per day. She has four children, three of whom are students and one who is a construction worker, building houses. Mrs. Mork would like to take out a loan to purchase palm fruit for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruit for sale

loans.name: Som

texts.en: In the middle of the community, crowded families living along the sub-main street located in the Siem Reap Province have been using the service of a small disc exchange. S., 26, owns this service. She has been in this business for more than a year, and has gained a lot of clients from her commune. S. is married to Than, 25, who is a local construction worker. Than recently faced a problem with his transport and traveling because the workplace is now farther than usual. Hence, S. is applying for a loan of $350 to buy a motor for her husband's usage. The family will have a better living standard through this loan. S. was not available during the photograph, so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy a motor for her husband's usage

loans.name: Emma Procesa

texts.en:
Emma Procesa R. is 47 year old, married and a resident of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has three children and she is engaged in fruits and vegetables retailing. The husband is a barangay councilor and at the same time a meter reader of MOELCI II - an electric power company.  One of son is already working abroad as a marine engineer.

Her business started with a minimal capital of PHP 2,000 and one display table. After her membership with PMPC she was able to build a storage room for the fruits and vegetables. She needs additional capital in order she can purchase fruits and vegetables in bigger volume and lower cost.

She hopes to become a wholesaler in the municipality of Jimenez

loans.use: Fruits and Vegetables Retailing

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch O., 46, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo, Cambodia. She and her husband sell fish at the market and are able to make US$ 25 in revenue per day. They also get support from two of their children who work as construction workers. This couple needs to ask for a loan to purchase more fish to re-sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to re-sell

loans.name: Mex

texts.en: Mex Y., 58, lives with his wife in Takeo province, Cambodia. He is a taxi driver who typically makes US$ 7 every day. His wife grows and sells vegetables at the market to earn approximately US$ 10 per day. This couple has five children and all of them are students. Mr. Mex Y. would like to take out a loan to purchase a water pump to irrigate his wife’s farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Uonn

texts.en: K., an innocent female, age 30, is a crop planter living in the Siem Reap Province. She has been growing various kinds of crops such as potatoes, cucumbers, gourds, etc. To sustain the family income, K. also works as a local construction worker when she's not laboring on her plantation. From this, she has earned a better income for her family's savings. Her husband’s name is Moung, 27, and he also works as a local construction worker. K. has one child who is still young and attends school. Nowadays, K. is facing a problem with the family transportation. She has to both work and take her child to school. Anyway, she is tired of taking the motor-taxi. So, K. is requesting a loan of $300 to buy a motor for herself and her family transportation. The loan will help the family achieve a better living standard.

loans.use: To buy a motor for herself and her family transportation

loans.name: Un

texts.en: K., 23, is a local construction worker. She started her job almost three years ago and is famous for her perfect work which is recognized by the locals. K. is married to Thoo who works with her. The spouse lives with another sister who  earns a living by raising pigs in the pigpen behind her house. The labor job in construction work is K.’s main source of the family income. Now, K. is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy a motor for work and to buy more piglets for her sister. The loan will help the family achieve a better living.

loans.use: To buy a motor for her work and to buy more piglets for her sister

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en: K., 29, owns a battery-powered machine (battery AA) recharged in her family's land in the Siem Reap Province. She has been in this business for more than four years and runs it very well. To help add more income to the family, K. owns a grocery store, and she is noted for her service. Yun, 32, is K.’s husband; he owns a medium vehicle used as a dump truck. The family has three children, all of whom are single and attending school. Now, K. wants to increase her income to provide for her family’s expenses. Thus, K. is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more grocery products and to renovate her grocery shop. K. was not available during the photograph, so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products and to renovate her grocery shop

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Finesse (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kaboila II,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région du Mali). 
 Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont, la vente  de  légumes, de savons, de pagne wax etc. .
Dans le but de donner satisfaction à leurs clients et d’agrandir leurs activités, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont  à  leur   troisième  prêt  solidaire. Les deux  prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter, 10 cartons de savons, 4  chargements de charrettes en légumes et 5 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles   s’approvisionnent à Sikasso ville et dans les localités environnantes.  Les marchandises sont vendues au marché et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 30.000FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider leur mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie épargnée.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Finesse are all married and average 45 years of age and 2 children. They live in traditional families in Kaboila II, a district in the city of Sikasso (third region of the Republic of Mali). They do various work, selling vegetables, soap, Wax-brand pagnes, etc.

With the goal of satisfying their customers and expanding their businesses, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan. The two preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The members plan to buy 10 boxes of soap, 4 cart-loads of vegetables, and 5 lengths of Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth). Supplies are gotten in Sikasso City and in surrounding towns. The merchandise is sold, mostly in cash, at the marketplace and in the area, to customers composed generally of women.

The group members each envision realizing an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA per month. Part of the profits will be used to assist their husband with daily expenses, and the other part, saved.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra S. has a business selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Nasra is 25 years old and married; her husband is a security guard. They have four children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, Nasra hopes to reinvest in her business


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: Expand her business selling beer

loans.name: Murod

texts.en: Murod O., born in 1960 in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan, is married and has a large family. Engaged in the livestock business for 20 years, he works with his wife producing and selling milk products. Murod is now requesting a loan of 1500 STJ for six months to purchase equipment to facilitate the production of milk. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To purchase milking equipment.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 37-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Ahmad has been working as a mason. He also works as a motorcycle repairman. Ahmad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his business. Ahmad has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his business as well as his financial situation. Ahmad is special in his business because he is the only one in his region. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started, he had difficulty finding the right place to open his garage. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Ahmad will use the loan to purchase tools for his business.

loans.name: Medicia

texts.en: Medicia, 50, a single parent, has a child to take care and look after. Her husband left them while her son was still one-year old. In spite of this, Medicia is still a very optimistic woman.   For her, life doesn't end there, she must continue to earn a living for her son's sake. When she heard about HSPFI offering financial assistance to micro entrepreneurs, she joined and availed a loan amounting to PHP5000. She used proceeds of her loan to start her small variety store to to support their needs. For now, she is in need amounting to PHP14000 to purchase additional grocery items to be more competitive in the market. The more stocks she would have the more income she would get and part of it will be used send her son to school.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her small variety store

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 7 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles  en majorité monogames  dans le village de  Finkolo, Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat - vente des condiments, de haricot, de la farine de blé et  la restauration.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé de collaborer  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursés les cinq prêts précédents, elles sont à leur sixième prêt  de groupe (prêt solidaire) 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt,  15 sacs de 100kg de haricot, 7 sacs et ½  de 50 kilogrammes de farine de blé, 5 bidons d’huiles de 20 litres, 10 paniers de tomates, 30 sacs de choux pommés et des condiments pour la sauce. Elles s’approvisionnent  au marché de Sikasso et Finkolo.
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Gladiè, Kadièla et Finkolo en détail, au comptant et à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie  investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The seven women of the group Danaya are all married and average 39 years of age and seven children. They live in traditional families, mostly monogamous ones, in the village of Finkolo (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do various work, such as buying and selling condiments, beans, and flour, and they do food catering.

To satisfy their customers, the group members decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly repaid their five preceding loans, they are on their sixth group loan (solidarity loan). The members plan to buy fifteen 100-kg sacks of beans, seven and a half 50-kg sacks of flour, five 20-liter drums of oil, 10 baskets of tomatoes, 30 sacks of cabbage, and condiments for making sauces. Supplies are gotten at the Sikasso and Finkolo marketplaces. The merchandise is sold retail at the marketplaces of Gladiè, Kadièla, and Finkolo (cash or credit accepted).

The group members each envision realizing an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA per month. Part of the profits will be used to meet family needs, and the other part is to be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods for commerce and for catering

loans.name: Hera Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Hera Devi M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives in single family with her husband and two children. She has one daughter and one son. Her daughter is studying in grade 3 and her son is just a year old. They are a middle class family. Her husband, Mr. Ram Krishna M., is engaged in wood carving. He has nine years of experience in this field. He sells his work to dealers. He also employs three workers in his wood carving business. Wood carving work is one of the traditional works for the local people work in Thecho and Thecho is famous for its wood carving. 

Now Mrs. Hera Devi M. is requesting a loan for Rs 25000.00  to help her husband buy materials for his wood carving business. Her husband is the only income source for the family and all the financial requirement of the family are met with his income.

loans.use: To buys wood carving materials

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina M., 39, married, ventures into fish vending to keep-up with the day to day needs of their family. It is her way of helping her husband, who only works as a carpenter, raise their four children. Given that demand for carpentry jobs is not constant, relying on her husband's income would not do good for their family. Gina was happy that HSPFI granted her loan to finance her fish vending business. She will be on her 4th loan cycle and she is requesting PHP 14000 loan to buy fish buckets for storage and additional capital to buy more fish for sale. She hopes that she would be able to get a space/stall in the public market someday.

loans.use: To buy additional fish buckets for storage and capital to buy fish for sale.

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita A. is 52 year old, married, and is presently living at Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has six children -- all of them are already married.  Her husband is a farmer.

The business started with PHP 1,000 only. Nowadays, with financial support from PMPC,  she is able to cater many customers since she has many stocks in her retail store. She is in her 5th loan cycle now and has a very good repayment performance.  She aspires to help her grandchildren in small ways and save money for her old age.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her retail store

loans.name: Shahzoda

texts.ru: Шахзода женщина 27 лет , замужем имеет одного ребёнка.После окончания средней школы поступила в училище по шитью и моделированию верхней одежды.Вначале сама шила на дому на заказ костюмы.Для начала бизнеса и открытия цеха по пошиву одежды ей помог её муж.И вот теперь когда у неё две ученицы она решила взять кредит для закупа материи  для пошива.Муж её работает в кондитерском цеху,заготовщиком теста для мучных изделий.Для расширения Шахзоде понадобилось 1000 сомони.
texts.en:
Shahzoda is 27 years old, married and has a child. After graduating from a secondary school, she enrolled in a clothing making and design college. At first she was sewing made-to-order suits at home. Then, with the help from her husband, she was able to start her own business and open a clothing making factory. Now that Shahzoda has two apprentices, she decided to obtain a loan for fabric purchase. Her husband works at a bakery, making bread dough. In order to expand her business, Shahzoda needs 1000 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making women's suits

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: S. is 31 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh. She has seven children; one is married and lives separately, three are single and help out with her business, and the other three are students. S. is married to Sokun, 43, who is a fisherman. S. is a morning glory planter, and has been in this business since 1995. She has gained a lot of reliable clients who always buy her products in bulk, and she has earned a good income from that. S. has a lot of lines in the water for the morning glories, and now she wants to increase her income. So, S. is asking for a loan of $150 to rent her neighbor's space for planting her morning glories. S. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To rent her neighbor's space for planting her morning glories

loans.name: Kato Allama Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Kato Allama sont toutes mariées. Avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 5 enfants, elles vivent en majorité dans des  familles traditionnelles polygames dans le village de  Finkolo situé à une cinquantaine de kilomètres de la préfecture de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat - vente de la farine de blé, du sel de cuisine, des tissus et  la restauration. Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle,  elles  ont décidé de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire) 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 7 sacs et ½  de 50 kilogrammes de farine de blé, 25 sacs de sel de cuisine de 25kg, 15 pièces de tissus et des ingrédients pour la restauration.  Elles s’approvisionnent  au marché de Finkolo. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Finkolo et à la maison en détail et au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Kato Allama are all married and average 39 years of age and 5 children. They live for the most part in traditional polygamous families in the village of Finkolo, located about 50 km from Sikasso prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do a diversity of work, such as buying and selling flour, salt, cloth, and they do food catering.

To satisfy their customers, the group members decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their fifth group loan (solidarity loan). The members plan to buy seven and a half 50-kg sacks of flour, twenty-five 25-kg sacks of salt, fifteen lengths of cloth, and some ingredients for preparing meals. Supplies are gotten at the Finkolo marketplace. The merchandise is sold retail there too and also at the house (retail cash sales).

The group members each envision realizing an average profit of 45,000 francs CFA per month. A portion of the profits will be use to meet family needs, and the other portion will be invested in the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various good for commerce and for making meals to sell

loans.name: Purna Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Purna Laxmi K. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Thecho. She opened her grocery store more than five years ago. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, snacks and soon. She opened her grocery store so that she could be independent and she also wanted to help her husband upgrade the living standard of her family. She has one son and two daughters. Her son is studying in grade 9. Her older daughter is studying in grade 12 and younger daughter in grade 11.

With the first loan from Kiva ,Mrs. Purna Devi Mali was able to buy various grocery items such as rice, maize and different kinds of snacks. She has been able to raise her income after investing the loan into her business. Now, she has cleared her loan and is requesting a second loan for Rs 30000.00 to further invest in her shop.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora Alitinde has a business selling charcoal and has applied for this loan to help her expand her business.  Flora is 35 years old and married; her husband is a policeman. They have four children who go to school.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: expand her charcoal business

loans.name: Kansiime Prossy Group

texts.en:
Prossy Kasiime is 25 years old and married with one child. She rents a two-room house with her husband. She has access to piped water and electricity. She also cares for additional family members. Prossy has three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is feeding her family.

Prossy sells charcoal in a market, were she must pay market dues. She works seven days a week and she receives about 20 customers a day. The only challenge she faces in her business is the rainy season, which disrupts her business.

She has worked with MCDT for five years now and chose to work with MCDT because it was easy for her to join. She will use this loan to increase her stock and she hopes to continue expanding on her business to improve on her income.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Purna Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Purna Devi M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in lalitpur district. Thecho is one of the developing areas of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Purna Devi M. lives in single family with her husband and two children. Her husband Mr. Raju M. is a taxi driver and drives his taxi around Kathmandu valley. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 3 and daughter is only a year old.
Mrs. M. is engaged in duck farming. She sells her ducks in the local market. Now she is raising 8 ducks. She buys small ducklings for Rs 60 per duck and sells them after 2-3 months for around Rs 750 per duck. She is satisfied with her duck farming work. With her previous loan from Kiva she bought ducklings, food grain and medicine for the ducks. Now she has cleared her loan and she is requesting a loan for Rs. 20000.00 to buy around 50 ducklings, food grain, and medicine for the ducks. She spends her income on her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings to raise

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les six  femmes du groupe Sabali ont  en moyenne  42 ans,  4 enfants et vivent dans des  foyers polygames à Dougoukolobougou  dans la sous préfecture de NIENA  3ème région administrative du Mali. . 
Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat - vente de riz, de condiments alimentaires, de vêtements, de bois de chauffe et  la restauration.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle elles décidèrent de collaborer  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Elles comptent acheter, 200 kg de riz, 15 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe,des vêtements  pour enfants et des ingrédients pour la sauce. Elles s’approvisionnent  au marché de Niena, Tiefala, Koumatou et Dougoukolobougou.  Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Tienfala de Bougoubala et de Dougoukolobougou  en détail, à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 3500FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie  investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
All of them married, the six members of the group Sabali average 42 years of age and 4 children. They live in polygamous households in Dougoukolobougou in NIENA sub-prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do a diversity of work, such as buying and selling rice, condiments, clothing, firewood, and they do food catering.

To satisfy their customers, the group members decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their tenth solidarity loan (group loan). The members plan to buy 200 kg of rice, 15 cart loads of firewood, some children's clothing, and ingredients for making sauces. Supplies are gotten at the marketplaces of Niena, Tiefala, Koumatou, and Dougoukolobougou. The merchandise is sold retail, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men and women at the marketplaces of Tienfala, Bougoubala, and Dougoukolobougou.

The group members each envision realizing an average profit of 3,500 francs CFA per month. A portion of the profits will be use to meet family needs, and the other portion will be invested in the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en:
Consejo a is 50 year old woman who hails from Budbudan, Hamtic, Antique. She is married and blessed with five children. She is engaged in buying and selling of fish at Dalipe market and her customers are the people of different municipalities of Antique.

Her business started with initial capital of P2,000 she got from a local moneylender. At that time she experienced hardships because of a huge interest she has to pay. This is the reason why she has to close down her business.
 
Whe she joined the ASHI microfinance program, she was able to revive her business.  She is now requesting her fourth loan  of PHP20,000 she can use to purchase different kind of fish direct from the fishpond. The purchase of different kind of fish is a great help in growing her business. She also into  buying and selling of "nipa" (local palm leaves)  hut and “bubo” (a fishing gear used to catch prawns).
 
Her aspiration in life is that her business will become successful and someday she will be called “Mayor Kuprador” -- wholesaler.  She dreams that her children will finish their studies and have stable jobs in the future.

loans.use: Additional working capital for buying and seeling fish

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 34-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ahmad has been working as a house painter for eighteen years. He also does plaster decor. Ahmad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a car for his business. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Ahmad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are engineers and others. Ahmad decided on doing his business because he learned to paint when he was young and he likes it. In the future, he plans to work on bigger projects.

loans.use: Ahmad will use the loan to purchase a car for his business.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en: Elna, 46, is a mother of four children. Her husband works as a part-time mason worker in the nearby construction site in her town. She is operating a small food stall outside the school for more than five years but the income is still insufficient to provide immediate needs of her family.  She  then decided to join HSPFI and received inital loan amounting to PHP5000. Due to increasing demand of the customers and to be more competitive she is in need of a loan now amounting to PHP11000 to purchase additional material/ stocks for her food stall. She is planning also to expand  her food stall to another school where her are enrolled.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials/stocks for her food stall

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Indira

texts.en:
Mrs. Indira P. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Chetrapati, Kathmandu. She opened her grocery store 3 years ago to upgrade the living standard of her family. She mainly sells bags of rice in her grocery store. She also sells maize and different varieties of snacks. Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy different types of grocery items for her shop.

Mrs. Indira P. lives in single family with her husband and three children. She has two daughters and one son. Her older daughter is studying in grade 9 and younger son is studying in pre-primary school. Her son is now studying in grade 9.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Oligario

texts.en: Buying and selling agricultural products (like green bananas, coconut fruits, coconut leaves) is Oligario D.'s source of income.  With his 4 children and a housewife, he feels that he needs to find additional source of income. HSPFI helped him finance his business. Currently, for his 4th loan cycle  he is  planning to open a small variety store for his wife to tend. Through this, he longs to provide better life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to put up a new store

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 50-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Jamal has been working as a taxi driver for eleven years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Jamal has requested a loan.

Jamal decided on his business because he wanted to have independent work and he likes contact with clients. His clients are friends, neighbors, students, employees and others. He decided on doing his business because of his financial situation. In the future, he plans on replacing his car.

loans.use: Jamal will use the loan to do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en: Kimberly C., 22, single mom of Krizaiah Jen C., ekes out a living by tending a sari sari (variety) store in Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City Southern Philippines. Her mother helped her finance the store. She also is engaged in dried fish retailing once every two weeks. With the help of the loan from HSPFI amounting to PHP14,000  she will be able to expand and put up another store at Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She only wants to give all the care, shelter and good future for her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for the store

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida P. helps her husband, a jeepney driver, in sustaining the daily needs of their four children. They own variety store and small rice field  which provide additional income so thay they can cope with the family's expenses. HSPFI assisted her business since the start of its operations.To meet the demands of her customers she plans to expand their variety store by adding more goods for sale like beverages, rice and dairy products. A portion of her loan will be used to maintain their small rice field. She needs a loan amounting to PHP 17,000 to realize her plans.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her store and to maintain her rice field

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Dijbar

texts.ru: Женщина которая уже кредитуется третий год,и пунктуально погашает свои погашения.Она каждый кредит использует целенаправлено для расширения своего бизнеса.Она торгует в престижном магазине г.Худжанда, женской одеждой.Товар привозит с Бишкека и с Турции.Кредиты ей помогли увеличить оборотный капитал и улучшить жизнь семьи.Следующий займ она хочет использовать для закупа весеннего ассортимента.
texts.en:
Dijbar is a woman who has been receiving and repaying her loans for the last three years. She uses each loan strictly for expanding her business. She has a retail outlet at a prestigious shopping center in Khujand and sells women’s clothing. The goods are brought from Bishkek and Turkey. The loans helped her to increase profits and improve her family’s living. Dijbar wants to use this loan to purchase spring goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Women's clothing

loans.name: Mulondo Milly Group

texts.en:
Milly is 34 years of age. She is a single mother of four and she rents a one-room house, where she stays with her children. She does have access to piped water and electricity. She also cares for additional family members. She has three meals a day and her greatest expanse in a month is paying tuition for her children.

Milly sells second-hand clothes in the market. She must pay market dues to be allowed to operate her business there. She receives about 10 customers a day and they are both men and women. She has done this particular business for 8 years now and the main challenge she faces is the rainy season, which disrupts her business.

She has worked with MCDT for 4 years now and chose to work with MCDT because it was easy for her to join and also near her home. She will use this loan to increase her stock and she also hopes to continue expanding on her business to improve on her income.

loans.use: To incresae her stock of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en:
Elizerbeth K. is currently in the business of selling onions and has applied for a loan in order to expand her business.  Elizerbeth is 32 years old and married; her husband is a security guard. They have two children who go to school. Elizerbeth With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To pay school fees for two children

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
Bhagabati S. lives in Chetrapati, Kathmandu. Chetrapati is one of the busy city of Kathmandu and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. Mrs. Bhagabati Shresth lives with her mother-in-law, husband, one son and one daughter. Her husband, Mr. Prachandra Bahadhur S., works in a government office. Both her son and daughter are studying as well as working.

Mrs. Bhagabati S. opened her photo studio and watch shop more than five years ago. She has employed two workers for her shop, where she has been selling different brand of watches. She opened her shop to upgrade the living standard of her family. In addition, she wants to be independent and she doesn’t like to ask money from her husband. Now she is requesting for Rs 20,000 loan to buy different varieties and brands of watches.

loans.use: To buy watches

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées avec en moyenne  40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à Dougoukolobougou dans la commune rurale de NIENA en 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat - vente du riz, des condiments et de l’igname. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle  elles ont décidé de  collaborer  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et  sont à leur dixième prêt  de groupe (prêt solidaire). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent acheter,  400 kg de riz, 1500 tubercules d’igname et  une importante quantité  de condiments. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Niena, Tiefala, Koumatou, Tdjila et Dougoukolobougou 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Tièfala, de Tdjila, de Tièkounko, de Niena et de Dougoukolobougou  en détail, à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 7500FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie  investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Benkadi are all married and average 40 years of age and 5 children. They live in polygamous families in Dougoukolobougou in the rural community of NIENA in the third administrative region, Republic of Mali. They do a diversity of work, such as buying and selling rice, condiments, and yams.

To satisfy their customers, the group members decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their tenth group loan (solidarity loan). The members plan to buy 400 kg of rice, 1,500 of yam tubers, and a sizable quantity of condiments. Supplies are gotten at the marketplaces of Niena, Tiefala, Koumatou, Tdjila, and Dougoukolobougou. The merchandise is sold retail, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men and women at the marketplaces of Tièfala, Tdjila, Tièkounko, Niena, and Dougoukolobougou.

The group members each envision realizing an average profit of 7,500 francs CFA per month. A portion of the profits will be use to meet family needs, and the other portion will be invested in the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru: Шаходат женщина 36 лет , замужем имеет пятерых детей.Она уже много лет занимается продажей женских платьев, которые её поставляют швеи из городских ателье.Шаходат выходит торговать каждый день на рынок Худжанда.У неё очень большой и разнообразный ассортимент.В весенний сезон Шаходат хочет получив займ закупить ещё платья.Муж работает в магезине кассиром.Все дети учатся в средней школе.
texts.en:
Shahodat S. is thirty-six years old, married and has five children. She has been selling dresses for many years. Every day, Shahodat sells at Khudzhand local market. She has a large assortment of dresses. This loan Shahodat will use to purchase spring dresses. Her husband is a cashier at a store. All of Shahodat's children attend secondary school.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of national dresses for women

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en:
Jenty J. sells tomatoes at the market and has applied for this loan in order to expand her business.  Jenty is 50 years old and married; her husband is a security guard. They have one child who goes to school. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: expand her business selling tomatoes

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru: Махфират клиентка Микроинвест уже шестой год.Она пунктуально сотрудничает с Микроинвестом.Махфират торгует женской обувью.Каждый свой займ она использует для закупа сезонного товара.По бизнесу ей помогает её старшая дочь.Со дня начала кредитования оборотный капитал Махфират увеличился  во много раз.Следующий займ она планирует потратить для закупа весенних туфлей.
texts.en:
Mahfirat J. has been a Microinvest client for six years. She has been diligently paying off her loans. Mahfirat sells shoes for women. Every Microinvest loan Mahfirat J. takes, she uses to purchase seasonal goods. Her older sister assists Mahfirat in business. Since becoming a Microinvest client, Mahfirat has increased her working capital many times over. This loan Mahfirat will use to purchase a spring collection of shoes.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoes for women

loans.name: Soliha

texts.en:
K. Soliha first applied to MicroInvest in 2002 and she recommended herself as a serious and reliable client. Soliha lives in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married with 4 children. Soliha has started the business from scratch and, thanks to previous loans, she improved the business turnover in women's wear and shoes. She also trades fancy goods and women's accessories. She has been engaged in business for 10 years.

Soliha works with direct suppliers so she trades at low prices and has repeat customers. Solha is applying to KIVA with a request for a business support loan of 4100 STJ for 4 months to import new seasonal goods.

loans.use: To import new seasonal good.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. sells bananas at the market and has applied for a loan to help her expand her business.  Mary is 20 years old and married; her husband is a security guard. They have two children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To educate her two children

loans.name: Kibalama Gorreti Group

texts.en:
Gorreti K. is 50 years of age and married with six children. She rents a four-room house together with her family. She also cares for additional family members. Gorreti has three meals a day and her greatest expense is school tuition for her children.

She is a tailor in a shop that she rents in town. She works seven a days a week and she normally receives about two customers a day. Most of her customers are women. She has done this work for over 12 years now. The challenge she faces in her business is that her customers come seasonally, mainly during festive seasons.

Gorreti has worked MCDT for five years now and chose MCDT because it was lending money to the poor. She hopes to use the loan to buy materials for sale and she also wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for sale.

loans.name: Kenja

texts.ru: Кенча мужчина в возрасте 44 лет , женат имеет троих детей.Сам Кенча мастер по кладке дорожных плиток и мрамора.Жена работает в МЧС специалистом.У Кенчи большой дом , который требует ремонта,но у Кенчи не хватка финансов.Сосед друг Кенчи давнишний клиент в Микроинвесте посоветовал взять потребительский кредит.Для чего и обратился Кенча.
texts.en:
Kenja T. is forty-four years old, married and has three children. Kenja is a master tiler. His wife works at the Ministry of Emergency Management. Kenja needs this loan to finance a renovation of his big house. Kenja turned to Microinvest for help on recommendation of his neighbor, an old Microinvest client.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home renovation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Kobusingye Cissy Group

texts.en:
Cissy K. is 30 years of age and married with three children who are between the ages of 9 and 13. She rents the place in which she resides with her family. They have three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is feeding the family.

Cissy is a shop attendant and this is how she earns her living. She works seven days a week and she normally receives 20 customers a day. She has been doing this for over three years now and prior to this she was selling used clothes. The challenge she meets is that every morning she has to spend money on transport. On days she doesn’t have transport money, she must walk to her workplace, which is about three miles away from her home.

She has worked with MCDT for five years now and chose to work with MCDT because she finds it easy to understand the way they operate. She will use this loan to pay school fees for her children and also use some of it to pay for rent. She also wants to start up her own business.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees and the rent for her house.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice Kwaje has a business selling groundnut paste and has applied for a loan in order to expand her business.  Rejoice is 30 years old and married; her husband is a policeman. They have four children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send the children to school.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To send the children to school

loans.name: Ilyosjon

texts.ru: Мусобеков Илёс   1973 года рождения женат, имеет 5 детей. Он работает уже несколько лет охранником в городской академии, как охрана он должен оставаться сутками на работе. Дома содержит 5-6 коров, он откармливает, а после откорма и перепродает скот. Когда он на работе, за скотом ухаживают его мать и жена. У него большой коровник, но половина поголовье скота он отправляет с  пастухом на пастбище. Так как в зимнее время запас истощался,  и нечем кормить коров, остаются только кормящие самки и молодые бычки. Ему необходим кредит для покупки  несколько коров и корм для скота.
texts.en:
Ilyosjon M. was born in 1973. He is married and has 5 children. For several years, Ilyosjon has been working as a security guard. In addition, Ilyosjon has a small cattle farm at home with 5-6 cows. He raises the cattle and then sells it at a profit. While Ilyosjon is at his job, his wife takes care of the cattle. Due to a lack of animal food during winter, Ilyosjon had to reduce the number of animals in his farm leaving only milking cows and young bulls. He will use this loan to purchase a few cows and food to feed them.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.en:
K. Hoshim is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young, Ashur has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Hoshim harbors in his heart is to increase his capital to invest in acquiring more animals so that he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children, who always support him unconditionally in his daily work. Hoshim requests $800 USD for a term of 12 months. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Vahob

texts.ru: Дехконов Вахоб  студент учиться на 3 курсе в экономическом факультете, ему 21 лет, еще не женат, живет с матерью  и  средним братом, старший брат живет в России и время от времени присылает деньги. Мать работает учительницей, отца нету. Он помогает матери, ухаживает за скотом и после откорма выводит на рынок на продажу коров. Братья присылают деньги на обучение, и на проживание. Он также ездил раньше в Россию, но мать отозвала его и больше не пустила , он решился заняться откормом скота, от этого бизнеса тоже есть хорошая прибыль. Он часто ездит в город на учебу и узнал об Микринвесте и о выгодном кредите, обратился и получил кредит, он также благодарен КИВА и Микроинвест за помощь.
texts.en:
Vahob D., 21, is a 3rd-year college student majoring in economics. He is not yet married and lives with his mother and a brother. Vahob's older brother is working in Russia and from time to time sends money to support his family. Vahob's mother is a school teacher. She has no husband. Before his mother forbade him, Vahob used to join his brothers on their money earning trips to Russia. Now, he raises cattle--a business that brings a decent profit. In the city where he goes to school, Vahob learned of the opportunity to apply for a KIVA loan. He will use the money to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход Абдижалилов 1978 года рождения, женат имеет 4 детей. Восемь лет назад он начал  перепродавать скот на рынке, раньше этим бизнесом занимался его отец, потом передал Фарходу, так как он женился, надо было прокармливать семью. Кроме этого он  водитель - дальнего рейса, он возит в своей грузовой машине камни и другие тяжелые грузы. Потому что от откорма и продажи скота бывает доход только через 3 месяца, а в остальное время одни расходы. Он получил кредит  в Микронвест от КИВА и прикупил 2 коровы и корм .
texts.en:
Farhod A. was born in 1978. He is married and has 4 children. Eight years ago, after getting married, Farhod took over his father's business of selling cattle. In addition, Farhod is a truck driver. To earn a living, Farhod transports stones and other heavy cargo over long distances, because cattle farming is only profitable 3 months a year. This loan Farhod will use to purchase 2 cows and food for them.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia M. sells biscuits wholesale at a shop and is requesting a loan to help her expand her business.  Lucia is 40 years old and married; her husband is a policeman. She has four children who go to school. 


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To expand her biscuit business

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is a woman with five children. Her husband is a teacher at a local school. Since he earns little, she started her own business of cattle breeding. Since she had previous experience working on a farm, her business has gone well. Today she has 2 cows and 2 sheep. She also has enough hay and forage. In fact, she calculates that she has enough  fodder for more cattle, so she decided to take a loan and purchase more cattle. Mavjuda is counting on your help.

loans.use: Purchasing more cattle

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes L. sells beer and has requested a loan in order to expand her business.  Agnes is 29 years old and married; her husband is a driver. She has 3 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build houses for rent.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To build houses for rent

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
S. Shuhrat is 37 years old. He and his wife have one son, who is 6 years old. Shuhrat sells DVDs and CDs. He orders the delivery of the disks from the neighboring city of Khujand and tries to have all the new movies and concerts of the popular actors, singers, and others. He also provides computer services, such as audio editing of video tapes and discs with recordings of his clients' family events. Shuhrat tries to use modern, up-to-date technologies in his work so that he can satisfy the demands and requirements of the customers. 

Shurhrat's business is successful generating the main income for his family. Today Shuhrat requests $800 US for a term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase a lot of DVDs and CDs to sell. Shuhrat thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to be accurate in his loan payment.

loans.use: To purchase DVDs and CDs to sell

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice N. is currently in the business of selling clothes at a shop and has applied for a loan to help her expand her business.  Joice is 26 years old and married; her husband is a soldier. She has two children who do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorcycle.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Radjabali

texts.ru: Раджабали Ассаров 1959 года рождения  женат имеет 6 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Более 6 лет он продает диски и расширяет свой ассортимент. Его старший сын также участвует в бизнесе , но он продает кайсу (сушенный абрикос). Раджабали работает также  в киностудии Б. Гафурова, он оставляет кого либо из семьи  на продаже дисков а сам идет на работу, так он совмещает работу и бизнес. Кредит получает почти год, планирует получать в дальнейшем  кредит и расширять свой магазин, и помогать сыну в продажи кайсы.
texts.en:
Born in 1959, Radjabali A. is married and has 6 children. His wife is a homemaker. Radjabali has been selling music and video disks and expanding his assortment for well over six years. His oldest son is also an entrepreneur and sells kaisa (dried apricot). Radjabali also works at the B. Gafurov film studio. He leaves one of his family members to watch over the business while he is at work, and this is how he juggles work and business. He has been receiving loans for almost a year and plans to use this loan to expand his business and to help his son with kaisa sales.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en:
For the past four years, Nuriddin has worked in agriculture, raising animals. He raises cattle, which he cares for greatly since thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses. Nuriddin showed us his animals with great happiness as his cattle were about to be vaccinated against the various sicknesses that affect that type of livestock.

For Nuriddin, it is very important to work raising his animals, so he is seeking a loan in order to purchase additional cattle so that in the future he can earn more money. That will help his family to generate additional income. We appreciate your support for Nuriddin’s project.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Sanabar

texts.en:
T. Sanabar is 46 years old. She works purchasing and reselling cows with her children. She has five children.

Sanabar would like to request a loan of $1000 USD for a term of 12 months in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase her income further. She plans to use the increased income to fund her children’s education. You could become an important part in Sanabar family's life, and she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is one of the poorer of the 15 former Soviet republics, with a GDP per capita of less than $600. The civil war, which took place soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., severely damaged the already weak economic infrastructure and caused a sharp decline in agricultural production and the manufacturing sector. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. All of these factors have resulted in a severe lack of jobs and have forced hundreds of thousands to leave Tajikistan to find work in other countries, mostly in Russia. While Tajikistan has experienced some economic growth since the end of the Civil War, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON International's mission is to promote sustainable economic development and improved quality of life in Tajikistan by insuring reliable access to financial services for the economically active members of the population. IMON International has 8 branch offices throughout Tajikistan, and its entrepreneurs work in many parts of the country's economic sector, including trade, manufacturing, agriculture, and services. As of October 2008, IMON International had 27,802 active clients and a total portfolio of $28,405,549. Approximately 44% of these clients are women and 65% are from rural areas. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase the cattle to expand her business.

loans.name: Ruziniso

texts.en:
Ruziniso Y., 46, has raised two children with her husband, and for 15 years has worked in the city’s largest local market selling rice, wheat and vegetables subject to the season. The business is very stable and generates the main income for the family as her husband is retired on a pension. Ruziniso has been working with IMON for three years and has proven to be a reliable client. Today she is requesting $900 for the term of 12 months in order to purchase wheat and rice to sell. Ruziniso thanks all for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, including being a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase wheat and rice to sell.

loans.name: Jiet Kevin Group

texts.en:
Kevin is 35 years old and married with four children. She rents a four-room house, where she stays with her family. She also takes care of additional family members. Kevin has three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is feeding the family and paying rent.

She sells food stuff in the market, where she must pay market dues. She works seven days a week and she normally receives about 20 customers a day. The main challenge she finds while carrying out her business is the rainy season. She uses an umbrella during the rains, but still the number of her customers and her subsequent income is much reduced throughout the season.

Kevin has worked with MCDT for three years now and she has so far received eight loans. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock. She also looks forward to expanding her business to improve her income.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Subita

texts.en:
Mrs. Subita L. lives in Chetrapati. Chetrapati is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small businesses like grocery stores, small hotels, and stationery stores.

Mrs. L. lives with her husband and two children. Her husband works in a government office. She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 4 and her son is in grade 3.

Mrs. Subita L. is engaged in her own small restaurant. She opened her restaurant 3 years ago. She sells different types of food items in her shop, especially she sells Nepali food. She also serves tea and coffee. Now Mrs. L. is requesting Rs 10,000 loan to purchase necessary food ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her work

loans.name: Khaled
