texts.en: Khaled is a 43-year-old married man with four children, living in Old Saida, southern Lebanon. He has owned a shop where he manufactures and repairs furniture since 2004. Khaled has 25 years of experience in this industry, and today he is asking for $1,000 in order to buy a sewing machine to increase his profit margin.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita G. lives in a single family with her husband Mr. Kamal Bahadur Tamang and two daughters. She lives in Chetrapati, Kathmandu. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses such as grocery stores. Her husband works in a private office. Her older daughter is studying in grade 3 and her younger daughter is in grade 1.

Mrs. G. opened her small food shop 2 years ago to strengthen the economic condition of her family. She sells different verities of food items in her shop. She prepares Nepali food such as DalBhat (rice) and also sells tea and coffee. Her food shop is small but very popular in her locality. Mrs. G. is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy necessary food supplies for her shop.

loans.use: To buy food supplies for her shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: This is Maria G. and she is 67 years old. She lives in Cantemir district, Baimaclia in a village where the main occupation of the villagers is wine production, and for this they grow grapes. The grapes she produces are sold at the wholesale market in the district, but at this time she cannot sell grapes because she needs to buy tree vines to plant for the coming years. She decided to take out a loan from MicroInvest to increase her working capital for 2009. Maria has been in the business for 10 years so she knows her job very well.  Maria wants to thank Kiva lenders for their understanding and desire to help.

loans.use: To buy tree vines for growing grapes

loans.name: Roudayna

texts.en: Roudayna is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, living in Rachaya in the Bekaa valley. She used to sell accessories at home, and five years ago she opened her own shop. Today, Roudayna is asking for $1,200 in order to increase her inventory and her profit.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She sells plastics. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more plastics to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil is a 38-year-old married man with two children; he lives in Zahleh in the Bekaa valley. He inherited a gas station from his father three years ago. Kamil wants to borrow $1,000 in order to increase his gasoline inventory, especially since the demand for it  is very high in winter.

loans.use: increase gasoline inventory

loans.name: Yamuna

texts.en:
Yamuna S. lives in Chetrapati, Kathmandu. She lives in single family with her husband and three children. Her husband Mr. Dipak lal S. works in a government office. She has two sons and one daughter. All her children are now studying.

Mrs. Yamuna S. has a business and operates her own bag shop. She opened her bag shop a year ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells ladies bags and school bags at her shop. These days, she is facing heavy competition in her business. So to stay competitive she must be able to provide the latest fashion bags. She is requesting a loan for Rs 10000.00 to buy a verity of new fashionable bags to meet her competition.

loans.use: To buys fashion bags for resale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 42-year-old construction worker, living in Shakra, southern Lebanon. Mohammad already took several micro-loans from Ameen to improve and expand his work. Today, he is requesting US$ 1,200 in order to buy wood for his newest project.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipa B. is 42 year old and lives in Chetrapati, Kathmandu, Nepal. Chetrapati is a busy city in Kathmandu and most of the people of this region are engaged in small business. Mrs. B. has two sons and one daughter. All of her children attend school.

Mrs. B. opened a grocery shop 10 years ago. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulse, biscuits, and noodles, in her shop. Her sons also help her with her work. The demand for grocery goods is increasing in her area, so she is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy grocery items to meet the demand.  
She spends the major part of her income providing better education for her children.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Fisoye

texts.en: Fisoye O. is 28 years old and he is single. He sells fish. He is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more fish to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Nasri

texts.en: Nasri is a 51-year-old married man with two children, living in Houla, southern Lebanon. He has owned a tow truck for 9 years, servicing the surrounding villages of Houla. Today, he is requesting US$ 1,200 in order to perform maintenance on his tow truck for better safety.

loans.use: Perform maintenance on the tow truck

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en: Tawa is 32 years old and married with a child. She sells hair materials and clothes. She is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more clothes to sell. She wishes to express her thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra, 45, resides in Adloun, southern Lebanon, where she owns a shop selling clothes and accessories. There is also a hairdressing corner in the facility. Zahra is requesting $1,000 in order to buy more clothes and accessories to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina K., who opened her cosmetics shop a year ago to improve her family’s standard of living, sells a variety of goods including cream, make-up materials, and glass bangles. She spends her income to help her husband, Raghu Raj Kayastha, a government worker, meet the family’s expenses, and is now requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy additional cosmetic goods for her shop.

The mother of two children, a son and daughter, Mina lives in a single family home with her husband and two children. Her daughter is taking the BSC (Nursing) course and her son is studying in grade 12. Both also help her in her shop.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija, a 45-year-old married woman with three children, lives in Marwanieh, southern Lebanon, where she has owned  a shop selling home appliances since 2006. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to buy more home appliances at a very good price.

loans.use: To buy home appliances for her business.

loans.name: Kulabako Faridah Group

texts.en:
N. is 27 years old and married with 4 children. She rents a one-room house and four people live in it. She has access to piped water and electricity. She does not have additional family to look after.

She normally has four meals a day. Her greatest expenditure is food, because all the food they eat at home is purchased.

N. runs a salon / cosmetics shop which is located in the market centre. She works 5 days a week, and her only expense is market dues for her business.

She mainly receives women customers to her salon. She has done this business for over six years now, although previously she had tried to sell piped water to her neighbours. The only problem she sometimes faces in her business is the potential for losses, although it is not common occurrence.

She has been with MCDT for five years now, and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because she wanted to start a business. She is going to use this loan to increase her business.

loans.use: Buy beauty oils

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 50-year-old married man with three children, living in Al Abassieh in southern Lebanon. He has owned a minibus taxi since 1992, and he services Tyr and the surrounding area. After benefitting from several micro loans from Ameen, today Abdallah is requesting $1,200 to perform maintenance on his minibus.

loans.use: Perform maintenance on his minibus

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu W. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Idowu sells bags of onions. He is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bags of onions to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 44-year-old married man with six children, living in Old Saida in southern Lebanon. He has worked as a floor tile polisher since he was 15 years old. When he was young, he used to work with his father, who taught him this profession. Today, Mahmoud is requesting $700 to buy new tools and perform maintenance on the floor tile polisher machine.

loans.use: Buy new tools and perform maintenance on the floor tile polisher machine

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en: Haitham is a 31-year-old married man with two young children, living in Ouzai in Beirut suburbs. He used to work in a linen shop since 1999, and opened his first shop in 2002. Today, Haitham is requesting $1,000 in order to improve the shop's decoration.

loans.use: Improve the shop's decoration

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo Akinnade is a 48-year-old married woman with five children.  To earn a living and to support her family, she sells crates of eggs. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $700 (100,000 NGN) to purchase more crates of eggs for resale purposes.  She thanks Kiva and all its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional crates of eggs

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 46-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Ali has been working as a carpenter since 2000. He makes doors, bedroom furniture, and other things. Ali has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. Ali is special because of his good work and his honesty. His clients are the people from his region. When he first started his business, he faced a lack of cash. Ali decided on this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business in order to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Mahmoud has owned a furniture shop for seven years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase new furniture for his shop. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud is speciA. in his work because he sells nice furniture. His clients are his friends and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up capitA.. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to help his brother who has a difficult financiA. situation. In the future, he plans on starting a new business.

loans.use: Mahmoud will use the loan to purchase new furniture for his shop.

loans.name: Jamiu

texts.en: Jamiu O. is a 35-year-old married man with three children.  To support his family, he sells electronics.  He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more electronics for resale purposes.  He thanks Kiva and all its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional electronics

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 52-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Zeinab has owned a grocery store for fourteen years. She also sells bread and gas cylinders. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. Zeinab has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time.

Thanks to her previous loans, Zeinab was able to expand her business and diversify her merchandise. Zeinab is special in her business because she has a good reputation and she is open until late in the evening. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the start-up capital. In the future, she plans on expanding and improving her business.

loans.use: Zeinab will use tha loan to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Perju

texts.en: Perju S. is 40 years old and he has lived in Cahul town for 20 years. All his life he has wanted to build his own house with 2 floors where he will be able to have a piece of land in order to grow vegetables and fruits and to feel better and more free. He decided to start building the house in order to finishit  in the next 2 years. For this he needs to buy construction materials, namely cement, bricks, wood, and sand so he applied for a loan from MicroInvest. It is not much money but it is enough to start construction.

loans.use: To start construction of a house

loans.name: Nakate Alisha Group

texts.en:
Alisha is 37 years of age and married with four children. She rents a one-room house in which six people live. She does care for additional family as well. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is that of feeding her family.

She sells used shoes in the market and she works six days in a week. She normally receives about ten customers a day. She has been doing this particular type of business for eight years now. The challenge she faces is that her customers are seasonal. She mainly makes big sales during festive seasons.

She has been a member of MCDT for over five years now and chose to work with MCDT because it was easy for her to join. Most of all she wanted some capital to increase her stock and that is how she will use this loan. She also wants to construct rental apartments to improve on her income and wellbeing.

loans.use: To increase her stock of shoes.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, a 33-year-old married man with three children, lives in Al Kafaat, a suburb of Beirut, where he has owned a shoe repair shop for five years, having learned the profession from his father. Today, Ali is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to buy new tools and used shoes at a good price.

loans.use: To buy new tools and used shoes for his business.

loans.name: Hezekiah

texts.en: Hezekiah O. is a 40-year-old married man with three children.  To support his family, he sells bags of dry corn to the people in his community; in turn, those individuals use the dry corn to prepare "pap", popularly known as "akamu" in Nigeria.  He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $700 (100,000 NGN) to purchase more bags of dry corn for resale purposes. He thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional bags of corn

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 30-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their child. Amin has owned a restaurant for two years. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her restaurant. This is the first time that Amina has requested a loan.

Amina is special because she knows how to treat her clients. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the start-up capital. She decided on doing her business because she always wanted to open a restaurant and she always wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: Amina will use the loan purchase merchandise for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Ali has owned a coffee shop. He sells all kind of coffee, teas and Nescafe. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new coffee machine and raw ingredients. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali is special because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody, but mostly his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up capital. In the future, he plans to purchase an ice cream fridge.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase a new coffee machine and raw materials.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih, a 22-year-old single man living in Aley in Mount Lebanon, works as a DJ and sells sound equipment and CDs. It is his first micro loan request from Ameen, and he is seeking to borrow $1,200 to buy sound equipment in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 22-year-old man who lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon. Ali owns a barber shop. He also sells beauty products. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products for his salon. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. Ali is special because he does nice haircuts and is aware of fashion. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He decided on his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for his salon

loans.name: Oyeyiola

texts.en: Oyeyiola O. is a 58-year-old married man with four children.  He rents a plot of land where he makes bricks; subsequently, he sells the bricks to builders in order to generate profits.  He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $700 (100,000 NGN) to purchase more raw materials to make more bricks and to thereby generate an increase in sales.  He thanks Kiva and all its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional raw materials used to make bricks

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en: Sawsan, a 22-year-old single woman living in Aley in Mount Lebanon, opened a perfume and accessories shop four years ago. Sawsan's business is growing constantly, so she is requesting a loan of $1,200 ito increase her inventory and  renew her shop's decor.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and  renew her shop's deco.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 30-year-old man who lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Jamal is a van taxi driver. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to register the license plate of his van. This is the first time that Jamal has requested a loan. Jamal's clients may be anyone. He decided on his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on purchasing another van.

loans.use: To register the license plate of his van.

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.en:
Anatolyi is married with a toddler son. His family lives in the small town of Veliky Luchki. He owns a bakery. His business has been running for 6 years. Demand for bread has always been high, which is why Anatoly’s business has flourished. Presently, he has about 40,000 UAH in working capital. His profit amounts to 5,000 UAH.  

Anatolyi has requested a loan of 8,000 UAH to purchase ingredients for his bakery. The ability to buy more inventory at low prices will give him the opportunity to increase his profits and continue developing a successful enterprise while improving his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with three grown children. They live in Mukachevo. Valentina sells clothing items in one of the local markets at the bus station. She launched this venture 2 years ago. Her working capital amounts to 20,000 UAH. Net profit is about 3,000 UAH. 

Valentina is well-known for her integrity. Today, as high inflation rates are affecting businesses in the Ukraine, she is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her plans for the future is to continue expanding her business. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Valentina reach all her aspirations.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.en:
Zinaida lives in Mukachevo. She owns a small business selling household supplies in one of the local markets in her home town. Zinaida offers a very large assortment of inventory and her price range is also quite diverse. Loans that she previously received from Nadiya Ukraine promoted the growth of her business. Zinaida has been in the trade for 3 years. Currently, she has about 50,000 UAH in inventory. Her monthly income is about 3,000 UAH. 

Zinaida’s business is the only source of income for her family. Today she would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to buy a variety of retail items wholesale. We believe Zinaida’s focused approach to business and her diligent hard work will help her repay this loan on time and expand her business as a result.

loans.use: To purchase items for resale

loans.name: Dragomiretchi

texts.en:
This is Dragomiretchi G., he is 37 years old and he lives in the village of Tibirica, Calarasi district. His business is raising pigs, including breeding animals. The location of his business is also in the Calarasi district, and he has been in business for 5 years. When he launched his business, it was not at first successful because it did not have enough capital to progress, but he found success when he took a loan from Microinvest. His business started to grow and now he has decided to request a loan to increase the number of pigs he has. 

His previous loan was repaid without any late payments and now MicroInvest has total confidence in this customer.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

loans.name: Valeriy

texts.en:
Valeriy has two businesses. During the day he sells chewing gum. He distributes it among the stores and kiosks in the city of Ivano-Frankovsk. In the evening he offers taxi services in the city as well as between cities. He uses his car in both business and depends on it a lot. His business goal is to purchase a newer, more reliable car.

Valeriy would like to get a loan of 7,500 UAH to purchase chewing gum. This would enable him to open several more locations for selling gum and to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase chewing gum

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila, a 35-year-old married woman with three children, lives in Haret Hreik, a suburb of Beirut. Four years ago she started working as a home-based hairdresser to help her husband in the family expenses. Today, she is requesting a loan of $800 to buy new equipment in order to increase her client base.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for her business.

loans.name: Jebran

texts.en: Jebran, a 48-year-old married man with three children, lives in Forn Al Chebak in Beirut, where he started a car repair shop 29 years ago. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy new tools and equipment for his shop.

loans.use: To buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Ramota

texts.en: Ramota is a 45-year-old married woman with four children.  To support her family, she sells medicine--in both wholesale and retail to her customers.  However, she hopes to expand this business, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) in order to purchase more medicine for resale purposes.  She thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for making this loan possible.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional medicine

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing K. is a 40-year-old married woman with five children.  To support her family, she sells bags of charcoal to her customers (in wholesale and retail quantities).  She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) in order to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale purposes.  She thanks Kiva and all its lenders for making this loan possible.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional bags of charcoal

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is divorced with one daughter. She sells women's clothing at several locations. She started her business 13 years ago. At that time there were few people with similar goods. Today Galina understands that having several locations is a real advantage over her competitors. Galina is very entrepreneurial and a hard-working person. Recently, she started new business - selling small home equipment. She is thinking about developing it further, provided sales are good.

Galina would like to receive a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase her inventories. Her business is the only source of income for Galina and her daughter.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Ella es nuestra socia MARLENE HUAMÁN MARCOTA; nació en la comunidad de Urquillos de la provincia de Calca, del departamento de Cusco; ella tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 02 menores hijos de 5 y 3 años; ella comparte sus responsabilidades del hogar con diversas actividades, para poder darles a sus menores hijos una adecuada alimentación y una buena educación. 

Ella tiene como actividad principal la agricultura  y el comercio de animales menores; cultiva sus tierras con diversas variedades de verduras, entre las que tenemos(culantro, asnapa, perejil, repollo, coliflor, calabazas, maíz) y frutas (membrillo, peras y palta); Ella también cría animales menores, (cuyes, pollos, patos) hasta alcanzar la madures y la procreación de los mismos, para una posterior venta.

Ella agradece a los prestamistas, la ayuda otorgada y reitera su compromiso con ustedes, para seguir trabajando día a día y devolver el préstamo otorgado en el plazo determinado, ya que ella reconoce la falta de apoyo en estas zonas de otras bancas financieras.
texts.en:
Our member, Marlene Huamán Marcota, was born in Urquillos, in the Calca province of the department of Cusco. She is a 26-year-old, single mother of two children, ages 5 and 3 years old. She maintains her household responsibilities in a variety of ways so she can give her children enough nutrition and a good education. She mostly dedicates her time to agriculture and to the sale of young animals. She cultivates various types of fruits (quince, pears, and avocado) and vegetables (coriander, asnapa (an herb), parsley, cabbage, cauliflower, pumpkins, and corn) on her lands. She also raises young animals (guinea pigs, chickens, and ducks) until they reach maturity and can reproduce to then be sold at a later date. She is thankful for the loans and help offered, and reiterates her commitment to you to keep working day after day to pay back the loan in full since she recognizes the lack of this type of support from other local financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes para los terrenos y compra de animales menores.

loans.name: Raman

texts.en: Raman O. is a 40-year-old married man with three children.  To support his family, he sells motor spare parts.  He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) in order to purchase more motor spare parts for resale purposes.  He thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional motor spare parts

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en: Adijat A. is a 50-year-old married woman with four children.  To support her family, she sells drinks.  She is hoping to expand her business, so she is now requesting a loan in the amount of $700 (100,000 NGN) in order to purchase more drinks for resale purposes.  She thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional drinks

loans.name: Cerafina

texts.es:
La señora CEFERINA C. Q., es nuestra socia,  tiene 53 años de edad, ella nació en la comunidad de Urquillos de la provincia de Calca, del departamento de Cusco; es madre soltera de 6 hijos; ella comparte sus obligaciones del hogar con diversas actividades, para poder darles a sus menores hijos una adecuada educación y calidad de vida. 

Ella tiene entre sus actividades principales la agricultura  de verduras en pequeñas parcelas de terreno y el comercio de animales menores; cultiva sus tierras algunas principales verduras de uso común en toda la región para elaborar los diferentes platos, cultiva, perejil. culantro, orégano, repollo, esto está destinado a la venta dominical en los poblados alejados a su comunidad; ella tiene el apoyo de su hija mayor para la venta de estas verduras; pero ella destina la mayor parte de su tiempo a la crianza de animales menores tales como son :(cuyes, pollos, gallinas, gallos y  patos), los hace procrear y luego los vende en el mercado local y muchas veces para ganar un poco más los lleva a otros poblados y al mismo Cusco.

Esta socia está muy agradecida con el apoyo que se le brinda y se compromete a la pronta devolución del préstamo.
texts.en:
Ms. Ceferina C. Q., is one of our members. She is 53 years old and was born in Urquillos, in the Calca province of the department of Cusco. She is a single mother of 6 children who manages her household responsibilities by working in several different areas so she can provide her young children with adequate education and good life. She spends most of her time cultivating vegetables on small plots of land and selling small animals. She cultivates some vegetables that are commonly used as staples in the region. To create a variety of different dishes, she grows parsley, cilantro, oregano, and cabbage which she sells on Sundays in remote towns. She relies on the support of her eldest daughter to sell the vegetables because she spends most of her time raising small animals like guinea pigs, chickens, hens, roosters, and ducks. She breeds them and then sells them at the local market. In order to earn a bit more, she often takes them to other villages and even to Cusco. This member is very grateful for the support offered her and promises to quickly repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar  animales menores para la crianza y posterior venta de los mismos.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is divorced with one child. She sells clothing and shoes at Drogobych market. She has been in this business for 4 years. Irina would like to open a second business location in a small neighboring city to increase her sales. This would help her deal with the current situation in the Ukrainian economy. Irina would like to get a loan of 1,500 UAH to increase her inventory. Irina is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person and believes she can overcome all business and personal life difficulties!

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Funmilola

texts.en: Funmilola A. is a 40-year-old married woman with four children.  To support her family, she sells kerosene.  She is hoping to expand her business, so she is now requesting a loan in the amount of $700 (100,000 NGN) in order to purchase more kerosene for resale purposes.  She thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional kerosene

loans.name: Serafima

texts.en: Serafima B. is the mother of three children at the age of 32. Serafima's main activity is raising cattle, but she earns a profit from selling beef at a wholesale market. She does her job very well and her sales are good, so she decided this year to buy more cows because the demand for beef is high enough and the risk is small. MicroInvest is ready to help Serafima to ensure her business development. Serafima also hopes Kiva lenders are ready to help with increasing her cattle.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Once again, Sarah M. is representing her fellow women of Twekembe Development group to seek a loan from Pearl Microfinance. She is a married lady with no children of her own, but with so many to cater for, mostly her husband’s children and other relatives.

Sarah has a retail shop and a milk-selling business thanks to the loans that have helped her re-capitalize her two businesses, hence coping with paying school fees for her dependents. She has benefited a lot through the loans she gets and with her last loan; she was able to start a dairy shop with some of the milk coming from her cows at home. She needs another loan to help with restocking her shop with more products.

loans.use: Restocking her shop with more products

loans.name: Jenny Francisca

texts.es: Jenny Francisca trabaja en la Escuela el Buen Maestro en colonia San Antonio a 7 km de Nueva Guinea, tiene 1 niño de 5 meses de edad, su esposo trabaja como auxiliar de emfermeria en  una comarca y la apoya con los gastos del hogar, esta solicitando su 6to  crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en la construcción de una habitación,  esta profesora todos los dias tiene que madrugar para viajar a la 6:00 a.m. a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños de esa colonia,   ambos comparten los gastos familiares pues son una familia muy unida. Jenny estudia  una licenciatura en ciencias de la Educación y su esposo  una licenciatura en enfermeria.  Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad, trabajo,  salud y llegar a ser una excelente profesional.stró capacidad y puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jenny Francisca works in the school "El Buen Maestro" (meaning, The Good Teacher) in the colony of San Antonio located 7km from New Guinea. She has one 5-month old boy. She is requesting a loan for the sixth time through AFODENIC (Kiva Field Partner) to invest in the construction of a house. This teacher gets up every morning at 6a.m. teach children in her colony. Both share the family expenses, given that they are a very close family. Jenny is studying to attain a license in Educational Sciences and her husband is completing training as a nurse. Her dream is to finish building their home for improved conditions, to have work and good health and to one day be an excellent professional. She has demonstrated capacity and timeliness in her monthly payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a house.

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en: Yetunde A. is a 43-year-old married woman with four children.  To support her family, she sells drinks.  She is hoping to expand her business, so she is now requesting a loan in the amount of $700 (100,000 NGN) in order to purchase more drinks for resale purposes.  She thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional drinks

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en: Margaret is a married mother of 4 who runs a soft drink business. She has been running the business successfully for 8 years. She has expanded her business with previous loans, and wants to expand it yet further to take advantage of the dry season.

loans.use: buy more refrigerators for soft-drink business

loans.name: Rk

texts.en: RK A. is a 70-year-old married man with six children.  To support his family, he sells stationery.  He is hoping to expand his business, so he is now requesting a loan in the amount of $275 (40,000 NGN) in order to purchase more stationery for resale purposes.  He thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional stationery

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en:
Harriet M. is the leader of the Tukwatirewamu group in Jinja. She is a hard-working lady with a bar as her business that has been operational for 7 years. Harriet sells beers, sodas, wines and spirits in addition to the local brew. She is grateful that in addition to having all brands that a customer might need, plus good customer handling, she has been able to retain her regular customers.

She needs a loan to be able to stock more beers and the profits out of it will cater for her children’s school fees and food in addition to what she gets from her garden.

loans.use: More beers to be stocked in her bar.

loans.name: Osas

texts.en: Osas O. is a 36-year-old single man.  To earn a living, he sells spare motor parts.  He is hoping to expand his business, so he is now requesting a loan in the amount of $700 (100,000 NGN) in order to purchase additional motor parts for resale purposes.  He thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional spare motor parts

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr: Fatou Bintou S., 34 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Goudomp depuis 4 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter  et revendre des bananes. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou Bintou S., age 34, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Goudomp for four years. She wants to bolster her commerce to satisfy her customers. This income enables her to improve living conditions and to cover the children’s schooling costs. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell bananas

loans.name: Esubio

texts.es:
El Sr.EUSEBIO T. P., es nuestro socio, el nació en de la comunidad de Urquillos de la provincia de Calca, Este socio tiene 49 años de edad, es padre de 05 hijos, los cuales tienen 21, 19, 17, 15, 13 y 9 años de edad; todos ellos estudiantes.

El socio EUSEBIO, trabaja desde hace 38 años la tierra, a los 11 años el apoyaba a su padre al cultivo de los diferentes productos que la zona produce; entre los que se tiene, el mejor maíz del mundo, de granos grandes y ricos, la papa en sus diferentes variedades, las habas, y verduras, las hortalizas, calabazas; esta actividad le permite al socio dar una adecuada educación a sus hijos y llevar el sustento diario a casa.

El socio agradece muy gentilmente el préstamo que a él le permitirá tener las herramientas necesarias para iniciar su nueva producción, de modo tal que le permitirá tener una buena cosecha, este socio está comprometido y valora el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Mr. Eusebio T. P. was born in the community of Urquillos in the province of Calca. He is 49 years old and the father of five children (aged 21, 19, 17, 15, 13 and 9), all of whom are students. Eusebio has been farming for 38 years, and for 11 years, he helped his father grow various crops that are produced in the area, including the best corn in the world, high-quality grain, many kinds of potatoes, beans, greens, pumpkins and other vegetables. Eusebio's work allows him to provide for his children and helps them obtain their education. Eusebio is thankful for this loan, which will allow him to acquire the tools necessary to improve production and have a good harvest; he is committed to honoring the terms of his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds, and rent a tractor.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina Y. is fifty–six years old. A slight misunderstanding between her and her husband resulted in a break up after they had given birth to four children. Currently, Angelina is a single parent of the four children, three of whom are female. She says the first three of her children have all completed school and are gainfully employed. The last born is in the military academy. She lives in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Angelina has sponsored her children's schooling through her trading business. She trades in smoked fish. She procures the smoked fish from the northern part of the country and sells them in the market in her locality. She also sometimes treks to other markets to do business. Angelina says she used to sell minerals and other drinks but thought it prudent to switch to this current business. She hopes to amass enough profit to complete her building project.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike O. is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She has a shop where she sells rechargeable phone cards and rents Video CD’s. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es: La señora Valeria es casada, tiene hijos 5 (2 en edad escolar y 3 solteros), esta solicitando financiamiento a la institución de AFODENIC para realizar la construcción de una galera y un corral, con el objetivo de mejorar las condicones del ordeño y producir leche de calidad, limpio y sano, así como también desea aumentar su inventario ganadero, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido y sus hijos mayores, obtiene ingresos mensuales de la venta de leche y comercialización de ganado. Valeria se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable y honesta, demostrado  buena conducta y moral crediticia ante la institución de AFODENIC, ademas se siente satisfecha con el apoyo recibido de esta institucion pues a salido adelante en el desarrollo de su actividad ganadera y ha mejorado las condicones de vida del nucleo familiar.
texts.en:
Valeria is married and she has 5 children ( 2 are school aged and 3 are single). She is requesting financing from AFODENIC (Kiva Field Partner) to build a galley and a corral, with the goal of improving the living conditions for the milking cows and produce quality milk, clean and healthy. And she also wants to increase her herd. She can count on the support of her husband and her eldest children, and she also earns a monthly income from the milk sales and by selling the livestock. Valeria is known to be a business woman, responsible and honest. She has demonstrated good conduct and responsibility with her finances with AFODENIC (Kiva Field Partner). She feels happy with the support she has received from this institution, having seen a great deal of success with her business and she has improved the living conditions for her family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Barn improvements.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah N. is the chairperson of the Kyaterkera group Lugazi. She is 42 years old with a charcoal selling business; she has a workshop built with timber and iron sheets and stocks it with over 100 bags of charcoal each time she buys them from the charcoal burners. She has been in this business for a long time, winning her more customers every now and then as well as retaining the existing ones; the biggest advantage is that there is not too much competition in her area. She has a plan of including the sale of firewood to increase her daily income. She needs a loan to be able to buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: More bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr: Issa D., 48 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Goudomp depuis 3 ans.. Elle veut renforcer son commerce avec l'achat et le revente de thioub (tissus teintés). Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Issa D., age 48, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Goudomp for three years. She wants to boost her commerce by buying and reselling thioub (dyed fabrics). This income enables her to improve living conditions and to cover the children’s schooling costs. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell dyed cloth

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. ELIZABETH V., es nuestra socia, Ella es natural de la comunidad de Urquillos en la provincia de Calca, está zona comprende el valle sagrado de los inkas; ella tiene 40 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos de 20, 18, 9 años, por lo que ella aún trabaja duro para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, el mayor esta en la universidad estudiando la carrera profesional de Agronomía, por lo que requiere mayor inversión.

La socia ELIZABETH, tiene como actividad principal la crianza de animales menores como los cuyes y la aves de corral, ella compra animales, los hace madurar y los vende a un mejor precio, también vende huevos y algunas verduras que ella misma cosecha en su pequeño huerto junto a sus casita; su esposo está dedicado a la agricultura, el vende papas al por mayor en los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, de este modo pueden seguir apoyando a sus hijos en su formación profesional.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio y promete devolver el monto otorgado dentro de los plazos y términos estipulados.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth V. is native to the community of Urquillos in the province of Calca, which includes the Sacred Valley of the Incas. Elizabeth is 40 years old and has three children, aged 20, 18 and 9. She works hard to provide for them and contribute to their studies. Her oldest child is in university studying agronomy, which is rather expensive. Elizabeth primarily raises small animals like poultry and guinea pigs. She buys animals, rears them and later sells them for a better price. She also sells eggs and vegetables that she grows in a little garden by her home. Elizabeth's husband focuses on agriculture; he sells potatoes wholesale in the markets of Cusco, which also allows them to continue supporting their children while they go through school. Elizabeth appreciates this loan, and she has promised to repay it within the specified time period.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena A. is a fifty-two-year-old married woman with seven children. Three of her children are males and four are females. She says three of her children are in the senior high school while the rest are in the junior high and the primary school. Helena lives with her family in a house in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre about twenty-five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. Helena’s husband owns a store in which he sells cement and other building materials.

Helena deals in all kinds of fuel – firewood, charcoal, etc., to help support her husband financially. She says she procures the firewood and the charcoal from the nearby villages and sells them in the local market square. Helena says she has been in business for six years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure fuel in bulk. She hopes to help her husband improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fuel – firewood, etc

loans.name: Mbayang

texts.fr: Mbayang S., 51 ans est mariée avec 09 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Goudomp depuis 3 ans. L'activité qu'elle envisage de renforcer est la vente de bananes. Elle s’approvisionne à Mangaroungou et Kougni pour revendre à Ziguinchor. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mbayang S., age 51, is married and has nine children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Goudomp for three years. The business that she envisions bolstering is the selling of bananas. She acquires her goods in Mangaroungou and Kougni for resale in Ziguinchor. This income enables her to improve living conditions and to cover the children’s schooling costs. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell bananas

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet O. is forty years old. She is a single parent of one child, a girl who has completed senior high school. Janet says she and her husband divorced because he was unfaithful. She has since decided to remain single, but she says her ex-husband helps to care for their daughter, who is currently pursuing a nursing course in their community.

Janet lives with her daughter in a relative’s house in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Berekum is a busy business centre about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Janet trades in all kinds of rubber and plastic products such as plates, pans, buckets, etc. She says she procures her goods from the nearby big cities and sells them in the local market square. Janet also treks to other places to sell. She has been in business for over ten years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can buy the goods in bulk.

loans.use: To procure plastic products

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Esta socia es la Sra. MARITZA A., ella tiene 33 años de edad, tiene 3 menores hijos, sus hijos tiene 6, 4, 2 años; esta socia es natural de la comunidad de Urquillos en la provincia de Calca.

La socia Maritza, trabaja las tierras que sus padres le han heredado hace un par de años, con esto ella puede criar a sus menores hijos, ella empleará el préstamo en la compra de fertilizantes, insecticidas, abono para la tierra, y semillas para sembrar y comenzar una nueva etapa de producción; la socia, necesita también el dinero para pagar a los peones que la ayudarán a la siembra y al tractor que alquilarán para arar la tierra; Esto le permitirá tener una buena producción y así continuar con sus actividades.

Ella está muy feliz y agradecida a este medio, por el apoyo que se le brindará y ratifica el compromiso con ustedes y devolverá el préstamo otorgado en el plazo designado.
texts.en:
Maritza A. is 33 years old and has three young children, aged 6, 4 and 2. She is native to the community of Urquillos in the province of Calca. Maritza works on the land she inherited from her parents a couple of years ago. By using the land, she is able to care for her young children. Maritza needs this loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds to sow, which will allow her to start a new production cycle. She also needs money to pay labourers to help with planting, and to lease a tractor she'll use to plow the earth. These investment will help her to have good yields and continue with her work. Maritza is happy and grateful to lenders and the support they're providing. She agrees to repay her loan with in the agreed time.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama D., 44 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Goudomp depuis 5 ans et demi.. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de tissus (tissus teintés et wax) pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Adama D., age 44, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Goudomp for five and a half years. She wants to bolster her business selling cloth (dyed and Wax-brand) to satisfy her customers better. The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve living conditions and to cover the children’s schooling costs. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell cloth

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Agée de 43 ans, Madame Awa T.  vit dans une famille polygame  avec son mari, ses deux coépouses et leurs enfants dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Très tôt elle commença les  activités  génératrices de revenu auprès de sa maman qui faisait le commerce. Awa opta pour la vente des   ustenciles de cuisine ( tasses et autres) depuis 13 ans. Elle jouit d’une réputation et d’une notoriété très enviable à Koutiala. Elle est très sollicitée lors des foires hebdomadaires de Koutiala. 
Afin de pouvoir faire un stock important d’ustenciles, elle a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 5 ans.  Après 4 prêts de groupe ( prêt solidaire ) tous  remboursés sans difficultés,  elle est à son 5 ème prêt  individuel dont les 4 précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter une grande quantité de tasses à Lomé (Capitale du Togo ) et effectuer sa vente  au grand marché de Koutiala, au comptant en détail et à crédit  à une clientèle essentiellement composée  de femmes. 
 Elle compte générer  un bénéfice de 150.000FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour  le remboursement de son prêt , participer aux charges quotidiennes de la  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa T., age 43, lives in a polygamous family with her husband, two co-wives, and their children in the Hamdallaye district of the city of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Very early on, she started working to earn an income along side her mom, who used to do commerce. Awa opted for selling kitchen utensils (tubs and other items) thirteen years ago. She enjoys a very enviable reputation and distinction in Koutiala. She is in high demand there on the weekly market day.

To build up a sizable inventory of kitchen utensils, she turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After four group loans (solidarity loans), all repaid without difficulty, she is on her fifth individual loan, the four preceding ones having been correctly repaid.

She intends to buy a large quantity of bowls and basins in Lomé (capital of Togo). She sells her goods at the grand marketplace of Koutiala, cash or credit accepted, to customers essentially composed of women.

She plans to generate a profit of 150,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to repay the loan, to help cover daily expenses of the family, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basins

loans.name: Lidia Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Lidia Auxiliadora G. es propietaria de su propio negocio de cafetín donde vende reposterías, gaseosas y café desde hace 19 años en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua capital del bello país de Nicaragua. 

A diario la señora Auxiliadora percibe ingresos los cuales son utilizados para el mantenimiento del negocio y de igual manera para bendecir a su pequeño hijo ya que ella es madre soltera. Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los comestibles como reposterías y bebidas para ofrecerlas en el negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Lidia Auxiliadora G. owns a small cafe, where she has sold snacks, soft drinks, and coffee for the last nineteen years. Her cafe is located in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua, capital of the beautiful country of Nicaragua. Each day, Mrs. Auxiliadora earns revenue that she uses to maintain her business and to care for her young son, since she is a single mother. She has sought out Ceprodel in hopes of receiving a loan that she will use to purchase food products, such as snacks and beverages, that she can sell in her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for her cafe

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en: Wilson N. is a proud member of the Kiwamirembe Women’s group and has a retail shop that he has been running with the help of loans. His first loan was used to buy more products for his shop. As a result, he has been able to take care of his family’s needs and to pay the children’s school fees. He has also started up a fresh fruits and vegetables business for his wife, and his dream is to open up another shop for his wife to manage. He is very grateful for the loans because his well-being depends on them.

loans.use: Restock his shop.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena M. is a sixty-two-year-old married woman with eight children: fours sons and four daughters. She says all of her daughters are married and are into trading. Of her sons, Abena says only one is in the training college while some work as drivers or in other jobs. Abena’s husband is a retired carpenter.

Abena lives with her husband and some of their children in their own toiled-equipped house in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Berekum is a busy business centre about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Abena trades in maize. She buys maize directly from the farmers in the surrounding villages because it is most cost-effective. She sells it in the local market, mostly to food vendors. Abena has been in business for over twenty years. She says it is necessary to be in business to supplement the meager income their children give them. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure bags of maize in bulk.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Mme Fatoumata a 51 ans et vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de koutiala troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
N’ayant  pas eu la chance de faire de brillantes études, elle a abandonné au niveau sécondaire, pour  embrasser les activités commerciales.  Après s’être éssayé à  plusieurs activités elle finit par opter pour le commerce d’articles diverse et cela depuis vingt ans. Elle est très appréciée et sollicitée de beaucoup de dames de Koutiala.
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme Fatoumata a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Après 4 prêts  groupe ( prêt solidaire ) tous  remboursés sans difficultés, elle est à son premier prêt  individuel. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter diverses marchandises à Bobo ( Burkina Faso ). Elle effectue sa vente au grand marché de koutiala au comptant en détail et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement féminine.
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour  le remboursement de son prêt , participer aux charges quotidiennes de la  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata, age 51, lives with her husband and children in the Hamdallaye district of the city of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance for academic brilliance, she dropped out of middle school to embrace work in commerce. After having tried several types of work, she ended up choosing commerce in a variety of goods twenty years ago. She is much appreciated and in high demand by Koutiala women.

To meet the needs of her customers suitably and to expand her business, Ms. Fatoumata turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After four group loans (solidarity loans), all repaid without difficulty, she is on her first individual loan.

With this loan, she intends to buy various goods in Bobo (in the Republic of Burkina Faso). She sells her goods retail at the grand marketplace of Koutiala, cash or credit accepted, to women customers, essentially.

She is counting on a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan, to help cover daily expenses of the family, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Irma Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora Irma F. se desempeña en su negocio de venta de piñatas para festividades vendidas en su propio establecimiento donde a diario llega mucha gente a hacer las compras al mercado y a la vez perciben el negocio de ella.

Actualmente ha decidido salir adelante por medio del negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de las piñatas y los mecates para su respectiva venta. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y logra mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y las de su amada familia a la que tanto ama.
texts.en:
In the wholesale market of the city of Managua, Irma F. has a store where sells piñatas. Each day, all the people who come to shop at the market pass by and see her store. She has decided to try to get ahead by expanding her business. To do this, she has asked for a loan from Ceprodel to purchase piñatas and ropes to sell from her store. With she loan, she will benefit enormously and be able to improve the conditions of her business and the living conditions of her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase piñatas and ropes

loans.name: Ndèye Coumba

texts.fr: Ndèye Coumba S., 46 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Goudomp depuis 5 ans et demi.. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de denrées alimentaires (riz, huile, oignons, jumbo, poivre ail etc.). Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndèye Coumba S., age 46, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Goudomp for five and a half years. She wants to bolster her business selling grocery items (rice, oil, onions, Jumbo bouillon cubes, pepper, garlic, etc.) The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve living conditions and to cover the children’s schooling costs. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell grocery items in a booth

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María Lourdes R. es una dama muy esforzada el cual se ha destacado en su negocio de venta de alimentos preparados por ella misma habiéndose caracterizado por ser una excelentísima cocinera ya que sus alimentos son vendidos rápidamente logrando la satisfacción del cliente.

Es importante destacar que el motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente por lo que mejora las condiciones de su negocio y así sale adelante en este.
texts.en:
María Lourdes R. is a very determined women who has distinguished herself through her business, in which she prepares and sells food. She has developed a reputation as an extremely good cook, so that now her dishes sell rapidly and always satisfy her customers. It is important to point out that the reason she has applied to Ceprodel is to receive a loan to purchase raw food materials that she will use to prepare her dishes. With this loan, she will benefit greatly as she is able to improve her business and get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw food materials

loans.name: Amys Lucila

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua Amys Lucila M. es una dama muy trabajadora como toda mujer nicaragüense el cual ha dedicado sus esfuerzos a su negocio de venta de tomates en su propia localidad donde se desempeña.

Hoy en día la razón por la cual ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los tomates. Es de importancia destacar que ella requiere de dicho crédito por lo que se beneficiará grandemente y logrará salir adelante en su negocio que tanto le ha costado mantener.
texts.en:
In the wholesale market of the city of Managua, Amys Lucila M. is a very hard-working woman (like all Nicaraguan women) who has dedicated her efforts to the sale of tomatoes. She runs her tomato business in the market. She decided to seek the support of Ceprodel in order to receive a loan to purchase tomatoes. It is important to emphasize that she seeks this loan to allow her to benefit greatly and be able to move forward with her business, which she has invested so much into.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina O. is thirty-five years old. She is a married woman with four children: two boys and two girls. She says one of her children is in senior high school, one is in junior high and the rest are in primary school. Her husband is a cocoa farmer.

Paulina lives with her family in a house in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Paulina trades in fresh yams to help support her husband financially. She says she also fries some for sale. She procures the fresh yams from Techiman, where the price is quite economical, then sells the yams on a table top in front of her house. She has been in business for ten years. Paulina wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure tubers of yams in bulk. She hopes to help her husband improve their standard of living and give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yams

loans.name: Immaculate's Group

texts.en: N. Immaculate is a 53-year-old widow who cares for 7 children and 4 grandchildren. She is a businesswoman who makes a local brew that she sells wholesale from her home. She also runs a retail bar at her home where she sells beer and wine to customers. This combination provides her with more income. Immaculate also has a retail shop that sells snacks, sugar, salt, cooking oil, maize flour and paraffin to people in her community. She needs a loan to restock her shop and to buy beer to sell from her bar.

loans.use: Buy beer and restock retail shop.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D., 32 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Goudomp depuis 5 ans et demi.. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de rafraîchissements préparés à base de pain de singe, sucre, bissap et de produits aromatisants. La vente se fait à Goudomp et au marché hebdomadaire de Yarang les mercredis Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariama D., age 32, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Goudomp for five and a half years. She wants to bolster her business selling ready refreshments made of “monkey bread” (the fruit of the baobab tree), sugar, hibiscus flowers, and flavorings. Sales are made in Goudomp and at the weekly market of Yarang on Wednesdays. The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve living conditions and to cover the children’s schooling costs. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell refreshments

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en: M. Teddy, 49, is the leader of her group and has various businesses.  She has banana, maize and bean plantations, buys and sells coffee, and buys and sells small fish (mukene) from neighboring landing sites. Teddy is married with 8 children and she looks after 4 grandchildren, which includes paying their school fees in addition to their general upkeep. She is happy with her businesses, which are possible only with the help of loans. Currently she needs a loan in order to invest more into her businesses.

loans.use: Restock and reinvest in businesses.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N., 59ans est veuve avec 01enfant  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Goudomp depuis 5 ans et demi. Son activité est la vente de rafraîchissements qu’elle prépare  à base de pain de singe, sucre, bissap et de produits aromatisants. Elle s’approvisionne à Goudomp et au marché hebdomadaire de Yarang.  Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de scolarité de son enfant et de renforcer son activité. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou N., age 59, is a widow and has one child. She has been a member of the village council of Goudomp for five and a half years. Her work involves selling refreshments that she makes from “monkey bread” (the fruit of the baobab tree), sugar, hibiscus flowers, and flavorings. She acquires her supplies in Goudomp and at the weekly market of Yarang. The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve living conditions and to cover the children’s schooling costs. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell refreshments

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La Sra. CIRILA P.; tiene 35 años de edad , ella nació en la comunidad de Urquillos, en la provincia de Calca, ella tiene 3 menores hijos, de 12, 09, 05 años. Esta zona es considerada la mas fértil entre el departamento del Cusco, denominada como el valle sagrado de los Inkas, tiene una serie de microclimas benignos para todo tipo de cultivo. 

La socia es una mujer fuerte y trabajadora; ella es madre soltera, educa y alimenta a sus hijos sola; Lo cuál la hace una mujer símbolo dentro de la comunidad, esta socia necesita invertir el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes, abono, y compra de semillas, para la siembra de las tierras y para el pago del alquiler del terreno que ella alquila, por no contar con su propio terreno; ella cultiva maíz, papa, lechugas, perejil, culantro, repollo, y tienen destinada una parcela para el cultivo de flores en todas sus especies, la zona de Urquillos es una zona muy fértil lo cuál propicia a la variedad de productos, en esta zona.

Esta socia, también alterna sus actividades con la crianza de animales menores, específicamente cuyes caseros.

La socia está muy agradecida y valora el apoyo que se le brinda y se compromete a devolver el préstamo otorgado en el plazo designado.
texts.en:
Cirila P. is 35 years-old, single, and has three children (ages 5, 9, and 12). She was born in Urquillos, within the province of Calca. This area -- known as the Sacred Valley of the Incas -- is considered the most fertile in the entire Cuzco region due its unique microclimates that support the cultivation of a wide variety of crops. Cirila is a strong and hard-working woman who feeds and educates her children by herself -- a fact that makes her a symbol within the community. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds, and to pay rent for the plot of land which she sows. Cirila grows corn, potatoes, lettuce, parsley, coriander, cabbages, and she also sets a portion of the land aside to grow different types of flowers. Additionally, she also raises small animals, specifically guinea pigs. Cirila greatly appreciates and values the help being provided to her and she fully commits herself to pay back the loan within the alloted timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds, and to pay rent for the plot of land which she sows.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Sinignessigui (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 3 enfants,  vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kaboila II, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région du Mali). 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  du bois de chauffe, des fruits et légumes, du poisson fumé etc.
Elles sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Elles comptent acheter, 4 chargements de camions en bois de chauffe. Elles   s’approvisionnent auprès des paysans ayant une autorisation de coupe,  à Sikasso ville et dans les localités environnantes. Le bois de chauffe est vendu à domicile,  et dans les quartiers en détail, à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 35.000FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie  investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Sinignessigui are all married and average 38 years of age and 3 children. They live in traditional families in Kaboila II, one of the district of the city of Sikasso (third region of Mali). They do different work, including the sale of firewood, fruits and vegetables, smoked fish, etc. The group members are on their third solidarity loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. All the preceding loans have been repaid.

They intend to buy four truck-loads of firewood. Supplies are gotten from rural producers having a cutter's permit in Sikasso City and in surrounding towns. The firewood is sold retail out of the house, and in the area, to customers composed generally of women, with most transactions in cash.

They each envision realizing a profit of 35,000 francs CFA per month. A portion of the profits will be used to meet family needs, and the other portion will be invested in the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Nicolasa De La Concepcion

texts.es: Nicolasa de la Concepción S. B. tiene 48 años, su estado civil es casado, y tiene un hijo. Su hijo trabaja y estudia, y tiene 25 años de edad. Las actividades económicas de Doña Nicolasa destace de cerdo y la venta de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar y aceite y solo por medio de los prestamos ha logrado salir adelante. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. Los propósitos para su negocio son de mejorar su negocio y así proporcionarle mas progreso. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo propuesto para la compra de cerdos y la compra de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y arroz. Sus deseos son de comprar una camioneta y vender en grandes cantidades. La cantidad solicitada para realizar la compra de materia prima es de C$ 8.500 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Nicolasa de la Concepción S. B. is 48 years-old, married, and has one child (who is 25 years-old, and who works and studies). Nicolasa raises pigs and sells rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oils. Loans such as this one have given her the ability to prosper and to grow her business, a task to which she has dedicated herself for over 30 years. Her goal with this business is to continue that growth and prosperity!! She will use the loan to purchase pigs and grains such as corn, beans, and rice. She also hopes to one day purchase a pickup truck so she can sell her products in greater quantities. The requested loan amount to purchase these prime materials is C$ 8,500 cordobas, which she will re-pay in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs and basic grains (corn, beans, rice)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sona

texts.fr: Sona D., 29 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Goudomp depuis 4 ans. Sona achète des mèches simples, des mèches greffages et des produits cosmétiques pour vendre et faire des coiffures à ses clientes. A coté de cette activité elle fait aussi la vente de rafraîchissements. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de scolarité de son enfant et de renforcer son activité. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Sona D., age 29, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Goudomp for four years. Sona buys simple hair extensions, weaves, and cosmetics to sell and to style her customers’ hair. Aside from this work, she also sells refreshments. The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve living conditions and to cover the children’s schooling costs. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell hair extensions and hairstyling and make-up products

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es: María Delfina M. Castellón tiene 45 años, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de cosméticos como pintura de uñas, pinturas de labios, perfumes, cremas y maquillaje. Doña María se ha dedicado a este negocio hace más de 11 años. Por lo que esta solicitando un financiamiento para seguir con este negocio ya que es el único medio de supervivencia para su familia. La cantidad que solicita es de C$9.800 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses y con esto podría comprar los diferentes productos. Sus sueños son de estudiar la carrera de derecho internacional para poseer más conocimientos.
texts.en:
María Delfina M. Castellón is 45 years-old -- she buys and sells beauty products such as nail polish, lipstick, perfume, cream, and make-up. She has dedicated herself to this business, which provides the only source of income for her family, for over 11 years. Maria is requesting a loan of C$ 9,800 cordobas (that she will re-pay in 12 months) to purchase various beauty products. Maria dreams of increasing her knowledge by studying international law.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To puchase various beauty products

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos R. U. tiene 31 años, esta casado, y tiene 2 hijos. Todos los hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Don Juan es la venta de mercadería en general como: como: pantalones, camisa, faldas y ropa para niños, además de poseer este negocio posee otro como es el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 7 años que tiene de poseer este negocio. Los propósitos de Don Juan para su negocio son de mantener su negocio con los productos que sus clientes soliciten y con el negocio de su taxi es brindarles a sus clientes la eficiencia que ellos solicitan. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de ropa para niños, adultos, cosméticos y además proporcionarle mejoras a su taxi. Sus deseos son de obtener otro taxi para seguirle proporcionando a su familia el pan de cada día. La cantidad que necesita es de  C$ 19.500 córdobas a un plazo de 24 meses.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos R. U. is 31 years-old, married, and has two children who are in school. He sells general merchandise such as pants, shirts, skirts, and children's clothing, a business which he has run for over 7 years. Additionally, he also works as a taxicab driver. Juan wants to continue to provide the highest quality products (through his clothing business) and the best service (through his taxicab business) to his customers. Juan is requesting a loan of C$ 19,500 cordobas (that he will repay in 24 months) to purchase clothing (children's and adult's) and cosmetics, and to make needed repairs to his taxicab. He dreams of owning another taxicab so he can continue to provide for his family's daily needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing (children's and adult's) and cosmetics, and to make needed repairs to his taxicab
