payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married. She has two sons: Maxim, who is 16 years old, and Anton, who is 10. Iria has a kiosk in Borki village close to Zmeev city where she sells food. Even though she started this business only half a year ago, she is already making about 4,500 UAH of gross income.

Irina would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase the assortment. Her goal is to develop this business to increase the turnover and income. She would spend her profit on her family's needs.

loans.use: To increase the assortment

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Don Luis R. de 50 años de edad esta casado con doña Lina Pérez de 38 años, tienen 2 (dos) hijos, ambos en edad escolar.
En sus inicios don Luis realizaba sólo compostura de calzados para otro microempresario, hace aproximadamente 10 (diez) años que con mucho esfuerzo y visión de independencia adquirió sus maquinarias básicas para confeccionar calzados de diferentes tipos, éstos lo comercializa en forma directa o a través de microcomerciantes en la zona del departamento central.
El objetivo de este crédito es cubrir con propiedad la demanda de calzados por inicio de la temporada escolar.
texts.en:
Luis R. is 50 years old, married to 38 year-old Lina Pérez, and has two school-aged children. In the beginning, Luis only repaired shoes for another small business person.

About 10 years ago, with much effort and the vision of independence, he acquired his own basic machinery to make different types of footwear, which he sells directly or through small retailers in the central zone.

With this loan, he hopes to meet the demand for shoes at the beginning of the new school year.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of leather, insoles, and iron fittings

loans.name: Dagnaguénewendé

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de zanguera, elle a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle fait cette activité depuis 1998 et fait ce commerce au marché local d’adidogomé, elle a déjà obtenu de wages un crédit de 300000f qu’elle a déjà remboursé c’est pour cela qu’elle s’adresse de nouveau à wages pour obtenir un crédit en vue d’acheter  des sacs de céréales. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in the Zanguera district. Her work income-generating work involves commerce in grains. She has been in this business since 1998 at the local marketplace of Adidogomé. She has already obtained from WAGES a loan of 300,000 francs, which she has already repaid. This is why she is again enquiring with WAGES to obtain a loan, for buying sacks of grain. She is married and the mother four.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Ramon Valdovino

texts.es:
El señor Ramón Valdovino O.  es de la ciudad de Gral. Resquin, tiene casa propia, casado, con hijos, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Margarita González de 32 años.

       Se dedica a la venta de articulos de mercerias en gral, y medicamentos, aparte se dedica a la agricultura tiene cultivos de sesamo y kaa hee, 

     Tiene una motocicleta en el cual se desplaza para realizar las ventas.
El cliente sueña en comprar más tierras para poder trabajar más grande, tener cultivos diversificados.
texts.en:
Ramón Valdovino O. is from the city of General Resquin. He has his own home, has children, is 36 years old and is married to Margarita González, who is 32.

He sells dry goods and medicine in his city, and he also grows seasame and stevia (a natural sugar substitute). He has a motorbike, which he uses to travel to make his sales.

His dream is to buy more land to be able to expand his business and cultivate more diverse crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dry goods

loans.name: Yawa Esther

texts.fr: Yawa esther  habite le quartier d’agbalepedo, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle a pour activité le commerce de pagnes, elle le fait de façon ambulante et ce depuis 1995, elle a déjà obtenu du crédit de chez wages, c’est por cela qu’elle sollicite de wages encore un deuxième crédit pour acquérir en gros des pagnes. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Avec le surplus de revenu qu’ele gagne elle aide son mari qui est un chauffeur dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
Yawa Esther lives in the Agbalepedo district. She is married and the mother of three. Her work involves commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth), which she has been selling door-to-door since 1995. She has already been the recipient of a loan from WAGES. This is why she is again requesting from WAGES a second loan for acquiring pagnes wholesale. She is married and the mother of three children. With the extra income she earns, she helps her husband (who is a driver) to cover day-to-day household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth

loans.name: Fiagan

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur habite le quartier de Soviépé où il tient un bar qu’il appelle Bar ELEGANCE,
Son bar est très animé les weekends et les jours fériés, il doit augmenter son stock de boissons pour répondre convenablement à la demande c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour pouvoir acheter des casiers de boissons au près de la brasserie.il  est  célibataire et aide beaucoup ses frèresv et sœurs dans les charges
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who lives in the Soviépé district, where he has a bar he calls “Bar ELEGANCE”. It’s a very busy place on weekends and holidays. He has to increase his inventory of beverages to respond appropriately to the demand. That’s why he’s requesting a loan from WAGES. The loan will be used to buy cases of drinks from the brewery. He is unmarried and helps his brothers and sisters a lot with their responsibilities.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of drinks

loans.name: Armando Abel

texts.es: Armando Abel C. tiene 39 años, y su estado civil es casado. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio, y anteriormente el negocio era de su Mama pero al fallecer el prosiguió con la venta de mariscos como pescado, camarones y langostas. Los propósitos de Don Armando son de continuar con este negocio para brindarle apoyo económico a su familia que lo necesita. Don Armando solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar la compra de mariscos. Sus deseos son de establecerse en un local de manera permanente para que sus clientes conozcan su ubicación. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 12.000 córdobas a 12 meses.
texts.en:
Armando Abel C. is 39 years old, and he is married. For 14 years he has been dedicated to his business. Previously the business belonged to his mother but when she passed away he continued selling seafood like fish, shrimp and lobster. Don Armando's goals are to continue with this business to provide much needed economic support for his family. He requests this loan for working capital since he needs to purchase the seafood. His wishes are to establish himself in a permanent store so that his customers know his location. The amount requested is C$12,000 cordobas during a 12 month period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mazalo

texts.fr: Cette jeune demoiselle est une travailleuse dynamique qui habite le quartier d’agbalépédo, elle fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générle, à son jeune âge elle tient une boutique qu’elle a appelé  KILOMBO, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006 et s’approvisionne à lomé. Actuellement ses marchandises ne suffisent pas pour satisfaire la demande, elle sollicite alors auprès de wages un crédit  pour l’achat de produits d’alimentation générale, avec ce qu’elle gagne elle subvient à ses propres charges et à celles de sa famille
texts.en:
This young lady is an energetic worker who lives in the Agbalépédo district. Her work involves commerce in grocery items. At this young age, she runs a shop called KILOMBO and has been in this business since 2006. She acquires her merchandise in Lomé. Currently, her merchandise is not sufficient to satisfy the demand. And so she’s requesting a loan from WAGES to buy grocery items. With what she earns, she provides for herself, as well as her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Abra Nousimédi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’adidogomé, elle pratique comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, actuellement son stock de charbons de bois est épuisé c’est pour cela qu’elle  s’adresse à wages pour demander un prêt afin de pouvoir se réapprovisionner en stock de charbons de bois, elle est mariée et  a deux enfants, son mari est à la retraite donc son activité lui permet d’aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Adidogomé district. To earn an income, she does commerce in charcoal. Currently, her stock of charcoal is exhausted. That’s why she is enquiring with WAGES to ask for a loan, so as to resupply herself with charcoal. She is married and has two children. Her husband is retired, so her business enables her to help him with daily expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi T. est un jeune célibataire qui habite le quartier d’adidogomé, il fait comme commerce la vente des articles scolaires, il a associé à cela la photocopie, reluire et autres. Il fait ce commerce depuis 2007, il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de wages il voudrait diversifier son commerce c’est pour cela qu’il demande auprès de wages un crédit. Il se débrouille bien et arrive à s’entretenir avec ce qu’il gagne.
texts.en:
Kossi T. is a young unmarried man who lives in the Adidogomé district. His commerce involves selling school items. He has included photocopies, book-binding, and more. He has been in this business since 2007. He has never been the recipient of a WAGES loan and would like to diversify his commerce. That’s why he’s asking for a loan from WAGES. He does well figuring things out and manages to take care of himself with what he earns.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and goods

loans.name: Bernanbe Lionel

texts.es: Bernabé Lionel E. tiene 49 años, su estado civil es soltero, y tiene 2 hijos. Todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de bananos verdes y plátanos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a la venta de plátanos y bananos, ya que anteriormente trabajo en una bananera en san Luis y mas tarde decide independizarse y por medio de los préstamos es que ha logrado salir adelante. Don Bernabé tiene los propósitos de incrementar su negocio para seguir proporcionando a su familia ingresos. Los deseos de Don Bernabé son de conseguir una camioneta para ofrecer los productos de casa en casa. Este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar la compra de más productos. La cantidad solicitada es de  C$ 12.700 a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Bernabe Lionel E. is 49 years old, single, and has 2 children. Both of his sons study. The business he works in is the sale of green and yellow bananas. For more than 5 years he has been dedicated to the sale of bananas. Before that he worked in a banana factory in San Luis, and he later decided to become independent; it is with his loans that he has been able to achieve this. Don Bernabe's goal is to increase his business to continue providing income for his family. Don Bernabe's wishes are to get a truck so he can offer his products door to door. This financing is for working capital since he has to be able to purchase more products. The amount requested is C$12,700 over a 12 month period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mauyibatou

texts.fr: Ogunsi  moumouyibatou  ehabite le quartier d’adewyui, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants son mari est un revendeur. Elle a pour activité le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1996, et s’approvisionne au marché locale d’adewui et au grand marché de lomé. La demande étant élevée elle sollicite un second crédit pour pouvoir satisfaire la demande.
texts.en:
Moumouyibatou Ogunsi lives in the Adewyui district. She is married and the mother of three. Her husband is a retailer. Her work involves commerce in grocery items, a business she has been in since 1996. She supplies herself at the local marketplace of Adewui and at the grand marketplace of Lomé. Since demand is high, she is requesting a second loan to satisfy the demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Bancomunal  Siempre Juntas.
Margarita es conviviente tiene 33 años, tres hijos de 11,10 y 8 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Margarita se crió con sus tíos por que sus padres fallecieron; su  suegro  empezó el negocio de transporte de materiales de construcción con carros alquilados.  Ahora los hijos continúan el negocio  su esposo maneja un camión, ella va haber a los clientes y hace las cobranzas.  
Necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para  comprar petróleo y pagar al botadero.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a manejar el negocio, trabaja mas ordenada, ella le explica a su esposo lo que le enseñan en los Bancomunales.
El sueño de Margarita es tener un volquete para ella.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Bancomunal Siempre Juntas. She has a live in partner and is 33 years old. She has three children ages 11, 10, and 8 who all attend public school. Margarita was raised by her relatives because her parents past away when she was young. Her father-in-law started a construction materials transportation business with rented cars. Now his children continue to run the business and her husband drives one of the trucks. Margarita visits the clients and collects the payments. She needs a loan of 3,000 soles in order to purchase gasoline and pay for the garbage dump. Since working with FINCA, she has learned how to operate the business, be more organized, and has been able to teach her husband what she learns at the Bancomunales. Margarita's dream is to own a dump truck.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan for 3,000 soles to purchase gasoline and pay for the garbage dump.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes García tiene 53 años, es soltera, no tiene hijos. Es por eso que se dedica a su negocio, sus propósitos son mantener la actividad económica ya que este es su único ingreso. Hace veintiún años que tiene de poseer este negocio. Las actividades económicas de Doña Mercedes es un comedor y una pulpería y aquí ofrece las comidas como: tacos, gallo pinto y gaseosas. Por lo que su única ayuda a la que puede recurrir son los financiamientos ya que estos ayudan a fortalecer su negocio. Sus deseos son de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un buen lugar para vivir. El financiamiento solicitado es para la compra de capital de trabajo como: granos básicos, gaseosa, refrescos naturales y verduras por lo que le gustaría que recibir la ayuda necesaria paras seguir con su negocio. la cantidad solicitada es de C$12.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Mercedes G. is 53 years old, single, and has no children. This is why she is dedicated to her business. Her goals are to maintain her economic activity since this is her only source of income. For 21 years she has owned this business. Ms. Mercedes' businesses are a restaurant and a small grocery store. Here she offers food such as tacos, gallo pinto (a spicy dish with rice and beans) and sodas. The only help she has access to is this kind of financing, which helps strengthen her business. The requested loan is for working capital such as basic grains, sodas, fresh juices, and vegetables; she needs this to help her continue operating her business. The amount requested is C$12,000 cordobas over a 12 month period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción S. tiene 69 años, esta soltera, tiene un hijo. Su hijo estudia y tiene 7 años. La actividad económica de Doña Concepción es la elaboración de tortillas y venta de frijoles cocidos. Hace más de 30 años que tiene de poseer este negocio, ya que dio inicio por iniciativa propia para mantener a sus hijos. Los propósitos para su negocio son de seguir atendiendo a sus clientes y ofrecerles la excelente calidad de sus tortillas. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar la compra de materia prima como maíz y frijoles por lo que estos suben de precio y solo así podría mantener en existencia la venta de sus productos. Sus sueños son de mejorar la calidad de sus tortillas para mantener la afluencia de clientes. La cantidad solicitada por Doña Concepción es de C$ 4.000 córdobas a un plazo de 10 meses.
texts.en:
Concepcion S. is 69 years old, single, and has one son. Her son studies and is 7 years old. Ms. Concepcion's activity is producing tortillas and selling baked beans. For more than 30 years she owns this business, which she started out of her own initiative to be able to take care of her son. Her goals for this business are to keep servicing her clients and offering them the excellent quality of her tortillas. This is why she requests this working capital financing as she needs to purchase raw material like corn and beans which are constantly increasing in price. This is the only way that she will be able to keep selling her products. Her dreams are to increase the quality of her tortillas to keep her customers coming. The amount requested by Ms. Concepcion is C$4,000 cordobas over a 10 month period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr.Anibal es del Barrio Santo Domingo de Carapeguà  vive en concubinato con la Sra Ramona  Fleitas  viven en casa propia 

Es una persona muy trabajadora,  se le conoce por ser multifacético y  luchador  en todos los trabajos, ya que desde joven se  independizò de sus padres  para formar así su propio local de ventas de verduras y frutas.

En horario  de  la mañana el Sr Aníbal realiza  venta de  empanadas y otra comidas rápidas   para mas tarde atender en su  local de venta de frutas y verduras .Tambien  los fines de semana por las noches también realiza trabajo de mozo para encuentros sociales 

	Solicita el préstamo para la compra frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Anibal is from the Santo Domingo de Carapeguà neighborhood. He lives with Ramona Fleitas in common law marriage in their own home.

Anibal is a very hardworking person. He is known to be multifaceted, a fighter in all his work, as in his youth he sought independence from his parents to form his own fruit and vegetable sales business.

In the mornings, Anibal sells empanadas and other fast foods. During the afternoon, he works selling fruits and vegetables. On the weekends, during the evenings, he works as a waiter for social events.

He seeks this loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr .Luis J. es soltero  y vive en el Barrio San Francisco de Carapeguà es una   persona joven que poco a  poco  fue  progresando se iniciò desde  de abajo montando  un  pequeño  puesto de venta de comidas ràpidas ,  

Cuenta  con  un  bonito  lugar que reune a mucha  clientela  por que  resulta confortable  por el  buen  servicio y la calidad de sus  productos es unos de 

	Solicita el préstamo para la compra de una  maquina  para  preparar lomitos.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis J. is a bachelor and lives in the neighborhood of San Francisco of Carapeguà. He is young and has prepared, little by little, to set up a small fast-food stand.

He has a beautiful place that collects many customers and allows for a comfortable, good service and high quality products.

He asks for a loan to buy a machine that makes lomitos (a type of sandwich.)

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new products for making food

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirián Fátima es del barrio Virgen del Cármen de la ciudad de Carapeguá, la misma es propietaria de una chiperia instalada en el domicilio de sus padres teniendo un local de ventas en un lugar céntrico de esta ciudad.
      Actualmente esta viviendo con su madre, mencionando que el negocio esta instalado hace varios años y era explotado por su madre quien por la edad avanzada le dejó la administración a su hija, teniendo una clientela formada desde hace años.
      Con el crédito solicitado logró adquirir una buena cantidad de materia prima que se le ofertó a un buen precio, además de realizar algunas mejoras en su local.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirián Fátima is from the neighborhood "Virgen de Cármen" in the city of Carapeguá. She is the proprietor of a "chiperia" (a store that makes traditional Paraguayan chipa bread,) located in the residence of her parents, which has a central location in the city.

Nowadays, she lives with her mother. She mentioned that the business has been in place for various years and was operated by her mother, who moved under the administration of her daughter, due to age. They have an established clientèle of many years.

With this requested loan she will get a substantial quantity of primary material which was offerd to her a good price. With this she will make many improvements to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying primary materials (starch, oil, cheese)

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar B. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá se dedica a la curtiduría de cueros vacunos hace varios años, actividad que es una tradición en su familia, ya que sus padres y hermanos también se dedican a este rubro.
      Actualmente esta viviendo con su madre, cuenta con una buena clientela formada hace varios años, con el crédito que accedió en nuestra entidad pudo hacerse de capital de trabajo para la compra de insumos o materia prima para la producción de sus productos y cubrir varios pedidos que tenía, y lograr un buen márgen de utilidad.
      Esta muy agradecido a nuestra entidad por la confianza y el apoyo que le brindamos para emprender su proyecto de trabajo, y espera retribuirnos con su buen cumplimiento
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar B., in the city of Carapeguá, has been running a tannery for cow leather for many years, an activity that is traditional in his family. His parents and brothers are also involved in this field.

Today he lives with his mother, and has a good clientèle of many years. With this loan that we agreed to, he can have the capital to buy raw materials for making his products, cover many orders that he has and achieve a good margin of profit.

He is very thankful to us for our confidence and support that we give him to continue his work, and he hopes to repay us with his good performance.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of leather

loans.name: Serafin

texts.es:
El Sr. Serafín R. tiene  40 años  posee una despensa bien surtida en el barrio Virgen de Fàtima de Carapeguà , su  conyugue la Sra Maria  de R. se dedica a tejer  sobrecamas tìpicas de nuestra  zona  y  ayudandose 
mutuamente  llevan adelante  la  familia  ,tienen 2  hijos en etapa escolar y  
viven en casa propia 

El negocio cuenta con mas de 10 años sirviéndole a la comunidad y  tiene  ya  clientela formada .


	Solicita el préstamo para la compra de azucar ,aceite y arroz
texts.en:
Mr. Serafin R. is 40 years old and owns a food supply store in the neighborhood "Virgen de Fàtima" in Carapeguà. His wife Mrs. Maria de R. makes quilts typical of their area. They help each other carry the fmaily forward; they have 2 school-aged children and they live in their own house.

The business has served the community for more than 10 years and has an established clientèle.

He asks for a loan to buy sugar, oil and rice.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, oil, rice

loans.name: Alvaro José

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León, el señor Alvaro C. se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras siendo su especialidad la venta de tomates el cual posee en su propio establecimiento que a pesar que no posee las condiciones necesarias por estar a la intemperie ha logrado salir adelante poniendo una sombría para cubrirse del sol y asi aprovechar sus ventas.

La razón por la cual el señor Alvaro ha logrado salir adelante en el negocio es gracias al apoyo de Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado un total de 14 créditos que los ha sabido aprovechar satisfactoriamente. Hoy en día solicita el crédito para la compra de los tomates y de esta forma continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In The Terminal Market, in the city of Leon, Nicaragua, Mr. Alvaro C. sells vegetables. His specialty is the sale of tomatoes. He has been successful with this, in spite of the fact that the selling conditions are not optimal. He has set up some shade to protect the merchandise from the sun, and this has helped him with his sales. One of the main factors in his success is the support he has received from the Ceprodel agency, which up until now has made him 14 loans, all of which have been repaid successfully. He now is requesting an additional working capital loan, to allow him to buy more tomatoes wholesale and thus continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tomatoes for resale

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León, la señora María Adela L. se ha destacado por ser una excelente comerciante de granos básicos tales como maíz, frijoles y arroz siendo vendidos diariamente en su establecimiento el cual posee.

Hoy en día ella requiere del apoyo crediticio de Ceprodel y es por esta razón que ha acudido para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los granos básicos ya que requiere que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta forma suplir sus estantes del producto para mejorar sus ingresos y así continuar beneficiando a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Adela L. operates a small retail business in the Terminal Market in the city of Leon, Nicaragua. She has gotten to be an excellent business person, selling basic commodities including corn, beans and rice, which she offers for sale every day. She now wishes to increase her sales volume and has requested the Ceprodel agency to extend a loan to her to enable her to purchase additional commodities wholesale. Increasing her sales volume will allow her to increase her income, thus improving the life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, beans & rice for resale

loans.name: Simona Esperanza

texts.es:
La venta de cosméticos es el negocio al cual se dedica la señora Simona Esperanza M. en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde es originaria. 

Ha logrado salir adelante en la venta de cosméticos por lo que ha mejorado sus ventas desde el momento que tomó la decisión de trabajar con Ceprodel en el otorgamiento de los créditos. Hoy en día ella una vez más espera ser beneficiada por Ceprodel obteniendo un  crédito para la compra de los cosméticos que tanto requiere para continuar ofreciéndolos a sus clientes en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Selling cosmetics is the business of Mrs. Simona Esperanza Munguia. She does this in the Terminal Market in her hometown of Leon, Nicaragua. Her cosmetics business has progressed successfully since she started working with the Ceprodel agency, which is providing her with credit on a regular basis. Once again she is requesting a working capital loan to enable her to purchase additional merchandise for resale to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
La señora Martha Irene C. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de todo tipo de alimentos preparados opr ella misma habiendo adquirido vasta experiencia en dicho negocio. Ha logrado prepara diferentes platillos como lo es la fritanga, nacatamales, entre otros.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo requiere de inversión, la señora Martha requiere de un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos en especial los nacatamales por ser una comida típica nicaragüense. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y beneficia su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Irene C. operates a food stand where she sells many different types of prepared foods. She has become an expert cook over the years, through long experience. She can prepare many different dishes, including several deep-fried foods and different types of Nicaraguan nacatamales, which are a form of steamed corn and meat tamale wrapped in a leaf for protection. All small businesses require investment, and Martha’s is no exception. She is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients for the meals she prepares, especially the Nicaraguan nacatamales. She feels that this loan will allow her to continue to expand her business and prosper.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for meals

loans.name: Mariana Lucia

texts.es: Doña Mariana tiene 55 años de edad, reside en Villa flor sur, estado civil casada con dos hijos de 24 y 26 años de edad, su esposo es ingeniero civil,  ella se desempeña como promotora social desde hace ocho años, uno de sus hijo es casado y el menor esta cursando una carrera universitaria de ingeniería civil, con esta solicitud la Sra. Mariana va ha invertir en materiales de construcción para terminar de construir un caraje. Sus planes a futuro es poder ayudar a su hijo que culmine su carrera, así como seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Mariana is 55 years old and she resides in Villa Flor south. She is married with two children aged 24 and 26 years of age. Her husband is a civil engineer. She has been a social worker for the past 8 years. One of her children is married and the youngest is completing a university career in civil engineering. With this loan request Mariana will invest in building materials to finish the garage. Her future plans are to help her son finish his studies, and to improve their home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to finish building a garage.

loans.name: Matilde Argentina

texts.es:
Matilde G. es una dama cuya labor es la venta de mariscos en el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León. Es una persona muy destacada debido a que en todo momento ha logrado sustentar su hogar compuesto por ella y sus cuatro hijos de los cuales actualmente solamente uno está en su responsabilidad y es un pequeño estudiante.

Una situación que ella atraviesa es que es madre soltera y por esta razón debe de esforzarse doblemente para salir adelante. El motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada  con un crédito para la compra de los mariscos y ofertarlos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Matilde G. sells seafood in the Mercado La Terminal in the city of Leon. She is highly respected due to the fact that she has always been able to support both herself and her four children. Of her four children only one currently lives at home and they are a young student. One challenge she has had to overcome is being a single mom. As a single mom she has had to work twice as hard to get ahead in life. Matilde has requested a loan from Ceprodel so that she can purchase seafood to sell at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seafood

loans.name: Nora María

texts.es:
La señora Nora María O. es una dama del departamento de León en Nicaragua el cual se dedica a vender calzados en el mercado La Terminal donde tiene ocho años de desempeñarse en esta actividad.

Actualmente ha logrado mejorar su situación porque ha iniciado a invertir más en su negocio y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante. Es importante destacar que la razón por la que ella ha solicitado el crédito en Ceprodel es para la compra de los calzados ya que requiere dicha compra porque se le están agotando y es de necesidad adquirirlos para ofertarlos y de esta manera no gana posicionamiento la competencia de la señora O..
texts.en:
Señora Nora María Osoria lives in the city of Leon in Nicaragua and has sold footwear at the La Terminal market for the past eight years. During this time she has been able to improve her situation by investing more in her business. Through a lot of hard work and effort she has been able to come out ahead. It is important to highlight that the reason she has requested a loan from Ceprodel is so that she can purchase more shoes to replenish her inventory, which is nearly depleted.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase footwear

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Fátima P. se desempeña en su labor de venta de calzados, cosméticos y ropa en su localidad en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde a diario brinda su tiempo al negocio para satisfacer las necesidades del hogar.

Ella es madre soltera y con dos pequeñas hijas las cuales las lleva al negocio para cuidarlas en el momento en que ellas no van a la escuela. A pesar de la difícil situación económica que ha atravesado, ella ha logrado salir adelante mejorando su negocio y para ello hoy en día una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería que tanto requiere.
texts.en:
Señora Fátima P. sells shoes, cosmetics, and clothes at the La Terminal market in the city of Leon. She dedicates a lot of her time to running her business so that she can satisfy the needs of her household. She is a single mother with two young daughters whom she brings with her to work so she can care for them when they are not at school. Despite her difficult economic situation she has managed to get ahead by improving her business. She has asked Ceprodel for a loan so that she can purchase much needed merchandise to sell at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Carlos Modesto

texts.es: El señor Carlos Modesto, tiene la edad de 73 años habita en el barrio san José de los ríos, en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa, la cual le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene hijos pero no a su cargo, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poner un pequeño taller de carpintería y elaboración de horno para producción de pan. Él desde hace diez año trabaja como agricultor lo que el cultiva es quequisque y repollo, la mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de orientación de de un técnico ya que en cultivos pasado el repollo se lleno completamente de plaga. Inicio con sus propias iniciativas, los planes hacia un futuro es establecer más cultivos de los productos antes mencionado. Con esta solicitud va invertir en productos de insumos para abonar los cultivos y tener una mejor producción y poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Carlos Modesto is 73 years old and lives together with his wife in the San Jose De Los Rios district, in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She helps him with the household expenses and has two children but no longer in her care. The plans he has for his family is to improve the living conditions and to set up a small carpentry workshop and a brick oven to make bread. For the last ten years he has been working as an agriculturer harvesting taro root and cabbage. The greatest challenge that he has met is that the lack of support from a technician, especially after some harvests were taken over by plagues. He started out on his own accord with plans towards a future, to establish more plantation of harvests previously mentioned. With this loan he will invest in products to fertilize the fields for a better yield and to sell the products at a better price in the markets.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products to improve the harvests.

loans.name: Marizol Azucena

texts.es:
Marizol es una mujer fuerte de 35 años, vive junto a su hija en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Huaraz.
Considera que uno de los momentos más tristes es el de su divorcio; sin embargo, ante eso Marisol mostró fortaleza y decidida a seguir adelante inició su negocio con la venta de abarrotes en su bodega que se ubica en la Urb. Los Jardines.

Marizol pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “María del Rosario”.
Con este crédito de S/. 300.00, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, podrá abastecerse de los siguientes productos: 1 saco de arroz, 1 balanza de reloj, además podrá implementar su bodega con la venta de pollo y verduras picadas.
texts.en:
Marizol is a strong 35 year old woman. She lives with her daughter in her parents' home which is located in the Huaraz district. She considers her divorce to have been one of the saddest moments of her life. Even so, when faced with this, Marizol showed great strength and decided to press forward and openened her own business. She sells groceries at her store which is located in the Los Jardines neighborhood. Marizol belongs to the group "Mientras Tanto Maria del Rosario." With this loan in the amount of 300 soles, which she will repay in four installments, she will stock the following products: 1 stack of rice, a scale and she will also start selling chicken and diced fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, vegetables, chickens and a scale for her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Maria es estilista, vende cosméticos, ropa y zapatos desde hace muchos años, negocio que inicio vendiendo en un tramo del mercado oriental de la capital de Managua, también  estudio en cosmetología todo esto lo realizo con ayuda de su mama y esposo, tiene 61 años de edad, reside en el barrio Jericó con cuatro hijos  que están independiente y trabajan. Lo cual es importante para ella ver a su familia realizada, tiene cuatro ciclo de estar trabajando en Afodenic con esta solicitud  va invertir  en la compra de ropa para niño y adulto, zapatos, cosméticos para ofertar variedad a sus clientes. Sus plane a futuro es poder seguir creciendo en sus ventas como en inventario.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a hairdresser, and she has also been selling cosmetics, clothing, and shoes for many years. She started her sales business in a part of the oriental market in the capital Managua; she also studied as a beautician. All of these activities were accomplished with help from her mother and husband. She is 61 years old and lives in the Jericó neighbourhood with her four children who are independent and have jobs. It is important for Maria to see her family do well. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner Afodenic, and she plans to use it to buy clothing for children and adults, shoes, and cosmetics so that she has a greater variety to offer to her customers. Her plan for the future is to continue increasing her sales as well as her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, clothing, and shoes

loans.name: Santa Honorata

texts.es:
Santa Honorata es una mujer de 40 años, vive con sus 2 hijos, su esposo y sus padres en el  distrito de Huaraz. Nos cuenta que le gustaría independizarse como familia ya que la casa donde viven es de sus padres.

Desde muy niña observaba el trabajo de sus padres, ellos se dedicaban al molino; es así que a los 30 años a Santa le nace la idea de vender harina de los granos que se procesan en el molino (granos de quinua, habas, cebada, linaza, y otras variedades).

Actualmente, Santa de hombro a hombro con su esposo, trabajan en el Mercado 19 de Marzo vendiendo harinas de habas, quinua, avena, yuca y además muestra desenvolvimiento en su negocio, tiene clientes fidelizados que siempre la buscan y la reclaman cuando no sale a vender. Además de vender en el mercado informal, ella participa en licitaciones de harinas del PRONAA (Entidad del estado), que le exigen estándares de calidad.

Santa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Catalina de Monterrey”.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,500 que será cancelado en 6 meses, Santa comprará 15 sacos de trigo para el stock.
texts.en:
Santa Honorata, 40, lives with her husband, two children and her parents in her parents' house in the district of Huaraz. She tells us that her family would like to be able to move out of her parents' home. As a child, she watched her parents' work in their mill. At 30, Santa came up with the idea of selling flour made out of the different grains that are processed on the mill (quinoa, fava beans, barley, flaxseed and others.) Now Santa and her husband works shoulder to shoulder at the market selling the different kinds of flour. Her business show progress, and she already has customers that look for her products and missed her when she does not come to the market. Besides selling informally at the market, Santa participates in state bids to provide flour, which requires her flour to meet quality standards. Santa is a member of the communal bank “Santa Catalina de Monterrey”. With this loan of 1,500 soles, to be paid back in 6 months, Santa will purchase 15 sack of wheat to stock her growing business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing grains wholesale

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.en:
Olivia del Carmen Rodríguez is 45 years old, married, and has three daughters. All her daughters are students. Her goal is to give her customers the best service. Her business is the rental of small battery cars and the sale of foundation garments, which she does during week-ends. She has had this business for over four years to supplement her income. Her dreams are to obtain a suitable location to better serve her deserving customers. The purpose of the loan is to obtain working capital so that she can buy batteries for the cars, in addition to the purchase of merchandise such as shirts, socks, undershirts and camisoles. The amount requested is C$9,600 for 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther es una mujer de 37 años, orgullosa de su hogar, ella vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposo en el barrio de Monterrey, Distrito de Independencia.

Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Catalina de Monterrey”.  
Interesada en saber más de su vida, nos comentó que inició su primer negocio en 1994 con la venta de ropa en una tienda ubicada en la cuadra 5 de la Av. Luzuriaga, trabajó aproximadamente cuatro años, en el año ’97 sufrió un robo de casi el 90% de su mercadería de su negocio, ella quedo muy desanimada con esta pérdida, sin embargo, perseveró con un nuevo negocio, ofreciendo pensión a los trabajadores de las Cías. Backus y Ferreyros en el tiempo que lo estaban construyendo.  Esto marchaba bien hasta que un día los trabajadores dejaron la pensión cuando se concluyeron los trabajos de la infraestructura y no cumplieron con el pago del consumo realizado.

Aún pese a esta mala experiencia María Esther no se dejó abatir fácilmente, nuevamente inició otro negocio, con la venta de abarrotes en Monterrey y que a la actualidad lo viene trabajando.  También tiene habilidades de cosmetología, es muy solicitada entre los pobladores de Monterrey.

Con este crédito de S/.1000.00, el cual pagara en 6 cuotas, podrá abastecerse de los siguientes productos: 2 sacos de azúcar, 3 sacos de arroz, 2 cajas de leche, 10 paquetes de detergente y otros productos para complementar el negocio.
texts.en:
María Esther is a 37-year-old woman who takes pride in her home. She lives with her husband and their four children in the Monterrey neighborhood, in the Independencia district. She is a member of the communal bank "Santa Catalina de Monterrey". When asked about her life, Maria Esther tells us that she started her first business in 1994 selling clothes in a store. She worked there for about four years. In 1997 most of her merchandise was stolen, leaving her very discouraged. She began another business, offering room and board to workers from a construction site nearby. This business was going well until the workers left after finishing the construction without having paid her in full. Despite these two bad experiences, Maria Esther started a new business selling groceries. Also, her services as a cosmetologist are in great demand among her neighbors. With this loan of 1000 soles, to be paid back in 6 installments, Maria Esther will purchase sugar, rice, milk, detergent and other products to restock and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products to restock general  store

loans.name: Jose Diego

texts.es: El Sr. José Diego elabora colchones  desde hace veintiún año, el inicio cuando vendió su propiedad en palacaguina donde habitaba con su hermano y se trasladaron ala capital de Managua, tiene 50 años y reside en villa Venezuela su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 24 y 26 años de edad que viven independiente, con ese dinero  de la venta compraron otra casa y iniciaron el pequeño negocio. Don José con esta solicitud de crédito va invertir en la compra de materia prima, para la elaboración de los colchones y otra parte va utilizar para mejorar la infraestructura del local donde elabora sus productos, ya que es pequeño, este es su cuarta solicitud en Afodenic y que lo ha beneficiado para incrementar sus productos y ventas y espera a futuro seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
José Diego has been making soft mattresses for 21 years. He started after selling a property in Palacauina and moving to Managua. Jose Diego is 50 years old, is married and has two sons, 24 and 26, who live on their own. The loan that Jose Diego requests will be used to purchase materials for making mattresses and to improve the small shop where he works. This is Jose Diego's fourth loan with Kiva partner Afodenic. All the previous loans have resulted in an increase in production sales, and he hopes to continue working with Afodenic.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials to make mattresses

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata es una mujer  D. 58 años, perseverante y emprendedora, vive con sus 3 hijos y su amoroso esposo en el distrito D. Independencia.

Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Catalina D. Monterrey”.  Ella se levanta muy temprano a realizar sus labores domésticas y siempre aconseja que “el que madruga Dios lo ayuda”, es un refrán que ella lleva en mente desD. los 14 años, edad en que ella se inició en el negocio D. venta D. comida en un pequeño kiosco en el barrio D. Monterrey, por lo que se considera una mujer fuerte y admirable.

Actualmente labora en su ferretería ubicado en el barrio D. Monterrey, donD. día a día trabaja con ahínco y esmero para así lograr ser un ejemplo para sus hijos, sobrinos y demás familiares.

Con este crédito D. S/.1,000.00 que será pagado en un plazo D. 6 meses, ella podrá abastecerse D. los siguientes productos: 10 balones D. gas, 6 docenas D. escoba, 100 tes, 100 codos, 4 docenas D. pegamento, 3 docenas D. cinta aislante. 
Aún a la edad que tiene se siente con ganas D. participar en cursos talleres D. Comercio, ímpetu que a muchos jóvenes nos hace falta.
texts.en:
Fortunata, 58, is a persevering and enterprising woman who lives with her loving husband and their three children in the Independencia district. Fortunata is a member of the communal bank "Santa Catalina D. Monterrey". She gets up early every morning to do her household chores. "The early bird catches the worm" has been on her mind since she was 14, when she began selling food in a small kiosk in the Monterrey area. Now she runs a small hardware store, where she works hard every day, providing a great example to her children, nieces, nephews and the rest of her family. Fortunata is requesting a loan of 1000, to be paid back in 6 months, to purchase gas containers, brooms, t- and elbow adapters, glue, electrical tape. Fortunata is very enthusiastic about participating in small business workshops.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing items to restock hardware store

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana Jarquín Z. is 40 years old, married, no children. Her business is the sale of cosmetics such as perfumes, lotions and also foundation garments. She has had this business for more than eight years, which emerged from the desire to obtain business knowledge as well as to make a living. The goals of her business are to continue to invest in new merchandise for her customers. The loan is for working capital, since she has to obtain her products in the capital of Managua due to the more favorable conditions of the market there. The amount requested is C$5,000 for 7 months.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruth Miryam

texts.es:
Ruth es una valerosa mujer de 41 años, vive con sus 2 amorosos hijos y su esposo. Vive en el distrito de Huaraz.

Ella pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “María del Rosario” y como toda mujer emprendedora inició su negocio con una bodega y lo complementó con la venta de alimentos (menú); su negocio tiene aproximadamente 4 años de funcionamiento.

Ella es una mujer bastante entusiasta para los negocios, por ello también se dedica al tejido de chompas (sólo pedido).

Con este crédito de S/. 300.00,  el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, podrá abastecerse de los siguientes productos: 1 saco de azúcar, 2 sacos de arroz, 1 caja grande y mediana de aceite.

Ruth se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad de poder acceder a créditos que permitan hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ruth, 41, is a courageous woman who lives with her loving husband and their two children in the Huaraz district. She belongs to the group "Maria del Rosario", and just as many other hard-working women, she began her business four years ago with a small general store, and later she added the sale of food. She enjoys having different businesses, so she also knits sweaters by order. Ruth is requesting a loan of 300 soles to be paid back in 4 months, to purchase sugar, rice and oil to restock her store. Ruth is very thankful for the credit that allows her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing items to restock general store

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia tiene 37 años de edad, reside en villa reconciliación del puente 1 c abajo 1 ½ c al norte en la ciudad de Managua, con dos hijos de 2 y 6 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante, ella tiene una pulpería desde hace cinco años, que inicio cuando se caso con su esposo los dos trabajaban en una zona franca y con la liquidación de ambos lograron este pequeño comienzo de una pulpería. Con esta solicitud va invertir en comprar materiales de construcción para hacer porche y poder gozar de los beneficios y logro de sus trabajos, a si también da las gracias  Afodenic por el apoyo con los créditos que ha otorgado. Sus planes para el negocio es acondicionar bien la venta para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia, 37, lives with her husband and their two young children (ages 2 and 6) in Managua. He husband work in sales, and she has been running a small convenience store out of her home for the last 5 years. She started her business after she and her husband were laid off. Silvia is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to make a small porch outside the store and provide a better service to her customers. Silvia is very thankful to Kiva partner Afodenic for the support she has received in the past.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn C. is 52-years old, has four children, and owns a small rice field she tills wil her huband. Everyday, she checks their rice crops and removes the weeds to ensure quality harvest. The harvest is mainly intended for family consumption and what is left is sold to rice traders for additional income. Aside from being a farmer, Evelyn is a elected Brgy. Councilor in their barrio. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She looking to start a new business. The loan will help Evelyn increase her yield and get started with a new business. 

CEVI helps Evelyn expands her business. Now, she has access to CEVI credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hydie

texts.en:
Hydie C. is 26-years old, has one child, and tends a small rice field with her husband. Together, they go to their farm, check their crops, and remove the weeds in the sun's heat. This is how they provide meagar support for their family.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to improve her yield. Hydie is also planning to establish a new sari-sari (general) store in their village. This loan that Hydie will get will help her increase her yield and get started to a new business. 

CEVI provides their clients with credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage. CEVI works hard to continuously uplift people's lives. Through CEVI, more and more people are able to start their own businesses.

loans.use: To buy sacks of Urea and other fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Oeun P., 51, is a widow who lives with three children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She sells chickens and vegetables at the Phnom Penh market.  She averages the equivalent of $100 in revenue per day. Two of her children are in school and one is a worker. Mrs. Oeun P. would like to take out a loan to increase her supply of chickens and vegetables, in order to meet client demands.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria C. Pran is 30-years old, has one child, and tills a small rice farm with her husband, Randy Pran. They have been working this farm since 2005, and it is their source of food and income for their family. 

Maria is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She is also looking to begin a new business, such as a general store, so she can improve her family's income.

CEVI supports Maria C. in her efforts to earn more income, Now, she has access to credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage which CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, 2 bags of Urea and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Ms. Antonieta M. is a 51-year-old resident of Hamtic, Antique. She is married and blessed with 3 children. These 3 children are all in college level. Her husband works as a farmer and at the same time, a fish pond caretaker.
She is engaged in hog fattening and cattle raising, and her loan amounting to P14,000.00 will be used as additional capital in the business and to be a great help in the continuance of her business. She will purchase one head of pig and cattle. Another source of income for the family is fish vending every morning. Hog fattening and cattle raising does not need much time, which is why she turns to fish vending as another source of income to supplement the needs of the family. Mostly, her customers are the people from Sibalom, Antique.
Her dreams in life are that her business will become successful and will continue to grow. She dreams that their children will be sent to school so that in the future they will find stable jobs. She wants to thank ASHI for the trust that is given to her.

loans.use: Hog fattening

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en: Choeun R., 26, pictured here with his mother, lives in Bati, Takeo province, Cambodia. He is single and works for a private company in Phnom Penh. His mother works at home making collars. Her earnings average the equivalent of $1.50 per day.  Mr. Choeun R. needs a loan in order to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work, which would reduce his transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong S., 59, lives with her husband in Bati, Takeo province, Cambodia. She is a local doctor and sells medicines from her home, averaging the equivalent of $20 in revenue per day. Her husband runs a small coffee shop and makes  $8 a day. They have one child. Mrs. Huong S. would use a loan to purchase more medicines to sell. She is pictured here at home with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase medicines.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en: Erna engages in buy and sell of Fish/charcoal and rice. She’s in this business since 2005. She is 47 years old, married and blessed with 1 child who serves as her inspiration to pursue her goals in life. She is still hoping that she can have another child after 2 years. For now she requests a loan of P8,000 to be used as additional capital to her buy and sell of fish, charcoal, and rice. She will purchase 2 sacks of rice and 4 sacks of charcoal. The loan from ASHI is a great help for the business because she can order raw materials in a bulk at lower price.  She dreams that her business will expand and meet the needs of her customers in the village.

loans.use: as additional capital for buy and sell of rice and charcoal

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um P. is 33 years old and lives with her husband in the Bati, Takeo province. She works in a grocery store and typically makes US$10 in revenue per day. Her husband is a company staff member and earns around US$7 a day. Um P. would like to take out a loan to expand her grocery inventory to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta C. is 65-years old and a rice grower. Despite her age, she is still strong and able to manage her farm business. She has workers who till the land. She has six children who help her manage her six-hectare rice field. Aside from farming, she also raises cows and pigs. Her husband, Wilfredo, cares for the farm animals.

Marieta is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. The loan will help her increase her yield and provide more inventory for her small sari-sari store. 

CEVI helps her grow and expand her business. Now, she enjoys having the CEVI credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gny

texts.en: Mrs. Gny R., 32, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo, Cambodia. She raises and sells poultry, earning about US$1 per day, while her husband works as a motorbike dealer and is able to make US$50 in revenue a day. Gny R. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to resell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun C. is 36 years old and lives with her husband in Bati, Takeo province. She makes and sells collars and is able to earn around US$2 of profit per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and makes about US$5 per day. Mrs. Chhun C. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a moto-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mr. Phan N. is 38 years old and lives in the countryside with his wife and three children. He and his wife are farmers and makes US$6 every day. They started growing rice and vegetables in 2006. Three of their children are students. Phan N. would like to take out a loan to purchase fertilizers and farming tools to expand his cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and farming tools.

loans.name: Lem

texts.en:
S., 42, is a local vegetable planter and she currently grows morning glories at the public lake in the area of Phnom Penh City, earning an average of US$ 5 per day. She is married to Than, 42, who is the father of seven children, and who also helps her in planting morning glories.

The family's businesses now are running very well and that motivates them continue working and improving. S. is asking for a US$ 500 loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and a boat to supply her business operation. (S.'s husband is pictured because she was not available for photographing.)

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and a boat

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha N. is a villager in Ta Pen village in Takeo province. She uses rice to make wine. Her husband, Mr. Chang Nhoeb, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. Although they try to work hard, they still cannot support their family well.

In order to provide better conditions, Mrs. Chantha N. is requesting a loan to buy five piglets for a pig-breeding business. She hopes to increase their income and improve living conditions with this loan. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy five piglets

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam S., 56 (pictured here with her daughter), is a widow and lives in Takeo, Cambodia. She is a weaver and typically makes around US$6 per day. She has three children and all of them are employed. They work as a weaver, hairdresser and tailor. Sam S. would like to take out a loan to purchase hairdressing tools for her child to open a hairdressing shop.

loans.use: To purchase hair dressing tools.

loans.name: Sarath

texts.en: Mrs. Sarath N. lives in Ang Kor Ky village in Takeo province. She is a Pro Hok seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more Pro Hok to re-sell to earn more profit to support her family. Mrs. Sarath N. is a 48-year-old widow with six children, three of whom work in various positions while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: Purchasing more Pro Hok to re-sell

loans.name: Pann

texts.en:
Mrs. Pann T. is a villager in Ta Suon village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chin Nhoen, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living. In this plantation, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to cultivate rice.

Thus, Mrs. Pann T. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, pesticide, fertilizer, and to plow her field. She is a 45-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are construction workers while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, pesticides, fertilizer, and plow her field

loans.name: Samean

texts.en:
Mrs. Samean M. is a villager in Ta Suon village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Chea Veasna, is a teacher in the local school.

To provide better conditions for their family, Mrs. Samean M. is applying for a loan to buy two cows for breeding to earn more income. She is a 40-year-old mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while three others are attending the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy two cows for breeding to earn more income

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Loliota P. is 48-years old, has five children, and, with her husband, rents a small parcel of land where she grows rice and other crops. What her family doesn't consume is sold to rice traders. She dreams of her children graduating from college so they can find better jobs to support themselves and their future children. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She is also interested in looking for some other possible income areas to improve her family's standard of living

CEVI provides their clients credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor C., a resident of Trapaing Krosang village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a piece of land upon which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Nup Oeun, is a construction worker. Even though they work hard, they do not have enough money to build a family home, so Nhor is now requesting a loan to add to her savings to purchase timber to build the house.

Nhor is 40 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy timber to build a family home.

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
S. is 40 years old and lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, where she makes a daily income by selling fishes. She normally runs the business with her husband; they both get up early in the morning to buy fish from a wholesale supplier and sell them in front of the garment factory. The couple currently lives with six children who are still single.

S. now hopes to run a new suitable investment, providing musical entertainment for wedding parties. She thinks that this is a profitable investment, so she has requested a loan of $600 as capital to buy a television, video CDs, and loudspeaker for her service.

loans.use: To buy a television, video CDs, and loudspeaker

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom N., a 51-year-old resident of Trapaing Krosang village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Ha Hoeun, is a construction worker. Sokhom is applying for a loan to add to her savings to buy timber to build a new family home.

She has five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while another is a construction worker and the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy timber to build a new family home.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom K., a resident of Ta Suon village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Su Han, is a cow breeder. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it, so Mom is requesting a loan to purchase two cows for breeding.

She is a 46-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Lelian

texts.en:
Lelian C. is 37-years old and a pig grower. She grows "baboy", a Filipino term for pigs, to support her the education of her three children. Lelian and her husband work hard together to buy the daily needs of the family. She started with only one sow. Now, she has a sow and more pigs in her backyard, and she enjoys raising hogs and the income it provides.

She is requesting a loan to buy more piglets and feed for her pigs. This loan will help her expand her business and find other businesses in which to earn an income. This will improve her family's standard of living and help her educate her children. 

CEVI helps Lelian with access credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Srey Seur

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Seur C., 22, resides in Samroung village in Takeo Province, where she owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice.  Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sophun, sells salt in the local village but has difficulty transporting his product to market. Thus, Srey is requesting a loan to add her savings to buy a motorbike for his business. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To help buy a motorbike for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Many

texts.en:
Mrs. Many U. and her husband, Mr. Khat Sokhorn, residents of Ta Smorn village in Takeo province, are farmers who own a plot of land upon which they cultivate both rice and vegetables. Because the field is far from irrigation, their crops are adversely affected; in order to solve this problem, Many is requesting a loan to buy a water pump and pump supplies to use on the field. She hopes to increase income and improve her family living conditions with this loan.

Many is 39 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and other pump supplies to use on her field.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma T. is 49-years old, has two children, and grows rice and other crops with her husband, Noel T.. When they are not busy with the farm, they operate a bakery in their home, baking breads to sell. People love their breads, and the earnings from the bakery enable them to pay school fees for their children.

Emma is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizers and other farm inputs. She will also be looking to start another business to increase her family's income.  

CEVI provides Emma with credi assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
S., 38, has been running a business raising ducks for eggs for a long time. As another income, he also plants a few vegetables next to his house. He is married with three children who are still single; one of them is employed as a garment worker. His wife is a good homemaker, cooking tasty meals and caring for the children.

The rice harvesting season is coming, S. needs to borrow a loan to buy rice from farmers to stock and later sell to gain income. He will use the remainder of the loan for growing vegetables.

loans.use: To buy rice from farmers and sell for income

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean B., 37-years old, the mother of four children, and grows rice on a small rice farm with her husband, Romulo B.. They started farming 15 years ago on the 1 3/4- hectare of land they were able to buy.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for her farm. She also is planning to start a pig business, and will use part of the loan to buy piglets. This loan will help her increase her farm's yield and the pig business will increase her income.

CEVI provides credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Mrs. Na Y. is a villager in Ba Kung Khang Koert village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Ying Saroeun, is a hard-working man. Mrs. Na Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is 34 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Felipina

texts.en: Felipina P., 62 years of age, married with 2 children, is a resident at Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as waterworks utilityman in their municipality. She started her business through the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.  In her 14th loan cycle, she wants to avail of  Php 10,000 for additional capital to purchased various groceries to be sold in her variety store. She hopes that her business will prosper so that she can renovate her house.

loans.use: Purchase various groceries to be sold to her variety store

location.town: Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheap P., a resident of Kampong Svay village in Kandal Province, is both a construction worker and a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which he cultivates rice. In order to make his crop more productive, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and a water pump.

Mr. Sopheap P. is a 30-year-old father of two children who are yet too young to attend school. His wife, Mrs. Sek Chreb, a garment factory employee, is presented on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a water pump in order to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn F. is a rice grower. She is 35 years old and both of her children are studying. She humbly started her business in 2001 using her own savings. Now she has her farm with an abundant harvest and machinery too, like tractors and threshers, which other farmers rent and use to plow their fields. She uses her harvest to raise her children. In addition to her husband's income, Lorelyn is making a profit from the machines she rents to other farmers. She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. The loan will help her increase her yield. She is also considering buying more land to increase the size of their farm.

CEVI helps Lorelyn be more successful in her business. She has access to the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Thach

texts.en: S. is a local primary teacher, age 57. He is married to Mrs. Hay, 56 years old, who raises chickens at their home for sale. They have eight children who live together in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. The family's daily income is not enough for other expenditures, so S. is asking for the loan amount of US$ 300 as capital to run a grocery store out of their home. The loan will help improve the family finances. (S.'s wife is pictured.)

loans.use: To run a grocery store out of their home

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard P. grows rice to feed his family. He is 32 years old and has 3 children. Three years ago he worked as a driver. He was not happy with his previous job because he received little compensation for his work. So he went back to his village and decided to manage his small farm. In the year 2000 he started managing his 1 hectare farm. He uses his harvest to buy the things his family needs and to help him send his children to school.

He is asking for a loan of Php 10,000. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. He is also considering looking for some other line of business for his wife to manage. The loan will help him increase his yield and get started in a new business.  

CEVI provides Richard with credit assistance to manage his business. He also receives training and insurance coverage services from CEVI.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en: Mrs. Sarat L., a resident of Prey Chuor village in Takeo Province, is a basket seller in the local market. She is a 49-year-old widow with six children, three of whom are workers in differing positions, while another is a driver and the others are enrolled in the local school. She is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike both for family use and for her child to operate as a motorbike taxi to earn income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use and for her child to operate as a motorbike taxi to earn income.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Mrs. Nara R. lives in Preak Doung village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy a pump and some hoses to irrigate her field. She is applying a loan for this purpose to earn more. Her husband, Mr. Yoeung Tai, is a construction worker.

Mrs. Nara R. is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a worker who can earn a little income while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump and some hoses to irrigate her field

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Mrs. Rem P. is a villager in Tkouv village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Toem Toem, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Even though they try to do work hard, they still earn too little income to provide a better house for their family.

Thus, Mrs. Rem P. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy timbers to build the house. She is 61 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other stays at home to do housework. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy timbers to build a house

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha K. lives in Tkouv village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Kun Sok, is a worker who earns money in the local market. Mrs. Sokha K. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is a 36-year-old mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Ni Putu Eka Yulianti

texts.id: Hidup di Desa , membuat Putu Eka Yulianti membuka usaha warung di depan rumahnya. Jalan didepan rumahnya tembus ke Perumnas Polisi, membuat warungnya cukup ramai dikunjungi oleh ibu-ibu disekitar rumahnya. Eka sudah ikut bergabung dengan Yayasan Dinari di KWT Tiing Gading, sudah dua kali periode dan pembayaran dilakukan setiap bulan dengan jangka waktu 12 bulan.Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Eka membeli barang dagangan untuk memenuhi warungnya . Setiap subuh Eka pergi kepasar Negara untuk membeli barang dagangan seperti sayur mayur ,ikan dan daging mentah dan lain-lain. Eka membuaka warungnya dari pagi hari jam 6.00 sampai sore hari jam 18.00. Eka juga mempunyai tanah untuk ditanami padi, dan kalau sudah musim menanam, Eka menutup warungnya disiang hari untuk pergi kesawah dan ikut menanam dengan suaminya.Setelah pulang Eka kembali membuka warungnya sampai sore hari . Selain sayur mayur, Eka juga menjual berbagai kebutuhan sehari-hari, keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- perhari. Keuntungannya dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya ,dan juga cita-cita anaknya yang ingin mencari polisi karena itu Eka harus banyak menabung untuk bisa memenuhi keinginan anaknya agar bisa menjadi polisi.. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari , Eka akan menambah modal usahanya dan memperbanyak isi warungnya .

loans.use: to be capital to increase the merchadise

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma S., 41 years of age, married with 3 children, is a resident of Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a carpenter by profession. The income of her husband is not enough for their daily needs. When she heard about PMPC, she applied for membership and availed of the credit services of the cooperative for her capital in her vegetable vending business. In her 13th loan cycle she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 for additional capital to purchase various vegetables for sale. She hopes that her business will prosper in the future, so that it can augment their income to improve their way of living and send their children to school.
