loans.use: Purchase of vegetables and various groceries to be sold

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhorn K. is 39 years old and she lives in Ba Koung Khang Koert village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Pha Sambo, is a traditional medicine seller. Although they try to work hard, they still earn too little income to support the family.

Thus, Mrs. Sokhorn K. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She has two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a cow

loans.name: Ni Komang Mahayani

texts.id: Sebagai orang Jawa asli dan sudah menjadi orang Bali karena menikah dengan orangHindu Bali,Ni Komang Mahayani yang bersuamikan Komang Sukadana, sangat pandai membuat jajan bolu untuk perlengkapan banten. Dengan hobinya ini Mahayani bisa membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai sopir Bis Jimbarwana.Mahayani sudah ikut bergabung dengan Yayasan Dinari dan masuk ke KWT Tiing Gading sudah dua kali periode dan pembayaran dilakukan dalam setiap bulan dengan jangka waktu 12 bulan. Setiap hari Mahayani membuat jajan yang dijual kepasar dan juga langganannya. Kalau hari raya, maka penjualan jajannya semakin banyak dan juga langganannya semakin banyak yang pesan. Modal yang dipakai untuk membeli bahan sampai Rp.500.000,-. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- perhari.Disamping membuat jajan Mahayani juga menjadi tukang pijat dan lulur panggilan ,hampir setiap sore hari Mahayani mendapat panggilan untuk memijat dan melulur ,harga setiap kali luluran Rp. 35.000 dan Mahayani juga memijat sampai keDenpasar, banyak langganan yang sudah menunggunya.  Keuntungannya dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga untuk pendidikan kedua anaknya yang duduk di kelas 2 SMP dan kelas 4SD.Keinginannya juga memperbaiki dapurnya agar lebih bagus dan permanen. Rumahnya dibangun sendiri  ditanah orangtuanya dengan bangunan yang semi permanen.  Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Mahayani akan menambah modal usahanya dan langganannya semakin banyak.

loans.use: buy tools and ingredients to produce cake

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ya C. lives in Chreak village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile and is far from the irrigation system.

In order to deal with these problems, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, fuel, and a pump to support her field. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Meak, is a hard-working man. Mrs. Ya C. is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fuel, and pump

loans.name: Ni Ketut Bentri

texts.id: Sebagai wanita Bali beragama Hindu, Ketut Bentri mempunyai usaha membuat jajan uli untuk perlengkapan banten.Bentri sudah ikut bergabung dengan Yayasan Dinari dan masuk di KWT Tiing Gading sudah periode kedua dan pembayaran dilakukan setiap bulan dengan jangka waktu 12 bulan. Setiap hari Bentri membuat jajan dari pagi sampai siang dan selanjutnya jajan diiris tipis-tipis sesuai dengan ukurannya , kemudian dijemur sampai kering. Modal yang dipakai Rp.500.000,- , Banyak langganan yang membeli jajan ulinya 100 biji harganya Rp.11.000 dan 1000 biji harganya Rp.110.000,-. Bentri sanggup membuat jajan uli sampai 1000 biji per hari. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- perhari. Keuntungannya dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya dan untuk pendidikan anaknya yang masih sekolah di SMEA dan di SMP .Keinginannya untuk memperbaiki rumahnya agar lebih bagus dan nyaman untuk ditempati.Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup sederhana. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari , Bentri akan lebih menambah usahanya dan lebih banyak melayani pelanggannya.

loans.use: be the capital to buy more ingredients

loans.name: Srei Leap

texts.en:
Mrs. Srei Leap Y. is a villager in Chreak village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crops.

In order to deal with this problem, she decided to request a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Phay Sruo, is a hard-working man who gets hired by the villagers to transport soil and rice. Mrs. Srei Leap Y. is 28 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer  to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
With her motto in life as, “try and try until you succeed”, Delia is more determined to do everything for the sake of her family.  She is 40 years old and married to Gerson, a farmer.  They have three children:19-year-old Ren Ren, a college undergraduate who helps his father on the farm; 16-year-old May Ann, a junior high school student; and 13-year-old Jerwin, a freshman student in high school.  The family has a harmonious relationship and lives happily in Caliguian, Burgos, Isabela.

Delia decided to start a business that can help the family with their everyday living aside from the income they earn from farming.  Delia started this business because of her desire to send her children to school so they can finish their studies and to provide them with a comfortable life.  Delia has engaged in hog raising for almost ten years and is able to generate a net income of 5,000 PHP every four months. She budgets her income to support her children’s education and for some of their household expenses.  

Delia plans to renovate and improve their pigpen.  In order for her to achieve her plans, she is requesting a loan of 5,000.00 PHP.  She also plans to buy another piglet for business growth.

loans.use: Pigpen renovation and to buy a piglet

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Savoeun H., 62, is widowed and has a child who works as a cook in a hospital. She lives in Chreak village in Kampong Cham province and makes a living cultivating rice on a plot of land that she owns. Mrs. Savoeun H. currently needs a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel, in order to make the rice field more productive.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of  two cows for breeding

loans.name: Sambaur

texts.en: Mrs. Sambaur L. is single and lives in Ba Koung Khang Koert village in Takeo province. She is a hard-working woman. Since her work place is far from the house, Mrs. Sambaur L. usually spends a lot of money on transportation. Therefore, she would like to take out a loan to be able to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of vegetable seeds

loans.name: Mrs. Poch Hor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of fourteen members is located in Preaek Doung village in Kandal province. The bank's members plan to use their individual loan shares for different purposes. 
The members have selected Mrs. Poch H. as the bank's president. Mrs. Poch H., 29, is a housewife, while her husband, Mr. Yan Sok Khan, earns income making sculptures. They have two young children who do not yet work or study. The couple's combined income is small, and Mrs. Poch H. has therefore decided to ask for a loan to start a business where she would make Khmer noodles for sale.

loans.use: Starting a Khmer noodle sales business

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Mrs. Amelia P., 37 years of age, is married and a resident of Barandias, Pangantucan, Bukidnon Southern Philippines. She is an active snack food operator whose project is located at the school canteen.  She uses as her daily income from the school canteen 10% of her gross sales.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional snack food items for sale.  Her simple aspiration in life is to have her own canteen.

loans.use: To purchase food snack  items for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Improvements in farming efficiency

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth C., 53 years old, married, is a resident of Tubod, Aloran, Misamis  Occidental. She is blessed with nine children. Her husband is a farmer. With the present economic crisis, Mrs. Elizabeth C. didn't regret that she entered into a business where only a small capital is needed but can earn bigger income. She is engaged in hog-raising. For several years, the business is already part of her life. It only started with a small capital of  PHP3,000 from PMPC last May 2004.  Being a MIGS members of Paglaum, she already availed of 14 loan cycles already.  Now, she applies for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy sacks of feeds for the daily consumption of her hogs. She really wants to sustain the business. In the future, she wants to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feeds for hog raising

loans.name: Romana

texts.en: Mrs. Romana D., 59 years old, married,  lives in Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with five children. Her husband is government employee. Romana thought of a project that could help her husband particularly on meeting financial needs of her family. She  then ventured on pig raising, starting up with only one piglet. Needing capital to finance the daily feeds of her piglet, she then joined PMPC last July 2008 and availed of loans to increase the number of her piglets.  Now, she applies for PHP 14,900 loan  to buy one sow and a few sacks of feeds for the piglets. She plans to raise them but some of it will be sold to Sotto Meat Dealer. Romana will be very happy and excited if she sees all her piglets grow healthy, for she knows that this will be additional income for her family. She hopes to see her children finish their studies as it will be a great fulfillment for her as a mother.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feeds for pig raising

loans.name: Lionela

texts.en: Mrs. Lionela A., 47, married and a resident of Pangantucan, Bukidnon is now looking for an additional capital amounting to PHP 8000 to purchase bags of feeds for her hog fattening business. She currently owns 2 gilt, 1 sow and 1 boar to be maintained.  She has been in this business for the past 3 years. Due to lack of capital, most of the time,  she can't provide the right feeding of her hogs.

loans.use: To purchase bags of feeds for  hogs

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en: Mrs. Soeng Y., 54, is widowed and has 7 children, one of whom attends a local school, two are employed in a garment factory, two are construction workers, and another two stay at home to do housework and help their mother. Mrs. Soeng Y. lives in Pech En village in Takeo province and earns income cultivating rice on a small plot of land. Additionally, she also breeds pigs. The breeding business is doing well, and Mrs. Soeng Y. would like to expand it. Thus, she is asking for a loan to be able to buy two piglets and a cow.

loans.use: Purchase of two piglets and a cow for breeding

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо Бобоева 1967 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Зебо торгует на рынке сигаретами и чаем. В 1992 году она осталась без работы, муж зарабатывал где предлагали работу , так продолжали жить и зарабатывать. Со временем  она сама начала выходить на рынок недалеко от своего дома, и торговать мелочами: чай, сигареты и другими мелочами. Она сотрудничает с Микроинвест  почти 5 лет и имеет хорошую кредитную историю, довольна условиями программы.
texts.en:
Born in 1967, Zebo B. is married and has 2 children. Zebo sells cigarettes and tea at a market. She lost her job in 1992, and, with her husband working wherever there was work, the family continued to make ends meet. With time, Zebo started to go to a market near their home and sell small goods like tea, cigarettes, etc. She has been working with MicroInvest almost five years, has a good credit history and is happy with the terms of this program.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy L., 28 years old, is a typical "tapisero" (sugarcane cutter) of  Barandias, Pangantucan, Bukidnon, Southern Philippines. She and her husband receive PHP100 (USD$2.50) a day for their labor.  The couple comes from the Manobo tribe and they  have been in financial difficulty for the past years. She then decided to engage in rice trading with her co-"tapaseros" as her main customers. Currently, Joy and her husband continue to be "tapaseros" so they can earn additional income. However, income is not sufficient for the family. To expand her business, she needs an additional capital amounting to PHP 8000 to purchase milled rice directly from the farmers.

loans.use: To purchase  bags of milled rice for sale

loans.name: Lynneth

texts.en: Lynneth E., 22, single, is a resident of Pangantucan, Bukidnon, Southern Philippines.  She has  been with her grandmother after the death of her parents. She stopped going to college to take care of her aging grandmother.  She did not lose hope instead  she started a barbecue/grilled chicken business in her place. Until now this business is still active after receiving  financial support from HSPFI.  For now, she is looking for an additional capital of PHP8000 to purchase in large volume dressed whole chicken for grilling. She hopes to be legally married to her live-in partner soon and work  on her business to make it more sustainable.

loans.use: To purchase in large volume of  dressed whole chicken

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Маткаримова Шахноза  1985 года рождения, детей нет. Торгует на рынке киноаппаратурой почти 4 года. Сотрудничает почти год в Микроинвест, в бизнесе помогает муж , привозит с Китая аппаратуры и частично помогает жене. Ей необходим кредит для расширения бизнеса и приобретения товара.
texts.en:
Shahnoza M. was born in 1985 and has no children. She has been selling film equipment at a market for almost 4 years and has been working with MicroInvest for almost a year. Shahnoza’s husband helps with the business and brings the equipment from China. This loan is needed for business expansion and purchasing new products.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mrs. Lun Soem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty two people living in Preaek Doung village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Lun S., 42, is the president of the village bank. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a small plot of land. Her farming business is currently facing some difficulties, in particular, due to the low fertility of the soil which badly affects the crops. To increase the productivity of the rice field, she has decided to take out a loan to buy fertilizers, as well as to hire laborers to work on the field. 

One member in this village bank group will have an end-of-term loan, while the others will be making monthly payments. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product, being the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, since it allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and hire of farm laborers

loans.name: Karimdjon

texts.ru: Каримджон Окилов 1972 года рождения имеет 2 детей. Жена домохозяйка,но помогает в бизнесе мужа, ухаживает за скотом, кормит. А Каримждон в свое время  вызывает ветеринара (делают уколы)выводит скот на рынок, покупает когда необходимо еще скот. В настоящее время скот на рынке дешевый и до середины марта можно прикупить скот и продать дороже  позднее.  Сотрудничает с Микроинвест с 2007 года. Планирует сотрудничать  и в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
Karimdjon O. was born in 1972 and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker, but helps with the business by feeding and caring for the livestock. In the meantime, Karimdjan takes care of calling a veterinarian for shots, takes the livestock to a market and buys additional livestock when necessary. Currently, livestock market prices are low and will stay there until about middle of March; then livestock can be sold for more. Karimdjan has been working with MicroInvest since 2007 and plans to continue the partnership.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Abdunaby

texts.en:
Abdunaby A. lives in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is a happy father and grandfather; he has 8 children and 28 grandchildren. Abdunaby worked on a collective farm and today he is 63 years old, but he young at heart and full of powers.

Abdunaby has been working with livestock for 10 years. It supplements the family income, and he is experienced in livestock because he was taking care of animals when he was working on the collective farm. Abdunaby has one cow and 4 rams. He wants to purchase a pedigreed bull and one milk cow. Today Abdunaby is asking KIVA for financial support, a business development loan of 2500 STJ for 8 months to purchase the pedigreed bull. Abdunaby thanks KIVA for its precious contribution to small business development and support.

loans.use: purchasing a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Mrs. Davy Sokh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, located in Preaek Doung village in Kandal province, consists of fifteE. members, each of whom plan to use their individual loan share for different purposes. M.. Davy S., 27, has beE. selected to be the president of the village bank. She is married and has two childrE. who are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Sun Kosal, works in a restaurant. M.. Davy S. herself is a farmer who cultivates rice on a plot of land. Her farming business is facing difficulties, since M.. Davy S. does not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest rice. Thus, she has decided to take out a loan for this purpose, as well as for threshing rice. 

Five members of the village bank group have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product, because it is very beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Hire of laborers to harvest rice

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза Разокова 1979 года рождения имеет 2 детей. В бизнесе участвует полностью больше года торгует хозяйственными товарами на рынке  недалеко от дома.  С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2004 года, довольна   условиями кредитования. Всегда вовремя погашает кредит имеет хорошую  кредитную историю.
texts.en:
Shahnoza R. was born in 1979 and has 2 children. She has had her business for over a year. She sells household products at a market close to her home. Shahnoza has been working with MicroInvest since 2004 and is happy with their credit terms. She always repays her loans on-time and has a good history.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Development

loans.name: Khusen

texts.en: Khusen G. first applied to MicroInvest after learning of their business development loans from a neighbor who, through the program, was able to purchase a pedigree bull and four rams. Khusen, who lives in a rural area where livestock is the main source of family income, has been raising livestock for 15 years, and he is now requesting a loan to help him purchase a milking cow to expand his business and increase profits.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина - девушка 20 лет не замужняя. Она молодая и уже опытная в своем деле. Тахмина предоставляет услуги парикмахера в городе Вахдат. Она является профессиональным дамским мастером в салоне «Ситора» и делает стрижку, прическу, укладку, завивку, а также красить по желанию клиента  течение восьми лет. Она хочет получить займ в сумме 1000 на шесть месяцев и купить сушилку.
texts.en:
Tahmina is 20 year old and single. Despite her young age, she is an experienced hairdresser. For the past eight years she has worked for a beauty salon Sitora in Vakhdat. Tahmina is applying for a loan of 1000 in order to buy a professional hair dryer for her salon.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a professional hair dryer for her beauty salon

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Табарова Гулнора Файзалиевна, 1979 года рождения. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она начала в 2000 году. Она шьет национальные и европейские платья. У нее много постоянных клиентов. Гульнора шьет платья, юбки, брюки  из разных материалов и разных фасонов.
В сезон свадебных мероприятий увеличивается спрос на шитье разнообразных национальных платьев. В такие моменты Гульноре необходимы дополнительные средства, для приобретения материалов и фурнитуры. Для этого она хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони и погасить его в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gulnora Faizalievna T. was born in 1979 and started her business in 2000. She makes Tajik and European dresses, skirts and pants from different types of fabric and following different fashions, and she has many regular clients. Since demand for her services goes up in the wedding season, Gulnora needs extra cash for buying fabric and accessories. Gulnora is applying for a loan of 2000 somoni, which she plans to repay within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fabric and accessories

loans.name: Pirruza

texts.ru:
Тоирова Пирруза Нуралиевна 1986 года рождения. Она живет с родителями в городе Вахдат. Благодаря маме, которая научила ее шить и вышивать, Пиррузу уже хорошо знают в своем районе. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев, а также вышивкой 8 лет.  Занимается она этим делом в ателье «Ситора». Пирруза старается,  угождать своим клиентом разновидностью фасонов и орнаментами, которые сама вышивает.
Она хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев, для закупа материалов и ниток.
texts.en:
Pirruza Nuralievna T. was born in 1986. She lives in Vakhdat with her parents. Thanks to her mother, who taught Pirruza to make and embroider clothes, Pirruza is a well-known seamstress and has eight years of experience in making traditional Tajik dresses and embroidering. She works for the workshop "Sitora" and tries to please her customers by offering a variety of fashions and embroidery patterns. Pirruza would like to become a Kiva client and get a loan of 2000 somoni for 6 months. She would use the loan for puchasing fabric and thread.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Burhon

texts.en:
Burhon P. was born in 1961 in the rural area of the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children who help him in their livestock-raising family business. Burhon has been engaged in raising livestock for 10 years and he is a skilled livestock owner because he worked before on a collective farm.

Burhon is a builder by professional background but that is seasonal work and livestock is the general business he is involved in. Burhon has a milk cow and rams. He wants to build a suitable seasonal barn and is asking KIVA for financial support, a business support loan of 2000 STJ for 8 months.

loans.use: to build a suitable seasonal barn

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Холова Гулдаста 1964 года рождения. Она замужем и у них 4 детей. Она выбрала для себя особое направление в бизнесе. Приготовление и продажа продуктов питания в городе Вахдат. Там можно вкусно пообедать, выпить зеленого чая, прохладительными напитками  утолить жажду. Недавно она услышала о программе Кива и с ее помощью хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев, для закупа продуктов питания.
texts.en:
Guldasta H. was born in 1964. She is married with four children and lives in Vakhdat. She has her own business. She cooks and sells food. At Guldasta's place one can enjoy lunch and satisfy thirst with a cup of green tea. Recently Guldasta has heard of Kiva and decided to apply for a six-month loan of 2000 somoni. She will use the loan to buy groceries and increase cash flow.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said J. is a successful father and dedicated husband. He has two children, the elder is studying at University and his younger is still in elementary school. Said began a small grocery store a year ago with savings which he earned as a carpenter as his small capital. He was assisted by his wife who helps him with serving his customers. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery has become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Said is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.en:
Fakhriddin F. is 20 years old. Despite his young age, he is already supporting his parents and, together with his brother, they’ve been working at baking “lepeshka”- traditional Tajik bread. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes the lepeshka and other bread so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast.

All the raw materials such as flour, salt, and yeast are purchased in the local market. Now, due to high demand, Fakhriddin wants to increase the number of his bread he bakes, so he is requesting US$ 800 for a term of 12 months. The loan shall be spent for purchasing flour and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. In future, together with his brother, Fakhriddin is dreaming of openning their own workshop and with the profit, building his own house and his family. Fakhriddin deeply appreciates the trust and support you give him.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour for baking “lepeshka”

loans.name: Mt. Rungwe Group

texts.en:
Stella M., age 36, is married with two children ages 17 and 11. She sells food at Mbagala. She started this business in 2006 and works daily from 6am until 12pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 258.

This will be Stella’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock and started selling pork and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a fourth loan to pay her children's school fees.

Stella will share this loan with her loan group, Mt. Rungwe, which totals 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Stella is 1st on the right with a red cap.

loans.use: School Fees

loans.name: Shamim M. Ameen Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is a 33-year-old married lady and has resided in an area called Ismail Nagar of the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 18 years. Shamim baji is uneducated because her parents couldn’t bear her education expenses. Her husband's name is M. A. and he is a hawker. He sells fruit from his cart by making his voice loud so that people hear him easily and come to him for buying fruit.

Shamim baji is the mother of four sons. Her eldest son runs a small restaurant where he sells Punjabi food (Daal chawal, dahi bhalas). Her second son has a utensils-selling business. Her third son is a cobbler and the youngest son is just 3 years old. Shamim baji helps her eldest son in his food-selling business. She prepares food for his restaurant so that he is able to sell more food and attract more customers. Shamim baji is applying for a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her eldest son’s restaurant.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Sajida baji and Farkhanda baji each want a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Jamila Bano baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food business

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
Umedjon F. is 25 years old. He and his wife have one child. Umedjon is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 5 years. He bakes the national bread “lepeshka” at home. His wife helps him with his business. Having many customers, Umedjon is selling the majority of his products just out of his place. However, he is also running a stand in the central market selling ”lepeshka”. Now Umedjon is requesting 800 USD for a term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase flour wholesale, as required for his business. Umedjon is grateful to all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  flour wholesale for  “lepeshka”

loans.name: Salohiddin

texts.en:
G. Salohiddin is 44 years old and married. Together with his wife they have four children. Their children are young and attend school. They are farmers who own a plot of land in their village where they grow different kinds of crops like wheat, potatoes, onions and other vegetables. They have been in this business since 1994. These crops are the main source of income for their family. To reduce the hard physical labour and to expand the business, Salohiddin would like to apply for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
Zulfiya is a married woman who lives alone and works hard for the good of her three children. The  training she has given her children allows her to count on their strong support in working the fields. Zulfiya’s children’s grateful attitude continues to encourage her, and they have gathered many lessons during this time that they will use when they form their own households. What Zulfiya urgently needs right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for the care of their crops, so that they can produce a product that meets the demands of the market. Zulfiya doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Upendo-2 Group

texts.en:
Anna owns a small grocery store in the Usariver neighborhood of Arusha. She currently makes an average monthly profit of $450. Every day she works at her business from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more grocery items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Anna is 39 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 4 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Veronica Who also has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora has owned a small shop in the Usariver neighborhood of Arusha for 8 years.She belongs to Magadirisho "A" (group code 2001) loan group. She currently makes an average monthly profit of $350. Every day she works at her business from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  She is requesting loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Debora is 31 years old, married, and has four children who age between 4 and 16 years.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Khurhseed Faryad Masih Group

texts.en:
Khurhseed baji is a 49 years old married lady and has been a resident in the Ismail Nagar neighborhood of Lahore city, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband name is F. M. and he has a sanitary supply selling business. He runs a shop in the community and people come to him to buy sanitary supplies. Khursheed baji is the mother of eight children: seven sons and one daughter. Her elder son is an electrician. The next two work in a factory. The others are being educated at a school located near their house. Khurhseed baji is a very hardworking and caring lady. She sews clothes day and night to make a good income because her daughter is 22 years old and she wants to marry her off. She has successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy electric tools for her elder son, so that he will be able to start a shop repairing electric items (fridge, television and sound system). 

Khurhseed baji is a loan group leader of some women of her locality. Irshad baji and Razia baji each want a loan to buy henna (coloring for palms and feet) to sell. Bashiran baji and Tariq baji each want a loan to buy blankets to sell.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electric tools to repair electric items

loans.name: Shahnaz Kosar Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz kosar baji is a 41 years old married lady and has been a resident of  the Ismail Nagar neighborhood of Lahore city, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her husband, M. R., is a driver by profession and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has been driving this for the past 12 years. Shahnaz baji is the mother of seven kids: four sons and three daughters. Her two eldest sons are involve in a decorative embroider business. The other two sons and her daughters are being educated at a school located near the house. Shahnaz baji is a very active lady. She does all the household work and than helps her sons by making embroidery on clothes. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now, she is applying again for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband so that he can increase his earnings.
 
She is a loan group leader of some other women of her locality. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy material (chairs, creams) for her salon. Shamim naz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Touch Sath Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people living in Preaek Doung village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. M.. Srey Touch S., 40, is the president of the village bank. She is married and has four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is still too young to work or study. M.. Srey Touch S.'s husband, Mr. Prum Saravuth, is a motorbike taxi driver. M.. Srey Touch S. herself earns income selling pork, and, since her business is doing well, she now wants to expand it. Thus, M.. Srey Touch S. has decided to take out a loan to be able to bU. more pork for sale and thereby earn more profits.

loans.use: Purchase of pork for sale

loans.name: Zarif

texts.en: H. Zarif is 34 years old. He is married and has a son. For 4 years Zarif has farmed his land together with the help of his wife. He is planning to sow potatoes on his land. He is requesting this loan to purchase potato seed and mineral fertilizer to strengthen the soil. Zarif is asking for a loan of $ 600 USD with a term of 10 months. You could become an important part in Zarif family's life, he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: to purchase potato seed, mineral fertilizer and to build a cattle shed

loans.name: Ruqaiya Dildar Hussain Group

texts.en:
Ruqaiya baji is a 41 year old married lady and has been a resident of Ismail Nagar in Lahore city, Pakistan, for the past 22 years. Her husband, D. H., has a business selling blankets and has 12 years of experience. He buys blankets from different cities (Multan and Faisalabd) and resells them in his native city, Lahore. Ruqaiya baji helps him by going to these cities to buy supplies of blankets. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy additional blankets and expand her husband’s business. 

She is a loan group leader of several other women in her locality. Zeenat baji, Bhoolan baji and sabri baji each want a loan to buy blankets to resell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy henna (decorative palm and foot color) to sell.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy blankets to resell

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan L. lives in Cheak village in Kandal province. She earns income breeding pigs, while her husband, Mr. Houl Lim, is a farmer who cultivates rice on a plot of land that he owns. The farming business is facing difficulties, because he does not have enough money to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, fuel, and hire laborers to work on the field. Therefore, Mrs. Yan L. has decided to take out a loan for these purposes.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers, pesticides, fuel, and hire of farm laborers

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is 26 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children. He has been a farmer for the past 3 years. He began with the goal of supporting his household and above all to satisfy the needs of his children. For Hamza, agriculture is an activity that he likes to do. Vegetable growing is what he enjoys most, as it is easier to cultivate these plants, which are harvested annually and the produce is profitable. The earnings are greater when buyers purchase the production in great quantities. The expense of transportation can also be avoided when buyers come to harvest and take them away the produce themselves. Hamza is requesting a loan to invest in seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. Be an important part of the growth of Hamza’s business.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Chantho

texts.en: Mr. Chantho P. lives in Ta Koul village in Kandal province. He is 31 years old and has three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is still too young to work or study. Mr. Chantho P. earns income as a vet, while his wife, Mrs. Et Kong, is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetables on a piece of land. Even though they work hard, Mr. Chantho P. and his wife still earn too little to be able to repair their family's house. Therefore, Mr. Chantho P. has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Mukhtayaran Liaqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Mukhtayaran baji is a 48 year old married lady and has been a resident of Ismail Nagar of Lahore city, Pakistan, for the last 30 years. She could not get an education as her father had little financial resources. She married a man whose name is L. A. and he has a blanket selling business. He buys blankets from different cities (Multan, Faisalabad). This has become her family business, because her three sons also involve in selling blankets. Mukhtayarn baji also helps her husband by going to different cities to buy the blankets so that her husband has more time to sell them. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy additional blankets to expand her family business. 

She is a loan group leader of several other women of her locality. Irshad baji, Rehana kosar baji, Nasreen baji and Guddu baji each want a loan to buy blankets to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy blankets to sell

loans.name: Shafi

texts.en:
Shafi is 50 years old. He is a married man with four children. Shafi’s main source of income is in the transportation sector. Shafi was a farmer and eventually bought a car to transport vegetables and fruits to the neighboring cities and towns. Through this business Shafi supports his wife and four children.

The loan he is requesting will be used to repair the engine of his car and buy new tires. This will allow him to better provide for his family. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Repair a car engine purchase new tires

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.en:
Mwahija has been a wheat seller in the Usariver neighborhood of Arusha for 8 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $95. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 7:30 p.m.  She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more wheat for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Mwahija is 39 years old, married, and has four children: aged between 11 and 22. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Paulina, Theresia, Matilda and Jackline.Each woman also has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more wheat for resale to expand her business.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a business woman in the Usariver neighborhood of Arusha. She belongs to the Juhudi loan group (group code 2033). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $225. Every day she works at her business from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Janeth is married, and has three children.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey C. is a pig breeder in Ang village in Kandal province. Her husband, Mr. Mao Mab, is a rice farmer who works his own plot of land. He faces an obstacle because the field has become infertile, and he does not have enough money to buy fuel in order to obtain water to irrigate the field. Mrs. Srey C. has therefore decided to ask for a loan. She is 26 years old and the mother of three children: two who are enrolled in the local school and one who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To help cultivate rice.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en: Ilhom is 41 years old and the father of three children. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. He is a hard working person and has been providing a taxi service for 3 years. It is most important to him that in the future, his children enter University and successfully finish it, so that they can become professionals and have a better tomorrow. Ilhom wishes to keep his taxi business growing, and for this he needs to have his working tools in good order. Ilhom is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to strengthen his business. Thanks to this work he has been able to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts to repair his car

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is married with one adult daughter. He owns a truck and transports construction materials. He started this particular business because he enjoys this type of work. His clients like the way he treats them, so Vasil, has many steady clients.  He also tries to keep reasonable prices for his services.

Vasil would like to get a loan of 9,000 UAH to remodel his truck to be able to transport longer material. His business goal is to purchase a second truck as he has many orders from his clients.

loans.use: to remodel the truck

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthy Long Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has been requested by 16 people living in Kampong Tuol village in Kandal province, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Bank president Mrs. Chanthy L. owns a small soup restaurant. Since her business is doing well, she wants to increase profits by purchasing more ingredients so she can make more soup. She is 35 years old and has three children: one little one and two who are enrolled in the local school where her husband, Mr. Kuth Boramey, is a teacher.

loans.use: Purchasing more ingredients in order to increase profits at a soup restaurant.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Mrs. Sarom C., a villager in Press Theat village in Kandal province, owns a grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to increase income by purchasing more grocery goods to sell. She is 48 years old and the mother of three children: two are employed in a garment factory and one attends the local school.

loans.use: Increasing income by buying more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane owns a small shop in the Usariver neighborhood of Arusha. She belongs to the Maua loan group  (group code 2055) She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250. Every day she works at her business from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Jane is married, and has three children who are between 5 and 7 years old.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a clothes seller in the Usariver neighborhood of Arusha for 4 years. She belongs to the Furaha loan group  (group code 2014).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $95. Every day she works at her business from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Halima is 33 years old, married, and has two children: ages 12 and 14.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yaroslav, married and with one adult son, sells women's and men’s shoes at one of the markets in Drogobych city. He has invested in his goods about 35,000 UAH but needs to increase the assortment all the time. Hard-working and quite entrepreneurial, Yaroslav started his business 10 years ago. He believes that selling good quality products brings repeat customers and helps his business grow.

Yaroslav would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to purchase his spring collection of shoes. He needs to buy early enough to be able to offer the best selection possible for his customers.

loans.use: to increase his shoe inventory

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.id: Setelah melalui periode pinjaman pertama ibu-ibu yang tergabung dalam kelompok Sari Mertha ini sangat merasakan ada peningkatan di dalam usaha mereka, dari keuntungan yang di dapat sebelumnya. Hal ini tidak lepas dari pembinaan dan kerja sama yang baik antar anggota kelompok dengan pola pemeliharaan yang teratur. Untuk periode pinjaman kedua ini kelompok Sari Mertha masih tetap beranggota 15 orang , pinjaman yang diperoleh Rp. 1.000.000,- per anggota dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan dan pembayarannya dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman. Dana tersebut dipergunakan sebagai tambahan modal usaha yaitu untuk membeli pakan yang berkualitas dan membeli bibit yang akan dipelihara selama sutu kali periode pemeliharaan (6 bulan). Untuk sekarang ini setiap anggota kelompok ada yang memelihara 2 sampai 4 ekor babi yang akan di panen 6 bulan kemudian dengan keuntungan bersih yang di dapat per anggota mencapai Rp. 500.000,-. Dari hasil yang di dapat ini kelompok Sari Mertha lebih bersemangat lagi untuk menjalankan usahanya agar bias meraih keuntungan yang lebih besar lagi.

loans.use: buy more piglets and it's feed

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um S. is a villager in Preaek Ta Noup village in Kandal province. She is a hard-working woman. She is a 59-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory. Since her child’s workplace is far from her house, she usually pays a lot of money for a motorbike taxi to transport her child to work. Thus, Mrs. Um S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her child and to reduce her expense.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child and to reduce her expense.

loans.name: Ndeshukurwa

texts.en:
A member of Hope loan group, Ndeshukurwa has been selling both milk and chicken in the Usariver neighborhood of Arusha for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175 working daily from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Ndeshukurwa is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more milk and chicken for her business, hoping to thereby increase her profit and grow her business.

Ndeshukurwa is married and has two children, ages 23 and 18.

loans.use: To buy more milk and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
A member of Furaha loan, Salome has been a rice seller in the Usariver neighborhood of Arusha for four years, currently earning an average monthly profit of $135 working daily from 11:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more rice for her business, hoping to thereby increase her profit and grow her business.

Salome, 28, is married and has a one-month-old child.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her business.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Mr. M. Abel is 40 years of age. He has been running a small retail shop in Kabwohe for the last four years. He is married to a woman who is a primary school teacher and a hard working mother. The couple has 3 children, whom they take care of very well.

Abel is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, rice, flour, and cooking oil. He dreams of transforming his retail shop into a wholesale business.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Sosal

texts.en: Mr. Sosal Y. (left) is a villager in Bro Chum village in Kandal province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Mao Chanthy (right), is a laborer who is a hard-working woman. Mr. Sosal Y. is applying for a loan to add to his savings to repair the house for his family. He is 30 years old and the parent of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To add to his savings to repair the house for his family.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en: Mrs. Yat S. is a villager in Sdao Kanleng village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who cultivates vegetables to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Pov Sem, is a government officer. Since his workplace is far from their house, he usually pays a lot of money for transportation. Thus, Mrs. Yat S. is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to go to his workplace. She is 54 years old and the mother of four children.  One of her children is employed by AMK Co., Ltd., while two others help their mother on the plantation.  The remaining child is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to go to his workplace.

loans.name: Amosi

texts.en:
Mr. M., Amosi raises cattle and owns over 60 cows. With 20 years of experience in this business, he plans on purchasing more cows for his farm in Lyantonde to increase milk production and sales.

Amosi is a father of 5 school age children. The income from his business has enabled him to pay the fees for his children's education.

loans.use: Purchase more cows to increase milk production

loans.name: Raem

texts.en: Mrs. Raem C. was born in 1946 and lives in Prochum Angk village, Kandal province. She is a laborer who can make a little income to support the family. Apart from being a laborer, she is a farmer who cultivates vegetables to earn a living. Raem is a widow with two children: one is a construction worker, while the other is employed in a garment factory. Although they work hard, they still earn less income to support the family. They live in an old house which is flooded during the dry season. In order to renovate her house, Mrs. Raem C. requests a loan to buy soil to fill in her flood-affected land.

loans.use: To buy soil to fill in her flood-affected land.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a simple wife to Nick B.. They have four children. The eldest child is 16-year-old Nicky, a first-year college student in a state university. The next child is 14-year-old Riza, a second-year student in high school. Riza is followed by 9-year-old Liezel, who is in fourth grade in elementary school. The family lives in a rural area of Sto. Tomas (part of Alicia, Isabela). They live in a small community with good road conditions. By their house, a Catholic chapel is located where Rowena’s family used to visit every Sunday for their spiritual growth.

Rowena also maintains her village store business situated in front of their house. She wants to improve more of her business. Thus, Rowena is looking forward to borrowing a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 from the lending programs of ASKI. Rowena will pay her loan on time so that she will be able to repeat the loan for her store working capital at present. Also, in the coming days, Rowena wants to be able to increase her estimated monthly income of PHP 3,000 in the business. Her estimated monthly income is not enough to sustain both her business and family’s daily needs. Also, her children’s educational needs in the future will increase.

But despite those hopes and dreams in life, Rowena believes that putting God first in everything you do is better than anything else for as said in the Bible, there is nothing impossible with Him.

loans.use: Improvement of village store

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
As a wife and mother, Annalyn started a business so she could help her husband in supporting the needs of their family.  She put up her snack vending business wherein she sells different foods that are very affordable.  Aside from snacks, she also raises chickens for additional income.  Her income of PHP 2,100 a week is being used for a rolling store for her business.  She seeks to improve her business by borrowing a loan of PHP 5,000 and she promises to pay on a weekly basis.  Through the loan, she can increase her merchandise and her income.

To prepare for her children’s education, Annalyn and her husband are now starting to save.  They want their children to finish their studies and hopefully not experience the hardships in life.

Annalyn is 31 years old.  She is married to Anderson and he works as a tricycle driver using their own motorcycle. They have three children: 8-year-old Hannah Pauline, 2-year-old Andrea Lewelyn, and their new born baby Justine Lloyd. The family is living a simple life in Nuesa, Roxas, Isabela.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Mary, a fish seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for six years, currently earns an average monthly profit of $155 working everyday at her business from 10:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to  buy more fish for her business, hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Mary, the 30-year-old married mother of two children, aged 15 and 10, will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Felisiana, Agripina, Mary Y. and Bujaina, each of whom has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Chanry

texts.en: Mrs. Chanry T. lives in Angk village, Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough rice seeds to cultivate rice to earn a living. Chanry has decided to ask for a loan, partly to buy rice seeds to cultivate in the dry season, and the rest to buy fertilizers and pesticides to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nguon Pov, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Chanry T. is 23 years old and married without any children.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to cultivate in the dry season, and to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Mrs. Sauda K., 32, has operated a coffee business in Kabwohe for over 15 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of coffee. 

Sauda is a married woman with four children, all of whom she hopes to educate with the income from the business and her rental units. Her husband also helps in the running of the business. Her dream is to export coffee.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of coffee.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia, a clothes seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for nine years, belongs to Titanic loan group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250 working daily from 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more clothes for her business, hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and her enterprise will grow.  

Zakia, 30 years old, is married and has three children: ages 8, 5 and 2.  She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeurn P. was born in 1971 and lives in Chek village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Mao Tha, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. They now face a small problem because their field has infertile soil. So, Mrs. Khoeurn P. requests a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to support the field and to make her crop more productive. She is 38 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to support the field and to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Ms. Justine A. has a grocery shop. She is a hard-working woman with 4 children who are school-going. Justine has 6 years experience in her business.

The loan is enabling Justine to purchase more items for her shop such as rice, "posho" (cornmeal), margarine, sugar, and many more items. This has increased her profits, thus improving her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase more items such as rice, cornmeal, margarine, and sugar for re-sale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia D. is 45 years old from Malalinta, San Manuel, Isabela.  Her husband Rogelio Sr. is a farmer in their village.  Their marriage was gifted with four children: Grace - 23 years old, high school graduate and working as a domestic helper in Dubai; Glenda - 18 years old, college student; Gretchen - 17 years old, high school student and Rogelio - 15 years old also a high school student.  She is thankful that \her eldest daughter assists them with their financial needs.  

Rice farming has been their main source of income.  But aside from it, she also ventured in the hog raising business as an alternative source of income.  She believes that the business could be of great help for them especially in providing the educational needs of her children.  Cecilia is requesting a loan of PHP 4, 000.00 to sustain her hog raising for she do not want to depend too much from the remittances of her daughter abroad.  She intends to use the loan to buy feeds for the hogs.  

Cecilia said that one could earn income on her own as long as she works hard.

loans.use: To sustain her hog raising business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a single parent raising her 14-year old son named Elmer, a high school student.  According to her, she has no regrets being a single mother for she has her son at her side and they were living happily in the semi-urban village of Marabulig 1, Cauayan City. 

She manages a typical village store.  She works hard for the education of her son but her income is still not enough.  She is now requesting to avail a loan of PHP 15,000 that she can use to maiantain her business for it is her sole source of income.  Teresita also said that being a father and a mother to her son is not that easy but she strives to do her best for his welfare. 

She believes that her son is a God’s gift to her and she will love him and supports him to the best that she can. “Live life to the fullest” Teresita ended.

loans.use: Business Maintenance

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 49 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Mohammad has owned a coffee shop since 1999. He sells all kinds of coffees, teas and Nescafe. Mohammad is special because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody, but mostly his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. He has requested a loan of 1200 US Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials and merchandise for his coffee shop. This is the first time that Mohammad has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by opening a restaurant.

loans.use: Mohammad would like to purchase raw materials and merchandise for his coffee shop.

loans.name: Dienalyn

texts.en:
“Being diligent towards work is a key to success”, says Dienalyn, a hog raiser in Sto. Domingo, Luna, Isabela.  She is 33 years old and married to Jackson, a welder.  The couple is blessed with two children: Chrisjohn - 6 years old, elementary student and Stefanie - 4 years old. The family is living a very simple life in their village.  

She wanted to help her husband in meeting the needs of their family.  She then started to plant vegetable seeds in their small farm and sold the products afterward. Her income from this business is just enough to support the immediate needs of their family.  

At present, she is maintaining her hog raising business and for it to grow, she would like to request a loan of PHP 5,000 that she can use for business expansion.  Aside from raising hogs and selling vegetables, Dienalyn also plans to venture in fish ball vending for extra income.  She wants to earn more income for the education of her children in the future.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam, 36, is married to Samuel M., a farmer. They are blessed with five children, Raymond, 21 years old, a tricycle driver who he did not finish his high school due to financial difficulties; Mary Rose, 17 years old, fourth year high school student; Mary Ann, 15 years old, already married in her very young age; Marimar, 8 years old, grade three pupil; and the youngest is Samuel M. Jr., 3 years old. The family lives in the semi- urban village of Del Pilar Alicia, Isabela. 

Miriam manages a village store in which retails different merchandise and vegetables displayed in front of her store. Miriam has successfully maintained her business for already 10 years now. She wants to avail a loan worth PHP8,000 to further expand her village store and purchase for business stocks in bulk also to increase her weekly net income of PHP800 that is budgeted for the daily allowances of her children and their basic needs at home.  The additional capital she wanted to avail will be of big help in improving her business towards uplifting their current living situation and continuing to send her children to school. “Believing in yourself and to God, all things are possible”, concluded Miriam.

loans.use: Expansion of village store and purchase of additional mechandise for sale

loans.name: Zamzam

texts.en:
Zamzam has been a vegetable and fruit seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 3 years. She belongs to Tupendane Group (group code 2061). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 335. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fruit and vegetables for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Zamzam is 32 years old, married, and has four children: ages between 16 and 12.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married to Henaro L. and they are gifted with four children: Gina - 28 years old, working as a domestic helper abroad; Jimmy L. - 26 years old, high school undergraduate; Romelo - 22 years old and Natalia - 17 years old, a first year college student. They are living a simple life in the village of Marabulig 1 in Cauayan City. 

Anita sells RTW’s including doormats for almost a year.  In a week, she was able to earn at least PHP1,000.  She wants to expand her business for it to become progressive, thus, she wanted to borrow a loan of PHP25,000 so she can buy stocks of RTW that she can sell in their community. Her business right now is their major source of income than their farming activity.  This has been a great help in providing the needs of their family and education of their children.  

Anita believes that every person she meets contributes for her personal transformation.  This is the reason why she enjoys dealing to different type of people with her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of RTW

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena B. is 53 years old and married to Primitivo. She is a mother of four:  Edwin, 33 years old, now a security guard in Manila, Eduardo, 27 years old, also a security guard; Mylene, 31 years old, a plain housewife; and the youngest is Primitivo B. Jr., 23 years old, who also works in Manila. Elena and husband sacrifice the long distance between them and their three male children who are all working in Manila but the distance encouraged them to live out of their own way since her only daughter already had her own family in Barangay Del Pilar Alicia, Isabela, too.

Elena used to manage a food vending business for almost 30 years but due to some bad circumstances, she had lost business capital but still thankful for she retained her village store business that had served as their source of income since they no longer work in the farm due to their age and it has been of great help to her family. Her weekly income out from the business is PHP700. Major parts of the generated amount are being rolled into the store since they no longer have children to send to school. Elena also wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP5,000 to purchase more stocks which paves her way to sustain the business so they will not depend on her children’s support when get weak.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal is a 25 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Kamal has repaired cars since 2003. He repairs cars, changes oil and cleans them. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools and car oil for his garage. Kamal is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. When he first started, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the needed tools for his business. This is the first time that Kamal has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to purchase a new cleaning machine.

loans.use: Kamal would like to use the loan to purchase new tools and car oil for his garage.

loans.name: Rinolie

texts.en:
Rinolie E. is a family man and married to Nida, a housewife.  They have two children: Hannah, the eldest 4 years old and Rainier, 1 year old. They live simply and harmoniously in their village at Marabulig 1 Cauayan City.

Rinolie wants to give the best for his family so he engaged in hog raising business to support his family needs.  He is glad that he was able to sell PHP5,000 per hog every three months.  He is working very hard for the future of his children.  He wants to improve his business and for that he would like to request a loan of PHP10,000 to sustain his piggery.

loans.use: To sustain his piggery business

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en: Mousa is a 28 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Mousa has been working as a car electrician. He also sells electrical accessories. Mousa has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. This is the first time that Mousa has requested a loan. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. Mousa decided on doing this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business in order to improve his income because he will get married soon.

loans.use: Mousa will use the loan to purchase tools for his garage.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is selling frozen meat, fish and chicken and vegetables for almost a year.  Using their motorcycle and her husband as the driver, they roam around their village and other nearby communities selling their products.  The couple devote their time in their business to earn a living for their family.  They are both hoping for the development of their business and with this, she came up with the idea to ask for additional business capital.  Luzviminda is asking for a loan amount of PHP7,000 to sell more products and achieve her business plans for the welfare of her family.  She also exhorted that people must be optimistic and should work for their best. She is inspired by her husband who helps her in the business.  

Luzviminda is married to Roy and they have six children: Romeo, 27  years old and working in the city hall of Cauayan; Jhonny, 22 years old, college undergraduate and now helping his father in the farm; Roy, 20 years old and Rodel, 17 years, were both college students; Rommel, 15 years old, a high school student and the youngest is Rey youngest, 11 years old, grade four elementary student.  They lived a harmoniously life in the village of Marabulig 1 Cauayan City.

loans.use: To purchase additional agricultural products for sale

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en: Augusta I. is 60 years old and married with 6 children. She has a tailoring shop where she sews lovely clothes for her customers. She also sells tailoring materials to her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials for re-sale

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou S. used to engaged in the buy and sell business.  However, due to some business difficulties, she then opted to start another business which is a community store.  In her store, she is earning an average income of PHP5,000 a month that she utilizes to provide the immediate needs of her family and as business capital.  To further improve her business, Marilou extended her wish to borrow a loan of PHP30,000.  She will use the loan to purchase different stocks for her store and hopefully achieve her dream of having a grocery store in their village.  She promised that if she will be given an opportunity, she will work hard and sacrifice to become successful.  

Marilou is happily married to Rodante S. and they are blessed with four children. The eldest is Mariel, 30 years old, married; Joyce, 28 years old, a college graduate and also married; Rodante Jr., 26 years old, college graduate, and the youngest is Love, 25 years old.

loans.use: To purchase different merchandise for sale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana A. is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She sells fairly-used clothing and shoes. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more fairly-used clothes and shoes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fairly-used clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad E. and her husband Ismael are already in their 50’s but despite their age, the couple share their strength in sustaining their livelihood for survival. They were blessed with eight children, some of them were already married, some are working and others are still studying.  Her family enjoys their simple way of living in the large village of Marabulig 1 in Cauayan City which is a flatland and subdivided into five districts. 

To help her husband in meeting their immediate needs, Soledad ventures into a small village store where she earns a monthly average income of PHP2,000.  This is smaller but more convenient compared when she was in the rolling store business.  

Her store sustains the immediate needs of their family while their income from their farming activities supports the tuition fees and allowance of their children. To fulfill her plan for her store, she wishes to avail a loan of PHP10,000 to purchase additional merchandise for her store.  With the different business trainings that she had, she is confident enough that she can make it grow.

loans.use: To purcahse additional merchandise

loans.name: Uchumi Group

texts.en:
Vumilia has owned a mini-shop (kiosk) in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 4 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 90. Every day she works at her business from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Vumilia is 25 years old, married, and has two children: ages 5 and 1. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Aisha, who has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia G. is 50 years old.  Her first husband, with whom she had four children, died ten years ago.  When her first husband died, she went to Hong Kong to work as a domestic helper together with her elder sister; however, she was not able to finish her contract for two years so she went back to the Philippines.  She then got married to Armando G., but they did not have a child.  She was thankful that Armando treated her children as his own and grateful to God for his guidance and for always protecting her. 

With the support of Armando, Leticia was able to put up a small sari-sari store (a community-based store) in their village as replacement for her previous business, which was food vending.  It was again a new start for Leticia and to further improve her business, with the consent of her husband, she is requesting financial assistance of PHP30,000.00.
