She hopes that her request will be granted and she will do her best to pay her loan on time.  The amount will be used for her store and she plans to use some of it to have the family's own electricity and not to depend on their neighbor for an electricity extension, which they also have to pay monthly.  Leticia always keeps her warm smile for everyone for she believes that it is the best way to communicate especially to her customers.

loans.use: To invest in a general store and home electricity

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra used to work as a vegetable and fish vendor in her village.  But then she decided to shift into the poultry business wherein she raises broilers for 40 days.  Weekly, she can sell a maximum of 75 broilers and earn an average of PHP2,500.00.  She wants to improve her business for the of her two children who are in high school.  She wants to borrow a loan of PHP15,000.00 as additional capital in her poultry business, which will be of great help for her family.  She hopes that some day she will be successful in her venture.  

Petra is more empowered right now to strive hard for her family in order to achieve her goals in life. She believes that everything has a reason and purpose, she added. 

Petra is married to Conrado, a part-time carpenter in their village.  They have four children: the eldest is Sheila, already married, 28 years old, and a graduate with a B.S. in Education; Catherine, a college undergraduate in criminology who now works in a factory; Irene, 15 years old, a fourth-year high school student, and April Jane, 13 years old, a second- year high school student .

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is a hog raiser.  She is glad that her business is gradually improving.  Due to lack of capital, she is now asking for financial support of at least PHP15,000.00.  She plans to use the loan to buy additional piglets and a supply of feed.  She continuously prays to overcome the struggles that come to her life and patiently works very hard to achieve her goals and to support her youngest daughter while she pursues her bachelor’s degree, which is Valeriana's greatest gift to her. 

Valeriana is married to Eusebio B. and they have four children: Antonio - 26 years old, a soldier; Audie - 23 years old, a hospital attendant; Ariel - 20 years old, a college undergraduate; and the youngest, Anabelle, a college student.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a mother and wife, Imelda is determined to do everything to help her husband in supporting the needs of their children. Imelda is 43 years old and a simple entrepreneur and her husband is working as a farmer.  Their marriage was gifted with seven children and they are: Rubelyn - 25 years old, a high school graduate; Redento - 21 years old, also a high school graduate; Regina - 19 years old, an elementary school graduate; Ruthlyn - 15 years old, a high school student; Rica - 10 years old, an elementary school student; Regino - 6 years old; and Lyka - 5 years old. Her eldest daughter is already married while two of their children help their father in cultivating their farm.  Imelda and her husband were not able to send their children to college because of financial difficulties.

Imelda engaged herself in a small business that she thinks will best support the daily needs of their family.  She manages a sari-sari store (a community-based store)  that sells basic commodities that are in demand in their village.  She is thankful that she can generate a monthly income of PHP 3,500.00 that she needs to budget for the needs of their family.  

She is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000. This amount will be helpful in acquiring additional inventory such as soap (laundry and bath), rice, sardines, and so on.  Imelda dreams that her store will grow and somehow become a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita tries her best to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family.  She has started to operate a village store from which they can earn enough to cover some of their daily needs. She is planning to purchase more products for additional inventory that she can offer in her store.  With this, she would like to request a loan of PHP 5,000.00 as additional capital.  She and her husband are striving hard to provide a better life for their children and hopefully give them a better education.  

Tita Dacayan is married to Carmelito and he is working as a farmer.  They have two children: Christian - 6 years old, an elementary student, and Christine - 3 years old. The family lives peacefully in Caliguian, Burgos Isabela.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Kola

texts.en: Kola is 52 years old and married with 7 children. He sells firewood. He is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more firewood to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is a 27 year old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Ayman has been selling bread for four years. Ayman requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a van for his bread transportation. This is the first time that Ayman has requested a loan. In the future, Ayman plans to expand his business thanks to the van he will purchase.

loans.use: Ayman will use the loan to purchase a van for his bread transportation.

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Halima has owned a small shop in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 125. Every day she works at her business from 6:00 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Halima is 29 years old, married, and has two children: ages 11 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Sarah, Priscila, Jamilah, and Veniranda, Each woman has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a beautician in her village.  Some of the services that she offers are haircutting, pedicure, manicure, and make-up.  She has been in this business for almost 20 years and it helps her in providing for and supporting the needs of her children and her family.  

Victoria wants to purchase more inventory that she needs in her business, such as cuticle remover, nail polish, powder, scissors, and other beauty products. In order to acquire these items, Victoria is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5000.00 pesos. She dreams to expand her business by having her own beauty salon and an assistant some day.  She also wishes to train those out-of-school youth in her village so that they would have an extra income.  

Victoria is 42 years old and married to Albert, a driver in their community.  They have three children: Jenalyn - 23 years old, a college graduate now working in a department store as a cashier; Maryjoy - 21 years old, a college student; and Albert - 18 years old, also a college student. Victoria loves her family so she sacrifices a lot in order to give them a better life.

loans.use: To increase beauty products inventory

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce has been a vegetable seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 3 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 40. Every day she works at her business from 12:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more vegetables for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Joyce is 31 years old, married, and has three children between 12 and 4. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Fatuma and Farida. Each woman has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for re-sale in order to expand her business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 22 year old man who lives in Bekaa. Mohamad has owned a game shop for a year and he has billiards and baby foot. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. majmoua in order to purchase new games for his shop. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan. Mohamad is speciA. in his work because he is the only one in his region. His clients are the people from his area. He decided on doing this business because of his experience in the business. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to purchase new games for his shop.

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Loeng Thon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who live in Preak Svay village in Kandal province make up the village bank loan. Each member will use the loan for different purposes.

M.. Srey Loeng T. is a farmer who earns a living from the bananas that she grows on a small piece of land she owns. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children. One attends the local school and the youngest, at 5 years old, is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Pak Pol, helps her in the plantation. M.. Srey Loeng T. has an obstacle because her field has infertile soil so she asks for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

Mr. ToU. K. did not attend the meeting but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture instead him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make the field more productive.

loans.name: Wule

texts.en: Wule is 41 years old and married with a child. She sells foodstuffs such as bags of rice and beans. She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Festus

texts.en: Festus O. is 33 years old and married with 2 children. He sells motor spare parts. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en: Kabiru is 32 years old and married with 2 children. He mills palm kernels to make palm oil. He also sells palm kernels. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more palm kernels  to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels to sell

loans.name: Fikiria Group

texts.en:
Anna has been a food and clothes seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 4 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 70. Every day she works at her business from noon to 6:00 p.m. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items and clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Anna is 34 years old, married, and has four children, aged between 15 and 1. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Faustina and Esther. Each woman has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more food items and clothes for her business

loans.name: Mrs. Pao Koch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan consists of 17 people who live in Preak Svay village in Kandal province. Each loan member will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Pao K. is a grocer in the local marK.. She is 41 years old and the mother of four children who all attend the local school. Her husband, Mr. Chan Saroeun, is a fisherman. Although they try to work hard, they still live in an old house in poor condition. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Pao K. is asking for a loan for zinc to use as a roof for her house.

loans.use: To purchase zinc to use as a roof for her house.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia has been a food and vegetable seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 2 years. She belongs to Jikomboe Group (group code 2068). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 450. Every day she works at her business from 6:00 a.m. to noon. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items and vegetables for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Lydia is 48 years old, married, and has four children: ages 22, 18, 14 and 12.

loans.use: To buy more food items and vegetable for her business.

loans.name: Abdumumin

texts.en:
U. Abdumumin first applied to the MicroInvest loan programme in 2007.  He describes himself as a very serious client that trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure and intends to work hard so that he can start a small business. 

Abdumumin has worked in the livestock business for 12 years; he started by helping his father in the same business.  He has one milk cow, one calf and four rams.  Abdumumin wants to buy a pedigree bull to increase his livestock.  Abdumumin applies to Kiva with a request for a business development loan of 300 STJ for six months to purchase a pedigree bull.  He thanks Kiva for its support!

loans.use: purchase a pedigree bull

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is 40 years old and married with four children.  She sells foodstuffs and is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  She also wants to thank Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha Nao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people who live in Preak Svay village in Kandal province form the village bank loan.

The members selected M.. Chantha N. as the village bank president.  She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. She is 47 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are employed in different careers while the remaining three attend the local school.

Her husband, Mr. O., is a construction worker and he also conducts a Tuk Tuk taxi business. Although they T. to work hard, they still cannot provide better conditions for their family. They also live uncomfortably because they have an old lavatory which needs to be fixed. M.. Chantha N. is asking for a loan to fix her lavatory to make her family members more healthy.

loans.use: To fix her lavatory to make her family members more healthy.

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en: Abiodun O. is a barber, and he has been in the profession for a very long time.  He is 30 years old and married with one child.  He is requesting a loan for 40,000 NGN to purchase a hair clipper.  He also wants to thank all the Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase a hair clipper

loans.name: Hulda

texts.en:
Hulda has sold maize in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 16 years.  She belongs to the Ujamaa group loan (group code 2063).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $350 from her business.  Every day, she works from 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more maize for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, she can increase her profit and grow her business.  

Hulda is 48 years old, married, and has eight children: ages 30, 28, 24, 22, 18, 16, 15 and 9.

loans.use: To buy more maize to expand her business.

loans.name: Fikiria Group

texts.en: Agnes M. is 32 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of five and 15.  She is also a member of the Juhudi Loan Group and frequently shares her loans with a colleague.  Agnes has worked for six years as a fish seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha in Tanzania.  She earns about $70 each month yet works from 6:30 every morning until 10:30 every evening.  Agnes wants to purchase more items for her business and thereby increase her customer base and profit.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $350, which she will share with another member from her lending group.

loans.use: To purchase more items in order to expand business.

loans.name: Fagbemi

texts.en: Fegbemi O. is 38 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and their only child.  Each day, Fagbemi sells a variety of foodstuffs in a market to many regular customers.  In order to expand his business and increase his profit, Fagbemi is requesting a loan of $700, which he will use to purchase a greater number of food items for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda lives in Malalinta, San Manuel, Isabela.  She is 41 years old and married to Jimmy, 44 years old and working as an electrician in their village while she maintains her hog raising business.  They were blessed with two children: Jerry -- 18 years old, a second-year college student and Estrella – 14 years old, a junior-high school student. As a mother, Erlinda always sees to it that she meets the needs of her family, especially when it comes to the education of her children.
 
Her dream is for her children to finish their studies and be employed with good jobs and not to experience hardships in life.  Her hog-raising business was Erlinda’s way of helping her husband in supporting their children’s needs in school. But still, their income is not enough.  So she would like to ask for financial assistance amounting to PHP 6,0000.00.  She plans to use the loan to buy bags of feed at the wholesale price in their public market, where the price is lower compared to the price from their local dealer.

loans.use: To buy hog feed

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is happily married to Benjie B., a construction worker in a gasoline company in Manila, Philippines. They have three children, namely; Christian, 20 years old, a first-year college student; next to him Mary Jane, 18 years old, a second-year college student; and the youngest Jane, 16 years old and already a graduating high school student at present. In their developing village of Del Pilar her family is living simply and happily despite the financial difficulties they sometimes encounter. 

Evelyn manages a rolling store, retailing fish and frozen products for over four years already. Using their motorcycle, newly purchased on an installment basis, and with the assistance of her husband who works in a distant place, they provide the family's important necessities. She wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP10,000 for her rolling business to increase her weekly income and be able to continue sending her children to school and to help her husband save for their monthly motorcycle installment. Evelyn admitted that she is not content with their current level of living conditions so she strives a lot for the progress of their lives through her good business endeavors. Evelyn also shares that her children’s education serves as her motivating factor towards working hard and persevering for the best.

loans.use: To increase business capital

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija N. is 28 years old and married.  She lives in Bekaaeith with her husband and their two children, where she also owns a small clothing store that offers clothing for men, women, and children.  Khadija's shop is in a very busy location, and she also offers low prices to her customers and thereby enjoys commercial success.  But in order to expand her business and attract even more clients, she is for the first time requesting a loan of $1000, which will be used to purchase a greater variety of clothes to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of clothes.

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en:
Anacita P. is 46 years old and married to Valeriano. He works as a farmer and manages their own land which is their primary source of income. They have five children: Felipe - 20 years old, college student; John - 17 years old, also a college student; Teodoro - 15 years old, second year high school; and the twins: Reynalyn and Renante - 13 years old. Unfortunately, the twins did not pursue their high school education due to a lack of financial support; instead, their parents prioritized the education of those in college level.

Anacita has been operating a sari-sari store (a community-based store) since 1984. However, her stocks are still limited. Her income of PHP 1,400 a week is being used for their daily expenses, not to mention the school allowance of their children. Her business is really a big help for their family for it sustains their daily needs like food and the allowance for her children. She is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase more stocks for further development of her store that she can offer to her customers. She says, “Life would be easier if everybody faced the trials and problems in life together."

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Glicilda

texts.en:
Glicilda is an entrepreneur married to a security guard, Joselito Ordonez. They were blessed with two children namely, Jocelle Sherwin, 21 years old, a first-year college student and Gliejel Carouzziel, 14 years old,a junior high school student. Their kids are studying here in the province and they live with them happily. Her children also accompany Glicilda in the store during weekends, which makes Glicilda thankful of having them in life.

In the past few years Glicilda had engaged in a rolling business selling assorted goods in the village but currently she maintains her village store, which is easier to manage than roaming from house to house to roll her assorted goods in the village and it has been a big help to them especially in providing her children’s allowances for school. Glicilda is again striving to expand another business, wholesaling vinegar and soy sauce to be delivered to different village stores near them. Thus, she wants to take a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 as business additional capital. Simply committing everything to God, and simply working hard to achieve such an endeavor is an easy way out of the dilemma of poverty, said Glicilda.

loans.use: To expand business capital

loans.name: Sandy Esther

texts.en: Sandy Esther A. is 40 years old and married with four children.  In addition to raising her children and maintaining her household, Sandy sells videos and musical disks to a variety of customers.  In order to supply a greater quantity and diversity of products, Sandy is requesting a loan of $350, which will be used to purchase more videos and musical disks.

loans.use: To purchase more videos and musical disks.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en: Husein R. is 29 years old and lives in Bekaa with his wife and their two children.  For about five years, Husein has owned an accessory shop that sells perfumes, musical disks, phone cards and other goods.  Prior to working in Bekaa, Husein managed a similar shop in Beirut.  Over the years he has developed a technique for maintaining good relationships with his clients and now boasts of a solid network of customers.  In order to further increase this network and attract new customers, Husein is requesting a loan of $1000, which will be used to purchase a greater variety of accessories.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of clothes.

loans.name: Jonervin

texts.en:
“Working hard is the best solution in order to earn more for the welfare of your family” says Jonervin A., 24 years old and a village operator from San Manuel, Isabela.  He is married to Clarita, his business partner.  The couple is quite sad because they do not have a child to inspire them more.  

Their sari-sari store (community-based store) is situated in front of their house. They earn a weekly income of PHP 1,800 that they budget for their immediate needs and a rolling capital.  Jonervin wants to improve his business and for him to fulfill his plans, he is asking for financial assistance of PHP 5,000.00.  He will use the capital to purchase more inventory for the store.  

He hopes to have a stable living with his wife through his community store. His business investment will be a big help in providing a better life for his future children, said Jonervin.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena, 44 years old, is married to Paul A., a church pastor in their village. In the past few years, they lived in Mountain Province, Philippines. But now, they came to settle for good in Barangay Del Pilar, where there are more livelihood opportunities. They were blessed with five children, namely; Enrique, 21 years old, a college graduate and an account officer in a banking corporation; Winnielyn, a domestic helper abroad who, at her young age of 19, also helps her husband with their family; Phoebe, 8 years old, now entering the second grade in the primary level; and the youngest, Valerie, 2 years old. The family is a God-fearing one. Magdalena envisions bringing her family closer to God for she believes in this Bible passage: “Trust in the Lord and He will direct your path.”

Madalena manages a store in their current village retailing gasoline, lubricants (for automobiles), and “bagoong” (a type of kitchen spice) for almost 11 years. Her weekly income from the business has an average of PHP1,000, which is not enough to support the education of her children since they don’t have other sources of income. She would like to receive a loan amounting to PHP5,000 to add to her business revolving capital. She plans to also purchase  some bottled drinks and snacks to increase her weekly income to meet all her family’s necessities. Magdalena is hoping and praying that some day their living situation will become progressive by working hard and motivating her family members to work together in combating life’s difficulties.

loans.use: To increase business Capital

loans.name: Muruf

texts.en: Muruf A. is 35 years old and married with 3 children. He sells automotive batteries. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN  (about $550 USD) to purchase more batteries to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more batteries to sell

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia has been a vegetable seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha, for the last 4 years. She belongs to the Uchumi loan group  (group code 2082). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $20. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more vegetables for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Rukia is married, and has two children: ages 6 and 3.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married to Gerardo, a tricycle (local 3-wheeled vehicle) driver. They have two lovely daughters: Mary Ann, 11 years old and Marielle, 8 years old; both are in elementary school. The family lives in Nuesa Roxas, Isabela. They own a passenger tricycle, which Gerardo is using to earn an income.

To help her husband support the family, Marilyn started a village store business which serves as their source of added income wherein she earns a gross income of PHP 700 a day that they utilize as rolling store capital and for their basic needs at home. She wants to further develop her enterprise, thus, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 that will assist her for the progress of her store. She will then purchase basic commodities that she can offer to her customers.

Marilyn is determined to sacrifice everything for her family and to send her children to school because she wants them to finish their studies and have a better life. She says these things will be possible if you always put God in everything you do.

loans.use: business improvement

loans.name: Iimad

texts.en:
Iimad is a 36 year old man, who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their three children. Iimad has been working as a van taxi driver for five years. His clients can be any passengers. Iimad decided to go into this business because he wanted to be independent. 

He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This is the first time that Iimad has requested a loan.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Frenelinda

texts.en:
Frenelinda is already 53 years old and happily married to Cirilo B., who is a farmer. They live in Barangay Sto. Tomas, Alicia, Isabela. They were blessed with four children who are: Loren, 31 years old; followed by Lea Amor, 25 years old, married; next to her Rosalie, 21 years old, a college undergraduate; and the youngest. Merriam Mae, 17 years old, a special child due to her physical and mental disability (cerebral palsy). Frenelinda and her husband work together for the progress of their family. They consider their special child as a motivating factor to achieve their goals for their family.  

One source of their family income is the village store aside from farming. Frenelinda maintains the business while her husband maintains their farm with the help of their sons-in-law. She was a rolling store vendor in the past, but after a few years, she shifted into managing a store in order to take good care of her special child at home while doing the business at the same time. Frenelinda hopes to improve the business. Thus she wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP8,000 to purchase more inventory, thereby minimizing transportation expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan L. regrets her marriage that lasted for almost a decade and ended because her husband broke her trust, having an affair with another woman. Though her husband has realized his fault, Joan is not yet ready to forgive her husband. For many months she remained calm with what happened. She just focused on raising her two children, Althea Vianca - 4 years old, and John Denver who is 2 years old already, alone. Her children served as her inspiration in struggling with life’s difficulties.

St. Tomas village located in Alicia, Isabela is where her family is currently living, Joan manages her village store business. Prior to her village store, Joan was first engaged in selling vegetables for almost a year and later on decided to shift to managing a village store to raise her children continuously without depending on any support from her husband. Her hopes to improve her current business led Joan to seek additional capital from lenders amounting to PHP 8,000. Her determination to succeed also motivated her to pursue her business alone.

Joan says that she is much blessed in her life for in spite of the trials and challenges, she has managed to overcome those through committing her troubles to God. She just prays that her children will grow up with a good attitude that she will be proud of in the future.

loans.use: business improvement

loans.name: Mariefe

texts.en:
Mariefe is engaged in a direct-selling business. Through venturing into said business, Mariefe can help her husband in generating income for their daily living. Her husband, Eric is busy with their farming business. They have three children namely, Ericson, 9 years old, in grade four, followed by Chelsea Claire, 7 years old, in grade 2, and the youngest is Shane Gwyneth, 5 years old, already in kindergarten. Mariefe said that sometimes they experience problems financially but prayers help them surpass all the hardships they encounter.

In Barangay (township) St.Tomas, Alicia, Isabela, where her family is living, Mariefe maintains her direct-selling business. Through an AVON product brochure, Marife is able to get orders from her regular customers and later on purchase those orders through the company branch in Cauayan City. She used to spend almost PHP 100 back and forth for the transport fee. She wanted to maintain her good performance as an AVON lady/dealer by purchasing more products. But, time has not always been a friend to her because some of her customers have delayed in paying. This is the reason why she wants to borrow additional business capital amounting to PHP 4,000 to pay for the products she ordered from the shop. This would be of great help to her business and her family if approved.

loans.use: Payment for Avon products

loans.name: Isabelo

texts.en:
Isabelo G. is the 48-year-old head of their family. He is married to Josephine who is engaged in managing a village store. They are blessed with five lovely daughters: Josiebelle, 21 years old, already married at her young age; Joanabelle, 19 years old, a high school graduate who is married, too; Janicesabelle, 16 years old, high school graduate, now stays in their home and helps her mother in their store; Ishabelle, 11 years old, graduating from the primary level; and the youngest is Joebelle, 9 years old, in grade five. They live simply in Barangay (township) Marabulig 1, a semi- urban place.

Isabelo manages and owns a tricycle transport service. The business is new to him for he just accompanied his wife in their store before. He just came to realize that he has to purchase an installment motorcycle to have another source of income. That is why he wants to request a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 for his business maintenance and improvement of their village store business to generate and save some money for their monthly motorcycle amortization and the education of their two younger daughters. He is striving for his family’s welfare and to achieve their dreams in life. Isabelo also hopes to maintain their peaceful and harmonious family living despite their difficulties in life.

loans.use: business maintenance

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her husband in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Lina has been a seamstress for two years. She both repairs and sells clothes.

Lina's customers say that she is a talented and capable seamstress. Her clients include her friends, neighbors, and others. Lina started her business because she needed to improve her financial situation and help supplement her family’s income.

Lina has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase additional clothes to sell and sewing supplies. This is the first time that Lina has requested a loan. In the future, she plans to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to sell and sewing supplies

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is already 48 years old, married to Marcelino C. who is a tricycle (local three-wheeled vehicle) operator in Cauayan City. They have eight children: Marlon - 26 years old, elementary graduate; followed by Medelino, 22 years old, high school graduate; next are the twins Michael and Armando who are already 20 years old, elementary graduates; followed by Mamer, 18 years old and a high school graduate; next to him is the only rose among the thorns - Marcybelle, 14 years old, 3rd year high school student; Marvin, 10 years old, grade four at the moment; and the youngest is Mel John, 5 years old. They live a simple life and strive to make plans possible for the future of their big family through the assistance of her husband.

For almost 10 years, Annabelle successfully maintained her business which is selling clothes for adults and children, slippers and doormats so as to be able to send her younger children to school. Anabelle struggles so much in making door mats to add to her current products to increase her income and to pursue her plan to request a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 that will be utilized in her business to further develop her selling of RTW’s (Filipino clothing).

Hard work and patience are the keys to achieving all her ambitions, both in her business and family welfare, said Annabelle.

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Velita

texts.en:
Velita T. manages a village store in their distant village of St. T., a Barangay (township) covered by the municipality of Alicia, Isabela. She is married to Donald T., who maintains their small farm with a lot of rice. At the moment, the couple has already their eldest child named Warren who is now 4 years old. They hope to have their sustainable business to break out life’s difficulties, especially in sending their children to school.

For three years, Velita has been maintaining her village store. She hopes to improve the business in the coming years through hard work and through taking out a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to support not just her store but also their livestock business which is one of their sources of income.

In a week, Velita earns an income of PHP 1,000, not enough to support her store and their daily needs at home; good thing that her child is not yet studying and that they don’t have more children to support. She wants to improve her business for the bright future of her son and future children because according to her, good quality education is the only thing she can give them. Her husband and son are her inspiration to work on towards success.

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Jocilda

texts.en:
Jocilda N. is already 40 years old and still single. Choosing her current marital status was really her option. She lives with her parents, and she is spending a lot of time in her vending business with the help of her niece. Being single is her contentment in life.

Jocilda is a business woman with full of dreams and ambitions in life. She has been selling frozen products and fish for three year salready. She rolls those products from house to house in their village. Jocilda also wants to venture into operating a village store someday thus, she is doing her best to improve her current business to increase her daily income. This is also the reason why she wants to take out a loan amounting to PHP 7,000.

Jocilda adds, “not to lose hope for your value in God’s eyes never changes, no matter how many times you fail Him and how many mistakes you make ” This quotation has served as her guiding principle in life and brings her closer to God.

loans.use: business improvement

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is happily married to Arthur D., who is a farmer; they’re living in a good relationship with their only son Gerald D., 9 years old, a grade four student in the rural village of Sto. Tomas Alicia, Isabela. Last June 21, Virginia fearfully shared her experience being hit with a gun shot and wounded in her back. She passed through a major operation then and had difficulties going back to her business operation which had become her habit already. However, her daughter in her womb didn’t survive because of the incident. And, unfortunately, until now, the crime remains unsolved.

For almost a year, Virginia was happy that she was able to move on and get back to her business. She is maintaining a village store and barbecue business in their village. Her two business types are working simultaneously and being maintained through the assistance of her supportive husband. She wants to request a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 for additional capital in the business and to save enough income to buy a motorcycle for their business transportation, going to market.

In the latter part of the interview, Virginia shared that “everything happens for a reason and only by faith in God could she explain why," a lesson learned from her dreadful experience.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Memoracion

texts.en:
Memoracion is already 55 years old and still single. She’s living in Barangay (township) Marabulig 1, a semi- urban area where most residents are hospitable. She was a domestic helper living abroad for 12 years. Memoracion put up her tailoring shop out of savings accumulated during her stay abroad. Sadly, her loved one was not able to wait for her while she was abroad working. The man married another woman. At present, Memo, her nickname, lives with her parents, nephew and nieces. Due to her failed romance, Memo has already chosen to be single for the rest of her life.

Memo manages her tailoring shop; her weekly income from said business averages PHP1,000 which is enough to support their basic needs at home since she is serving as the family’s breadwinner. She also supports her niece and nephew’s allowances for school since they stay together in their house. This is the reason why Memo wants to take out a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase tailoring cloth, different colored threads, machine needles, and many other materials used in her tailoring business.

"There is nothing impossible with God if you remain a believer," said Memoracion. So, she commits all her plans and dreams to God, believing that someday she will achieve all of those.

loans.use: To purchase cloth for her business

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a 41-year-old diligent entrepreneur. Her husband Romulo O. is a truck driver for a multi-gas company from whom she got the idea of selling LPG tank. They are blessed with four children. The eldest is Alvin, 19 years old, who stopped during her college studies due to obvious financial crisis. Next to him is Analyn, 18 years old, first year in college, followed by Mae-ann, 16 years old, still in third year high school, and the youngest is John Bryan, 10 years old, who is already in the fourth grade of elementary school. They are living in Barangay (township) Del Pilar, located between the boundaries of Cauayan City and Alicia, Isabela.

Marietta is already confident due to her almost three years of maintaining her LPG tank-selling. She hopes to receive a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 as additional capital for her business and to be able to expand into rice and electronic load retailing in their village. She wants to increase her monthly income of PHP 1,700 out of the business she manages. Marietta said that she will do her best to generate a higher income to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.en:
S. Zulfiniso lives in the Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married with 3 children. At present, she supports the family on her income alone. Her husband went to the Russian Federation to find work, but because of the world financial crisis, he could not find a job that would provide his family with the basic necessities.

Zulfiniso has been working at home for six years, running the family business that makes and sells the type of bread most popular in her country. She prepares the dough herself and makes “lepeshky,” which is the traditional bread in Central Asia, including the Tajik Republic.

Zulfiniso has applied for a loan of 3000 STJ for 3 months from KIVA. She wants to expand her business by importing large amounts of flour.

loans.use: Import large amounts of flour

loans.name: Jide

texts.en: Jide A. is 38 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has a small poultry farm where he rears poultry birds. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more poultry birds and poultry feed. He says (thank you" to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds and poultry feed

loans.name: Mrs. Savoeung Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan, which consists of twenty people, is located in Preaek Pang village in Kandal Province. The members will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Savoeung S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Keit Chamroeun, are grocers in the local village. Aside from this business, Mr. Keit Chamroeun is a farmer who cultivates rice on a piece of land to earn a living. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate, so Mrs. Savoeung S. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds to cultivate rice. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to support a pump to make her crop more productive. She is 43 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory; the remaining three are attending the local school. Mrs. Savoeung S. did not come to take the loan, but her husband did so he is shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy rice seeds and for fuel for a pump to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Honest Group

texts.en:
Shamsi has owned a nursery in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 9 years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $650. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more school items (chalk, books, and clothes) for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Shamsi is married, and has two children: ages 18 and 13. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Fransisca, Asha H. and Asha M.. Each woman also has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy school items

loans.name: Yasmeen Bashir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is 56 years old, married, and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan city is famous for its sweetmeat. Her husband, B. A., has been a school teacher for 15 years. Yasmeen baji is the mother of four sons. Her eldest son is a truck driver. Her second son has a leather-selling business. Her third son works in a factory, and her youngest son has a milk-selling business. Yasmeen baji feels proud when she sees her sons establishing their own businesses. Yasmeen baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan for her youngest son whose name is Iqbal. Iqbal wants to expand his milk-selling business by buying another buffalo. 

Yasmeen baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy cold drinks to sell. Suraiya A. baji wants a loan to buy a truck for her loading business. Salma baji wants a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell. Another Salma baji wants a loan to buy shoes to sell. One more Salma baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Olubunmi

texts.en: Olubunmi O. is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children. She sells foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says "thank you" to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Eswat Group

texts.en:
Febronia has owned a small shop in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 2 years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. Every day she works at her business from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Febronia is  married, and has nine children: ages 30, 27, 25, 22, 20, 18, 15, 13 and 8. She also cares for two additional dependant ages 90 and 20. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Anna, Maimuna, Asha, and Antusa. Each of these women also has her own small business in Arusha

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Mr. Moa Un Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve people who live in Preaek Pang village in Kandal Province have formed this village bank loan. All the members will use the loans which they obtained for different purposes. Mr. Moa U. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is farmer who has a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. On his farm, he now faces a small problem because his field has infertile soil which is affecting the crop. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. He will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to support the field to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Lis Pong, is a recycling collector who buys waste such as empty bottles, cans, plastic and so on to re-sell in a recycling factory. Mr. Moa U. is 35 years old and the father of five children, two of whom are recycling collectors while two others help him in farming and the youngest one is attending the local school. Another loan member, Mr. Khorn K. did not come to take a loan but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture instead him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his field and to buy fuel to support the field to make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Mrs. Luz M., 68, hails from the beautiful province of Antique in the Philippines. She is blessed with one child who serves as her inspiration in her daily life. 

She  is engaged in dressmaking for so many years. In spite of  her old age and  being a widow she still dreams to be a recognized fashion designer someday. Mrs. M. is requesting for a loan of  P7,000 to purchase materials for  her dressmaking business.

loans.use: Dressmaking

loans.name: Naseem Allah Rakha Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is 30 years old, married, and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. Her husband is A. R., and he works in a factory. Naseem baji is the mother of three sons. All of her sons are free and don’t do anything. Naseem baji has been selling warm clothes for the past five years. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more warm clothes to sell. 

Naseem baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Maryam baji and Naseem baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk-selling businesses. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy paints to sell. Another Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Hajra baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy warm clothes

loans.name: Ea

texts.en: EA A. is 45 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells cold drinks. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She says "thank you" to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase drinks

loans.name: Rauff

texts.en: Rauff A. E. is 48 years old, married, and has 6 children. He sells planks. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 NGN to purchase more planks to sell. He says "thank you" to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором 34 летняя женщина , мать двоих детей.Работает техничкой в школе Табошара. Её муж занимается откормом и продажей скота.она ему помогает за уходом.У них 20 баранов.Дилором из шерсти баранов вяжет носки и продаёт в зимний период.Пока скот дешёвый Дилором со своим мужем хочет закупить ещё несколько голов.Муж её дополнительно подрабатывает разнорабочим,и погашения вполне смогут погасить без проблем.
texts.en:
Dilorom is a 34-year old mother of two. She works as a cleaning lady at a Taboshar school and helps her husband to raise and sell livestock. Dilorom and her husband own 20 sheep. She uses their wool for knitting and selling socks in the winter season. Dilorom and her husband would like to buy more livestock because it is cheap now. Since her husband also works day jobs, they think they would not have any problems with loan repayment.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Shahida M. Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Shahida baji is 29 years old, married, and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. Shahida baji quit school after passing the 8th standard because her parents couldn’t pay her education expenses. Shahida baji is married to M. A.. He has a motorbike rental business. He has been in this profession for the past five years. Shahida baji is the mother of one son who is four years old. Shahida baji successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy another bike for her husband’s motorbike rental business. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy chickens for her chicken-selling business. Anwar baji wants a loan to buy flour to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Latifatu

texts.en: Latifatu A. is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children. She sells peppers. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more peppers to sell. She says "thank you" to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more peppers

loans.name: Fansat

texts.en: Fansat O. is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She sells yams, and she is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more yams to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Sok Vy

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Vy C. is a villager in Chhrek Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a laborer. Her husband, Mr. Sout Leap, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he has an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy farm supplies to support his field. Mrs. Sok Vy C. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. She is 27 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en: Christine N. is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is in her late 40s and a mother of 9 children; only 4 are still in school. Christine has a business selling fish where she buys dry fish from the surrounding landing sites of Senyi and Kiyindi at a lower price and sells to her customers in Ajjija as well as to those in Buikwe and Lugazi. She has been in the business for over 5 years and she is happy that the business is paying. She has also been able to acquire 2 cows and 2 goats, with the cows giving her milk for sale. Christine needs a loan to help with buying more fish for sale.

loans.use: More fish for selling.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana G. is fifty-four years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to six children; three boys and three girls. She says the last two of her children still in school (junior high). The rest are out of school and are working. Christiana’s husband is a trader. He trades in cement, lorry tires and other hardware. She lives with the family in a family house in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Christiana trades in provisions and many other products such as soap, etc. to make some income to support her husband financially. She procures the goods from distributors in Techiman where prices are quite economical. Christiana does not sell in a store house but treks to sell her products. She has been in business for eight years. Christiana wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more goods. She hopes to help her husband improve upon their standard of living and give their last two children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Na Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Na Ry S. is a villager in Koun Tmart Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a chicken breeder. Her chicken breeding business is doing well, and she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens. Additionally, she needs a loan to build the cage for her chickens. She hopes to increase income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Leng Kha, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate both vegetables and rice. Mrs. Na Ry S. is 41 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school and the remaining child is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To build the cage for her chicken breeding business.

loans.name: Hudoydod

texts.ru: Ашуров Худойдод проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 26 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже два года полностью занимается животноводством. Разводит КРС и реализует на рынке. Бизнес приносит доход. Но сейчас у клиента возникла проблема с кормом , поэтому он решил получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить комбикорм. Это даст возможность до весны обеспечивать своих животных.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hudoydod A. lives in the Gissar district. He is 26 years old, married, and has four children. For the past two years he has worked solely in animal husbandry. He raises cattle and sells them at the market. The business brings him an income. A problem has arisen, however, with feed, so he decided to request a loan in order to buy a pre-mixed complete feed. This will enable him to feed his animals until spring. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a complete feed

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence O. is 39 years old and married with 3 children. He is a photographer. He is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase one digital camera. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one digital camera

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael O. is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She sells sarongs. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence B. is fifty-four years old. She is a divorced mother of two children, both of whom are boys. She says that one of her sons has just completed senior high. The other one has travelled abroad for greener pastures. Florence says that she lives with a sister while her son is also currently living with an uncle in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Florence deals in printed textile fabrics. She says she procures a variety of fancy prints from a textile depot in Accra and sells in Berekum. Florence does not sell in a store house but treks to sell her products and hawks as well. She has been in business for eight years. Florence wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more fabrics. She hopes to put up her own apartment.

loans.use: To buy printed textiles in bulk

loans.name: Nurudeen

texts.en: Nurudeen A. is 27 years old and married with a child. He sells foodstuffs like rice and beans. He is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede F. is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She has a shop where she sells medicine. She is requesting the loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is forty-two years old. She is a married woman with one child: a girl. She says her daughter is currently in the junior high school. Janet lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Janet deals in printed textile fabrics. She says she procures a variety of fancy and wax prints from a textile depot in Accra and sells in Berekum. She also treks to nearby towns to sell. Janet does not own a shop to sell in; therefore, she hawks to sell her products. She has been in business for eight years. Janet wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more fabrics. She desires to sponsor her daughter through school.

loans.use: To buy printed textiles in bulk

loans.name: Oyebola

texts.en: Oyebola J. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Oyebola bakes cakes and meat pies. She is requesting the loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more catering ingredients like bags of flour to bake more cakes and meat pies to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more catering ingredients

loans.name: Ferida

texts.en:
Ferida G. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Ferida is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.ru: Солихов Маъруфджон проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 29 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Работает водителем частного такси по маршруту Душанбе-Гиссар-Душанбе. Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 5 лет. Для того, чтобы привлечь новых клиентов путем снижения цен на предлагаемые услуги, хочет получить кредит и установить газовое оборудование. Кредит планирует получить на 12 месяцев. Таким образом он улучшит финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Marufjon S. lives in the Gissar district. He is 29 years old, married, and has two children. He drives a private taxi along the Dushanbe-Gissar-Dushanbe route. He has 5 years of experience in this sphere. Marufjon would like to receive a loan to install a natural gas based fuel system so that he can lower the price of his services and attract new customers. The loan will have a 12 month term. This will help him improve the family's financial standing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of natural gas fuel system

loans.name: Francesca

texts.en:
Francesca Korang-B. is fifty years old. She is widowed and a mother of four children: a boy and three daughters. She says one of her daughters is married. Of the remaining three, one is at the teacher training college, one is in the junior high and another is in the senior high school. Francesca lost her husband not long ago; that’s why she is in dark colours. In our part of the world as done elsewhere, dark colours are worn when one is bereaved. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Francesca deals in printed textile fabrics. She says she procures a variety of fancy and wax prints from a textile depot in Accra and sells in Berekum. She also treks to nearby towns to sell. Francesca has been in this business for three years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more fabrics. She desires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy printed textiles in bulk

loans.name: Mulikatu

texts.en: Mulikatu A. is 50 years old and married with 2 children. A. sells provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of 30,000 NGN to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Cill

texts.en:
Cill C. is currently in the business of selling rice and beans at the hotel and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Cill is 20 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a big hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Гурезов Шариф проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 47 лет. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Кроме того, он занимается животноводством. Сейчас хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы купить дойную корову. Это поможет ему обеспечить семью свежим молоком , а так же лишнее он сможет продавать и получать прибыль. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharif G. lives in the Abdurahman Jomi district. He is 47 years old, married, and has 5 children. He works on a small farm and raises livestock on the side. Now he would like to use a loan to buy a dairy cow. This way he will be able to provide fresh milk for his family as well as selling the extra milk at a profit. The loan will be repaid over 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.ru: Ишанкулова Мукаррам проживает врайоне Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 57 лет, замужем и имеет троих детей. Имеет лепешечную, где выпекает лепешки на заказ. Кроме того , выпекает для реализации на рынке "Баракат". Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить муку и масло , для того, чтобы иметь в запасе продукты необходимые для выпечки. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mukarram I. lives in the Jalalludin Rumi district. She is 57 years old, married, and has three children. She has a flat bread bakery where she makes flat breads on order. Her bread is also sold at the Barakat market. She decided to request a loan in order to buy extra flour and oil as a reserve stock of the essential ingredients for baking. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour and oil

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Анаев Нурали житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 24 года , женат и имеет троих детей. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно рогатый скот. А так же покупает молодых бычков  для продажи. Для этого он сначала откармливает их. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nurali A. lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 24 years old and is married with three children. He is involved in animal husbandry and also buys and raises young bull calves for sale. Nurali is applying for a loan in order to increase the number of livestock. He would be able to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is fifty-six years old. She is a married woman with two children, a boy and a girl. She says both of her children have completed school and are working. Mary says she lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Mary’s husband is a farmer. She sells textiles and infants' layettes: baby’s cots, napkins, diapers, etc. She says she procures her goods from the nearby cities and sells in Berekum. Mary also treks to nearby towns to sell. She does not own a shop to sell in. Therefore, she hawks to sell her products. She has been in business for three years. Mary wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more goods. She desires to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy infants' layettes and textiles for re-sale

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Акобирова Насиба проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Имеет два вида деятельности. Занимается торговлей тканями и одеждой, а так же занимается пошивом национальной одежды. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы использовать его в торговли и увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nasiba A. lives in the Jalollidini Rumi region of Tajikistan. She is involved in two types of activity. She sells fabric and clothing and she also makes traditional clothing. Nasiba plans to get a loan for increasing cash flow. She would repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI sont tous des femmes mariées. Elles ont  en moyenne 20 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles conjugales avec leurs frères, sœurs, enfants et époux. Elles résident dans le village de WEREKELA, sous préfecture de Fana, dans la préfecture de DIOÏLA relevant de la région de Koulikoro en république du Mali. 
Elles font plusieurs activités mais la plus importante est la vente de céréales.
 Dans le souci de développer leur activité elles ont  intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Aucun prêt précèdent n’a fait l’objet de mauvais remboursement.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 1tonne de maïs, 600 kg de sorgho et 450 kg de petit mil auprès des paysans et paysannes du village de WEREKELA et environs pour être revendus  dans le marché de Fana en gros et au comptant. Leur clientèle est composée essentiellement d’hommes. 
Elles comptent obtenir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 10.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the BENKADI group are all married women. They are on average 20 years old and have 2 children. They live in traditional nuclear families with their brothers, sisters, children, and husbands. They reside in the village of Werekela in the Fana sub-prefecture, in the Dioila prefecture in the region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. They engage in several businesses, but the most important is the sale of cereals. With the aim of developing their business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and are now seeking their fifth group loan. None of their previous loans had any problems being repaid. This loan will be used to buy 1 tonne of maize, 600 kg of sorghum, and 450 kg of pearl millet from the farmers in the village of Werekela and the surrounding areas; these goods will be re-sold in the market in Fana at wholesale in cash. Their clientele is composed mainly of men. With this loan, they intend to generate a profit of 10,000 FCFA, which will be used to take care of and pay for the education of their children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.ru: Гуломов Рузибой житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 45 лет , женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает бухгалтером , но кроме этого занимается животноводством. разводит домашний скот уже около девяти лет. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ruziboy G. lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 45 years old and is married with five children. He is an accountant by trade but for the past nine years he has also been involved in animal husbandry. Ruziboy is applying for a loan in order to purhcase more livestock. He would be able to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty P. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Betty is 24 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 1 child and her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her child.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Madina's Group

texts.en: W. Madina is the leader of the Musoli group in Jinja. She is a business lady involved in the fishing business; she has 2 boats for which she employs a man in charge of each boat though, at times, she indulges in the activity herself. She has been in the business for so long that she has been able to build a good customer base over the years. On each boat, she has fishing nets and hooks, and she would like to buy new ones since the ones she has are used up. She has recently bought a plot of land that she will use for agriculture then in future, she will construct houses for rent.

loans.use: New fishing nets and hooks.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
La plupart des femmes du groupe DANAYA sont  mariées  avec  en  moyenne 25 ans, 4 enfants et vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles conjugales dans le village de WEREKELA, sous préfecture de Fana, préfecture de DIOÏLA, région de Koulikoro république du Mali. Elles se sont connues à travers  des relations professionnelles et font généralement l’achat vente du charbon de bois. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur stock de charbon de bois et de satisfaire le besoin de la clientèle elles ont décidé d’adhérer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe dont quatre prêts agricoles. Les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent ce prêt pour acheter, 13 tonnes de charbon de bois auprès des charbonniers de WEREKELA pour les revendent au comptant et en détail au bord de la route principale BAMAKO – SEGOU à une clientèle composée essentiellement de voyageurs et de revendeurs.
 Elles comptent obtenir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Most of the women in the DANAYA group are married, are on average 25 years old with 4 children, and live in traditional nuclear families in the village of Werekela, Fana sub-prefecture, Dioila prefecture, in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. They met each other through professional contacts and are engaged to a large extent in the buying and selling of charcoal. With the intention of augmenting their charcoal stocks and satisfying the needs of their customers, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and are seeking their fifth group loan. They have obtained four previous agricultural loans, which were all repaid without problems. These women plan to use this loan to buy 13 tonnes of charcoal from the coal sellers in Werekela, in order to re-sell their goods in cash and at retail on the side of the main Bamako-Segou road to a clientele composed mainly of travellers and retailers. With this loan, they intend to generate a profit of 15,000 FCFA, which will be used to take care of and pay for the educational costs of their children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.ru: Намозов Раджабмурод житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 25 лет, женат  и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей крупно рогатого скота. Покупает на одном рынке а продает на другом уже подороже. Бизнес приносит неплохой доход , но теперь он планирует получить кредит и увеличить поголовье скота. Это даст возможность больше заработать. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabmurod N. lives in Abdurahmoni Jomi. He is 25 years old and is married with three children. He has a high school diploma and is involved in livestock sales. He buys livestock at one market and sells it at a profit at nother. The business is profitable, and Rajabmurod would like to get a loan and purchase more livestock. This would help him make more money. He would be able to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Semetiya Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe SEMETIYA sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent en majorité dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, frères, sœurs et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le village de WEREKELA, sous préfecture de Fana relevant de la préfecture de DIOÏLA région de Koulikoro république du Mali. Par des relations commerciales, elles se sont connues et font essentiellement l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires. 
Pour mieux développer leur activité elles ont intégré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe. Les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent utiliser le prêt pour acheter,   600 kg de feuilles de baobab séchées, 150 kg d’oignon et 80 kg d’aubergines. Elles s’approvisionnent  auprès des maraîchers de WEREKELA et environs et revendre sur le marché de FANA en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes.
Elles espèrent  réaliser un bénéfice de 10 000 FCFA  chacune à la fin du cycle qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The ten women of the SEMETIYA group are all married and on average 26 years old with 4 children. Most of them live in traditional extended families with their children, brothers, sisters, and husbands. These women live in the village of Werekela, Fana sub-prefecture, Dioila prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. Through their businesses, these women met each other, and are all engaged to a large extent in the buying and selling of condiments. To better develop their business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and are currently seeking their sixth group loan. All their previous loans were repaid without problems.
