They plan to use this loan to buy 600 kg of dried baobab leaves, 150 kg of onions and 80 kg of eggplants. They supply themselves from the market gardeners in Werekela and the surrounding area, and sell their goods at the market in Fana at retail and in cash to a clientele composed of women. They hope to realize a profit of 10,000 FCFA each at the end of the loan cycle, which will be used to take care of and pay for the education of their children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur habite le quartier d’agoè vakpossito, depuis 1997 ce monsieur  a entamé le commerce de gravier, ce commerce marche bien à agoè parce qu’il y a beaucoup de chantier en construction dans ce quartier, actuellement il a reçu des commandes et pour y répondre il sollicite auprès de WAGES un autre crédit, il a déjà obtenu un crédit qu’il a bien remboursé. Il est marié et est père de trois enfants, sa femme est une coiffeuse.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Agoè Vakpossito district. In 1997 he started a gravel business, which is doing well in Agoè because there are many construction sites in his area. Currently, he has some orders he’s received. And to fill them, he is requesting another loan from WAGES. He already had a loan that he repaid. He is married and the father of three, and his wife is a hairdresser.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gravel

loans.name: Wassa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WASSA est composé de femmes mariées qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles dans le village WEREKELA, sous préfecture de FANA, relevant de la préfecture de DIOÏLA  région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues  par des relations de commerce et font en générale l’achat vente du charbon de bois. 
Pour développer leur activité commerciale et avoir plus de stock, elles ont fait recours à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 9 tonnes de charbon de bois auprès des charbonniers de WEREKELA et environs. Les charbons sont conditionnés dans les sacs de 100kg avant d’être revendus au comptant aux grossistes venant de BAMAKO. Leur clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent obtenir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 40 000 FCFA qui servira à étoffer leur fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
WASSA is a group composed of married women who average 32 years of age and 6 children. They live in traditional conjugal families in the village of WEREKELA (in FANA sub-prefecture, belonging to DIOÏLA prefecture) in the Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. They know one another through business ties and in general do work buying and selling charcoal.

To develop their commerce and to have more inventory, they turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their fifth group loan (solidarity loan). The preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

The group members plan to use this loan to buy nine tonnes of charcoal from the charcoal producers in and around WEREKELA. The charcoal is packaged into sacks of 100 kg and then sold in cash to wholesalers from BAMAKO. Their customers are composed of men and women.

With this loan, they intend to make a profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will serve to expand their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Katoura

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’agoè demakpoè, elle a pour activité principale la vente de bijoux, pagnes, foulards et assiettes, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2005 et elle le fait de façon ambulante, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé et chez des fournisseurs venus du benin, elle vend à crédit à certaines bonne dame et récupère son argent après, son commerce marche bien et  elle voudrait agrandir son stock de marchandises par l’achat de 20 pièces de pagnes et 15 ensembles de bijoux. Elle est mariée et a un enfant.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Agoè Demakpoè district. Her work involves selling jewelry, pagnes cloth, scarves, and plates. She has been in this business since 2005 and goes door-to-door as she works. She supplies herself at the grand marketplace of Lomé and through suppliers from Benin. She sells on credit to certain nice ladies and collects her money afterwards. Her commerce is doing well, and she would like to increase her inventory of merchandise by buying 20 lengths of pagnes and 15 sets of jewelry. She is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and jewelry for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is currently in the business of selling onions, cooking oil, and beans and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rose is 38 years old and is married to a husband who is a chairperson for local council 3. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand the business

loans.name: Ambignakola Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe AMBIGNAKOLA sont en majorité des femmes mariées qui,  avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et  5 enfants  vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies  dans le village de ZANFINA, sous préfecture de KONOBOUGOU, dans la préfecture de BAROUELI, région de SEGOU république du Mali.
 Elles se sont connues à travers des activités traditionnelles qu’elles organisent chaque mois dans le village. Ce groupe fait essentiellement l’achat vente des amandes de Karité préalablement traitées. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont intégré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter 4 tonnes  d’amande de karité  auprès de leurs camarades femmes de ZANFINA et des villages environnants. Ces amandes sont revendues sur le marché de FANA aux grossistes et au comptant à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent obtenir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de  30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour acheter des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The members of the group AMBIGNAKOLA are for the most part married women who average 37 years of age and 5 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families in the village of ZANFINA (in KONOBOUGOU sub-prefecture, of BAROUELI prefecture) in the SEGOU region, Republic of Mali. They know one another through traditional activities that they organize each month in the village. This gourp essentially buys and sells already-processed karité kernels (shea nuts).

Concerned about satisfying the needs of their customers, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their sixth group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

These women intend to buy four tonnes of karité kernels from their women friends in ZANFINA and in surrounding villages. These kernels are resold at the FANA marketplace to wholesalers and in cash to customers composed of men and woman.

With this loan, they intend to make a profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to buy some small ruminants.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy karité kernels

loans.name: Doh

texts.fr: D. doh habite le quartier d’agoè cacaveli, elle fait depuis 2004 le commerce de charbons de bois en gros et en détail, son stock de marchandises a dimunié, cliente de wages, elle s’adresse à wages pour acheter 8sacs de charbons de bois, elle s’approvisionne au marché de tokoin gbadagbo. Elle est mariée et a trois personnes à sa charge. Son mari est un chauffeur et avec ce qu’elle gagne en surplus comme bénéfice elle arrive à aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
D. Doh lives in the Agoè Cacaveli district. Since 2004, she has been doing commerce in charcoal, wholesale and retail. Her inventory has shrunk. As a client of WAGES, she is enquiring with WAGES to buy 8 sacks of charcoal. She supplies herself at the Tokoin Gbadagbo marketplace. She is married and has three people to support. Her husband is a driver. With the extra profits she earns, she manages to help him to cover household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru: Шерова Нозигуль жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 43 года, замужем и имеет пятерых детей.. Уже 12 лет занимается торговлей детской одежды. Имеет потребность в кредите для того, чтобы привезти товар к весне.Это поможет ей увеличить товарооборот и обеспечить себя и население товаром. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nozigul S. lives in the town of Vakhdat. She is 43 years old and is married with five children. For the past 12 years she has been selling children's clothing. She would like to receive a loan in order to supply more goods ahead of the spring season. This would help her increase cash flow and provide goods for herself and her fellow residents. She would be able to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to supply goods for the spring season

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI de l’association Djekafo est composé de sept femmes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et  4 enfants. Toutes ces femmes vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants frères, sœurs et époux. Elles résident toutes dans le village de ZANFINA, sous préfecture de KONOBOUGOU relevant de la préfecture de BAROUELI région de SEGOU république du Mali.
 Elles se sont connues  à travers des activités à caractères agricoles et dans l’intention de valoriser leurs activités (agricoles, commerciales etc.), elles ont décidé de collaborer avec  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe dont deux prêts agricoles. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 180 kg d’oignon, 200 kg de sel de cuisine, 10 boites de 2 kg de concentrée de tomate et une grande quantité de condiments divers. Elles s’approvisionnent sur le marché de Fana pour  revendre sur le marché local de ZAFINA en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Ces femmes espèrent avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 25 000 FCFA qu’elles utiliseront pour acheter des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group of the association Djekafo and is composed of seven married women. They average 32 years of age and 4 children. These women all live in traditional extended conjugal families with their children, brothers, sisters, and spouses. They all reside in the village of ZANFINA (in KONOBOUGOU sub-prefecture, part of BAROUELI prefecture) in the SEGOU region, Republic of Mali. They know one another through work of an agricultural nature.

With the intention of developing their businesses (agricultural, commercial, etc.), they decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their sixth group loan, which included two agricultural loans. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

These women intend to use this loan to buy 180 kg of onions, 200 kg of salt, 10 boxes (2 kg each) of tomato paste, and a large quantity of various condiments. Supplies are gotten at the Fana marketplace in order to be sold retail at the local ZAFINA marketplace, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed essentially of women.

With this loan, the group members hope to make a profit of 25,000 francs CFA that they will use to buy some small ruminants.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiment

loans.name: Afiwo

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de kégué elokopé qui est un quartier au centre de la ville de lomé, elle a pour activité la vente de pagnes et de chaussures. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2004, elle a tous les jours de nouvelles demandes et  parfois elle n’arrive pas les satisfaire toutes, elle a donc besoin d’agrandir son stock, elle demande donc à wages un prêt pour acheter 50 pièces de pagnes. Elle est mariée et a un enfant.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Kégué Elokopé district, which is a district in central Lomé. Her work involves selling pagne cloth and shoes. She has been in this business since 2004. Each day, she receives new orders, and sometimes she isn’t able to fill them all. She therefore needs to expand her inventory. So she is asking WAGES for a loan for buying 50 lengths of pagnes. She is married and has a child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 50 lengths of cloth

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат Ганиева 1971 года рождения , замужем имеет 3 детей. Работает с Микроинвест с 2007 года. Получила кредит на  покупки сухофруктов. Также торгует хозяйственными товарами. В бизнесе помогают дети, когда холодно или когда она неможет выйти на торговлю. Планирует сотрудничать с КИВА и в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
Mamlakat G. was born in 1971. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2007. She received a loan to purchase dried fruits. She also sells household products. Her children help her in her business when it is cold or when she cannot go out to sell. She plans to work with KIVA in the future.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business development

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Курбонов Фирдавс житель города Вахдат. Возраст 21 года , холост. Образование среднее.Занимается торговлей . Торгует на рынке запчастями для автомашин. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 7 лет. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и завезти товар. Это поможет ему обеспечить население необходимыми запчастями. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Firdavs K. lives in the town of Vakhdat. He is 21 years old, single, and has a high school diploma. He sells spare parts for automobiles at the market. He has been in this business for seven years. He would like to receive a loan in order to increase cash flow and purchase more goods for sale. This would help him provide more spare parts for his customers. He plans to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase goods for sale

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont en majorité des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et  7 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, frères, sœurs et époux  dans le village de ZANFINA, sous préfecture de KONOBOUGOU relevant de la préfecture de BAROUELI, région de SEGOU république du Mali.
Ce groupe fait essentiellement l’achat vente de céréales.
Dans le souci d’agrandir leur fonds de commerce, les femmes du groupe ont  décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt  elles comptent acheter,  850 kg de fonio, 300 kg de haricot et 1tonne 500kg de maïs dans le village de WEREKELA et environnants avec les producteurs et productrices de céréales pour être revendus au comptant aux grossistes de Fana. Leur clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  la prise en charge des dépenses des enfants.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Kotognonyala group are mostly married and are an average age of 36 with 7 children. They live in traditional family structures made up of their husbands, children, brothers and sisters in the village of Zanfina, located in the prefecture of Konobougou, adjacent to the prefecture of Baroueli, in the region of Segou, Republic of Mali. This group deals mainly in the sale of cereals. In the effort to increase their operating capital, this group of women decided to join the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance company, with which they are now taking out their fourth group loan.Their previous loans were all duly repaid. With this loan they plan to buy, 850 kg. of fonio (west African grain), 300 kg. of beans and 1,500 kg of corn in the village of Werekela and surrounding area. They will buy from the cereal farmers and resell for cash to the wholesalers in Fana. Their customers are made up of both men and women. With this loan they expect to make a profit of 35,000 Francs CFA which will be used to meet their children's expenses.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat  de céréales.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine D. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil, beans and fish at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Christine is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a secretary in UNDP Sudan. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: K. ama habite le quartier d’agoè sogbossito un quartier au nord de la ville de lomé, le commerce de pagnes  à lomé est une activité très rentable, ce commerce est très developpé au grand marché, K. ama fait ce commerce depuis 4 ans déjà, elle maîtrise bien ce commerce, sa clientèle est importante, elle voudrait commencer à vendre en gros pour cela elle demande à wages un prêt de 150000F pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes. Elle est marié à un monsieur qui est maçon carreleur, ensemble ils ont eu 03 enfants
texts.en:
Ama K. lives in the Agoe Sogbossito neighborhood, north of the city of Lome. The pagne (decorative cloth) business in Lome is very profitable. This business is well developed at K., the central marketplace. Ama has been in this business for 4 years. She has specialized in the selling of pagne cloth and has a large clientele. She would like to start selling pagne in wholesale and has made a loan request to WAGES for 15,000F to buy 30 pieces of pagne. She is married to a man who is a brick-layer and together they have 3 children.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagne (decorative cloth) for resale

loans.name: Nikel Group

texts.en:
Lucy N. age 30, is married with three children, ages 14, 12 and 9 years. She has a pharmacy business. She started this business in 2007 and works daily from 8am until 9pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 117.

This will be Lucy’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy medicine and repaired the pharmacy shop with a new glass door and has repaid the loan successfully. She hopes for a second loan to open another pharmacy.

Lucy will share this loan with her loan group called Nikel , which totals 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Lucy is 1st on the left in a blue T-shirt.

loans.use: to open another pharmacy

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru: Назарова Шарифа проживает в городе Вахдат.Возраст 46 лет, замужем и имеет семерых детей. Образование среднее. Уже 10 лет обеспечивает семью , тем , что работает На рынке. Торгует детской одеждой. К весне планирует завезти весенний товар и поэтому обратилась к нам за кредитом . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharifa N. lives in Vakhdat. She is 46 years old and is married with seven children. She has a high school diploma. For the past 10 years she has been making a living by selling children's clothes at the local market. She is applying for a loan that would allow her to supply goods ahead of the spring season. She would be able to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to supply goods ahead of the spring season

loans.name: Daima

texts.fr: I. daima habite le quartier d’agoè demakpoé, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants, son mari est un menusier. Elle a  pour activité la vente de céréales notamment le maïs, haricot, qui sont très utilisés dans la cuisine togolaise, elle vend aussi à crédit à sa clientèle et récupère dans de brèfs délai ses créances. Elle veut augmenter ses marchandises c’est pour cela qu’elle demande à wages un crédit. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle arrive à aider son mari et à soutenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
I. Daima lives in the Agoè Demakpoé district. She is married and the mother of two. Her husband is a cabinet-maker. Her work involves selling grain, notably corn and beans, which are used a lot in Togolese cuisine. She also sells on credit to her customers and collects on the debt after a short time. She wants to augment her merchandise. That’s why she’s asking WAGES for a loan. With what she earns from her commerce, she manages to help her husband and to support her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI sont toutes mariées avec en moyenne  26 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent en majorité dans les familles conjugales traditionnelles dans le village de ZANFINA, sous préfecture de KONOBOUGOU, dans la préfecture de BAROUELI région de SEGOU république du Mali. 
Unies par des relations commerciales, ces femmes  font généralement  la même activité à savoir  le commerce du bois de chauffe. 
Afin d’améliorer leur activité elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe. Les précédents prêts ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 15 tonnes de bois de chauffe avec les charretiers de WEREKELA qui vont couper du bois de chauffe dans la forêt du dit village. Ces bois sont ensuite vendus dans la ville de Fana  au comptant en détail et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ces femmes comptent réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour étoffer leur fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The nine women of the group SINIGNESSIGUI are all married and average 26 years of age and 4 children. They live for the most part in traditional conjugal families in the village of ZANFINA (in KONOBOUGOU sub-prefecture, part of BAROUELI prefecture) in the SEGOU region, Republic of Mali. United by commercial ties, these women generally work in the same field, namely commerce in firewood.

In order to improve their business, they decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their third group loan. The preceding ones have been repaid

The group members plan to use this loan to buy 15 tonnes of firewood with the cart drivers of WEREKELA who are going to chop some firewood in the forest of the aforementioned village. This wood is then sold retail in the city of Fana, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men and women.

With this loan, the group members intend to realize a profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to increase their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Sharifgul

texts.ru: Раджабова Шарифгуль проживает в городе Вахдат. Замужем и имеет восьмерых детей. Домохозяйка . Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить дойную корову с теленком. Это необходимо для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью  молоком и молочными продуктами. Если она сможет получать много молока , лишнее она сможет продавать соседям и таким  образом она будет получать прибыль. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharifgul R. lives in Vakhdat. She is married with eight children. She is a homemaker. She is applying for a loan in order to be able to buy a dairy cow with a calf. This would allow her to provide her family with milk and other dairy products. If the cow gives enough milk, Sharifgul will be able to make extra cash by selling milk to her neighbors. Sharifgul would be able to pay off the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 40-year-old married man with three children, living in Harouf, southern Lebanon. He has been in the floor tile business for the past 20 years, which he learned from his father who used to take Samir with him to work during holidays. Today, he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1,000 in order to buy scaffolding.

loans.use: Buy scaffolding

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret J. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Margret is 35 years old and is married to a husband that is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a permanent house

loans.name: Kafayati

texts.en: Kafayati is 37 years old and married with 2 children. She sells sarongs at Bola Ige Market in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She requests a loan of N50000 to purchase a greater variety of sarongs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of sarongs to sell

loans.name: Taofeek Jimoh

texts.en: Taofeek Jimoh O. is 36 years old and married with 4 children. He sells tires, which he purchases from Onitsha and resell them in Ibadan. He needs a loan in the amount of N140000 to purchase more tires to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more tires to sell

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les femmes du groupe YEREDEME ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et  6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies dans le village de ZANFINA, sous préfecture de KONOBOUGOU, dans la préfecture de BAROUELI, région de SEGOU république du Mali. 
Les membres du groupe YEREDEME se sont connus par des relations professionnelles et font généralement le commerce de condiments alimentaires.
Pour développer leur activité, elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Tous les précédents prêts ont été bien remboursés.
 Elles veulent acheter, 400 kg de sel de cuisine, 150 kg d’oignon, 15 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et une grande quantité de légumes vertes. Une partie de ces articles est achetée sur le marché de Fana et l’autre avec les jardiniers du village. Les articles sont vendus dans le village à ZANFINA en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes. 
Elles comptent obtenir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 17 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider les époux à subvenir aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
All married, the women of the group YEREDEME average 36 years of age and 6 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families in the village of ZANFINA (in KONOBOUGOU sub-prefecture, in BAROUELI prefecture), the SEGOU region, Republic of Mali. They know one another through professional ties, and they generally do commerce in condiments.

In order to develop their business, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. All the preceding ones have been repaid

The group members want to buy 400 kg of salt, 150 kg of onions, 15 packets (100-count each) of Maggi cubes, and a large quantity of green vegetables. A portion of these goods are purchased at the Fana marketplace; and the other portion, from gardeners in the village. The goods are sold retail in the village of ZANFINA, cash or credit accepted, to women customers.

With this loan, the group members intend to make a profit of 17,000 francs CFA that will be used to help their spouses to provide for the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 38-year-old married man with two children, living in Nabatieh Al Fawka in southern Lebanon. He opened a grocery store 15 years ago, where he services his village. He has already taken several micro loans from Ameen to improve his business. Today, he would like to borrow $1,200 to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose J. is currently in the business of selling beans, onions and maize flour and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Rose is 25 years old, married and her husband is a security guard. She has 1 child who goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay for her child's school fees  BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business and pay school fees

loans.name: Mehrojiddin

texts.ru: Раджабов Мехроджиддин житель города Вахдат . Возраст 26 лет , женат  и имеет двоих детей . Имеет высшее образование и по специальности работает учителем в средней школе. Кроие этого работает таксистом . Кредит планирует использовать для покупки автозапчастей. Они ему необходимы для ремонта автомашины. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mehrojiddin R. lives in Vakhdat. He is 26 years old and is married with two children. He has a university diploma and works as a school teacher. In addition to teaching, Mehrojiddin drives a taxi. He plans to use the loan for buying spare parts for fixing his car. He would be able to pay off the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for fixing the car

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en: Hussein is a 34-year-old married man with two children, living in Zawtar Al Gharbiah in southern Lebanon. He works as a construction worker, specialized in floor tiles.  He already had a micro-loan from Ameen, which was used to buy a floor tile polisher. Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 in order to buy scaffolding.

loans.use: Buy scaffolding

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther S. is in the business of selling charcaol, sugar and soap and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Esther is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a nurse. She has 1 child and her child do not go to school.  With the extra profits earned from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her food selling business

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, living in Ansar in southern Lebanon. She started her home-based business five years ago, selling orientA. clothing to help her husband with the family income. Hanan wants to borrow US$ 1,000 to increase her inventory.

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda A. sells building materials. He is 40 years old and married with 4 children. He is requesting a loan amount of  50,000 NGN to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Зарипов Хикматулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 25 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Уже восемь лет занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Имеет свой магазин у себя дома. Сам живет в одном из отдаленных кишлаков города. Поэтому его магазин единственная возможность сделать покупки. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить товар долгого хранения. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hikmatullo Z. lives in the town of Vakhdat. He is 25 years old and is married with two children. For the past eight years he has been selling groceries. He has a store in his house. He lives in one of Vakhdat's remote villages. His store provides a unique opportunity for people to do groceries in their village. Hikmatullo is applying for a loan in order to buy groceries that can be stocked for a long time. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow and to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza is a 21-year-old young man, living in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon. He works in a clothing store in addition to giving private tutoring for three years. Today, Hamza wants to buy a laptop to improve his knowledge in the subjects he is teaching; therefore he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,100.

loans.use: Buy a laptop

loans.name: Ashwak Group

texts.en:
This group's name is Aswak; it is made of seven ladies who are living in Aley Mount Lebanon.

Hana is a 45 year old married woman who has three children. Hana has been working as a private teacher for three years. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase books and school supplies. This is the first time that Hana has requested a loan. Hana is special in her work because she is patient with children and knows how to make deals with them. Her students are children from her neighborhood. She decided on doing this business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income.

Joulia is a 54 year old woman. Joulia has been working as a seamstress for twenty years. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her work. This is the first time that Joulia has requested a loan. Joulia is special in her work because she does it well and has done it since she was a child, and she is also known for her sewing and good work. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she had difficulty finding clients because she wasn’t known yet for her good and clean work. She decided on doing this work because she always wanted to work and she likes sewing. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

Najwa is a 37 year old married woman who has two children. Najwa has been working as a seamstress for five years. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread and materials for her sewing. This is the first time that Najwa has requested a loan. Najwa is special in her work because has experience and is known of her good work and creativity. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When Najwa first started her business, she had difficulty building networking. She decided to do this work because she has done it since she was young. In the future, she plans on expanding her work.

Ihssan is a 51 year old married woman. Ihssan has owned a grocery store for three years. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Ihssan has requested a loan. Ihssan is special in her work because she is known in her region and she knows how to please her clients, and she has competitive prices. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Ihssan decided to do this business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her store.

Mona is a 50 year old married woman who has three children. Mona has been producing natural food products for ten years in Lebanon. She sells grenadine, vine leaves and other natural products. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials and special products for her production. This is the first time that Mona has requested a loan. Mona is special because she is good in her production. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Mona decided to do this business because she always liked making these items. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

Hindiyeh is a 38 year old married woman who has three children. Hindiyeh has been working as a private teacher for seven years. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase school supplies. This is the first time that Hindiyeh has requested a loan. Hindiyeh is special in her work because she likes children and knows how to make lessons interesting and easier for her students. Her students are usually her neighbors and children of her friends. She decided to do this business because she always wanted to teach.

Widad is a 42 year old married woman who has a child. Widad has been working as a private teacher for ten years. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase school supplies. This is the first time that Widad has requested a loan. Widad is special in her work because she knows how to teach children and make them like their lessons. Her students are usually from her neighborhood. Widad decided to do this business because she always wanted to teach. In the future, she plans on continuing her studies in order for her to become a teacher.

About Group Loans: In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: This loan will assist these women in building their businesses.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary F. is in the business of selling charcoal and local brew from her home and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Mary is 30 years old, married and her husband is a teacher. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits earned from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Cơ năm nay 53 tuổi, gia đình chị có ba con đã trưởng thành. Năm 2001 chị  Cơ tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Đến nay sau 7 năm tham gia Quỹ công việc chăn  nuôi của gia đình chị đang rất phát triển và cho thu nhập ổn định.  Bên cạnh thu nhập từ chăn nuôi hàng tháng gia đình chị  còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm thợ xây của chồng và sự hỗ trợ của các con với tổng thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
Trong thời gian tới gia đình chị  đang dự định đầu tư vốn để  mua thêm lợn về nuôi và mua máy trộn bê tông về phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương vì thế chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi C., 53 years old, has three grown-up children. In 2001, she got a loan from TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) and invested in raising animals. After seven years, her farm has grown significantly and provided her family with a stable source of income. Mrs. C.'s husband, a construction worker, and her children also worked to bring extra income to their family, with a total of 6,000,000 VND/month (equivalent to 345 USD/month). In the coming months, Mrs. C. and her family are planning to borrow money to buy more pigs and buy a concrete mixer to meet the demands of the villagers. Thus, Mrs. C. would like to borrow 20,000,000 VND (equivalent to 1150 USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda A. is in the business of selling charcoal, beans and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Elda is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits earned from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her charcoal, beans and cooking oil business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thư  năm nay 38 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 2001.  Ban đầu chị  Thư vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Sau một thời gian sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả gia đình chị đã đầu tư mở  thêm cửa hàng bán đồ ăn  sáng. Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn T. nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Với tổng T. nhập 7.000.000đ/ tháng từ chăn nuôi, buôn bán  kinh tế gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm thực phẩm và đồ dùng phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 38 years old, has joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam). At the beginning, she borrowed money to invest in breeding animals. After a while using the loan efficiently, she managed to open a small breakfast restaurant. The restaurant has soon become the main source of income for her family. Mrs T.'s family's life has become much better, with the total income of 7,000,000 VND/month (equivalent to 403 USD/month). In the coming loan cycle, she'd like to borrow 20,000,000 VND (equivalent to 1150 USD) to buy more ingredients and other tools for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Donoi

texts.en: Donoi T. is 37 years old and her business is the retail sales of footwear at the wholesale market in the Leova district. As winter is now virtually at an end, she needs to buy shoes for the spring season. The demand for winter shoes is low and T. earns nothing but she still must rent her table at the market. T. has requested a loan from MicroInvest to buy merchandise for the spring season.  In the future, T. would also like to buy clothing to sell during the spring season. This loan will help T. increase her future sales..

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Holberdi

texts.ru: Нодиров Холберди  житель города Вахдат . Женат и имеет  шестерых детей . Занимается  животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит крупно рогатый скот. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже пять лет.Планирует получить кредит  сроком на шесть месяцев. Использует деньги для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Holberdi N. lives in Vakhdat. He is married with six children. Holberdi has a farm and for the past five years has worked in animal hudbandry. Holberdi would like to receive a six-month loan in order to purchase more livestock.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Omolabake

texts.en: Omolabake sells medicines and provisions. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She requests the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and medicines to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhàn  năm nay 47 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 1995. Trong suốt 13 năm tham gia Quỹ  gia đình chị Nhàn luôn sử dụng vốn vay để chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Với sự chăm chỉ và những kinh nghiệm sẵn có công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển hơn. Hàng tháng với mức thu nhập 6.000.000đ từ chăn nuôi lợn, gà và sự hỗ trợ của 3 con đã đi làm  gia dình chị không chỉ hoàn trả  vốn  tốt cho Quỹ mà còn có điều kiện để tích luỹ và tạo điều kiện cho 2 con đi học.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., 47 years old, has joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 1995. In thirteen years being a TYM Fund member, Mrs. N. has always used her loan in raising animals to increase her family's income. With diligence and experience, her farm has grown significantly. Each month, with 6,000,000 VND (equivalent to 345 USD) from raising pigs and chicken and from her three children's wages, Mrs N. is able not just to give TYM the repayments but also to save some money towards her children's schooling. In the coming loan cycle, she'd like to borrow 20,000,000 VND (equivalent to 1150 USD) to buy more pigs and food for pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Muhibideen

texts.en: Muhibideeen A. is 45 years old and married with 5 children. He sells building materials. He is requesting the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials

loans.name: Vu

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Vụ  năm nay 34 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại huyện Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Sau một thời gian vay vốn và sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả gia đình chị đầu tư vốn  để kinh doanh. Hiện tại chị đang là chủ cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Chồng chị ngoài thời gian giúp vợ trong công việc kinh doanh anh còn có thêm nghề sửa chữa đồ điện. Với thu nhập 8.000.000đ/ tháng, cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để mua thêm dụng cụ, thiết bị phụcvụ cho công việc sửa chữa đồ điện của chồng, phần còn lại chị sẽ sử dụng để kinh daonh hàng tạp hoá
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Vu is 34 yrs old, and lives with her husband and 2 young children in Phuc Yen District in the town of Vinh Phuc. In 2003, she joined TYM fund and secured a loan to invest in raising animals. After a period of utilizing the loan program, her family used the money and invested in doing business. Currently she is the owner of a grocery store. Her husband, in addition to helping her with her store, also has a business in electronics repair. With income of 460 USD per month, her family's living standard is improving everyday. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 1150 USD with a portion used to purchase additional parts and supplies for her husband's electronics repair business, and the remainder to invest in her grocery store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria B. is in the business of selling fresh fish at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Victoria is 27 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her fresh fish business

loans.name: Tam

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Tâm  năm nay 46 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 1999. Trong suốt thời gian  tham gia Quỹ  gia đình chị Nhàn luôn sử dụng vốn vay để chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Từ việc chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ đến nay sau 13 năm vay vốn chăn nuôi gia gia đình chị đang là chủ một trang trại khá lớn tại huyện Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Hàng tháng với mức thu nhập 6.000.000đ từ chăn nuôi, làm trang trại  kinh tế gia đình chị Tâm đang ngày càng phát triển hơn.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Tam is 46 yrs old, and joined TYM fund in 1999. Since joining the fund, she has used the loans to invest in raising animals to improve her family's income. After 13 yrs of raising animals in a small setting, she is now the owner of a decent-size animal farm in Phuc Uyen District in the town of Vinh Phuc. With average monthly income of 345 USD, her business is doing quite well and her family's economic situation is improving every day. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 1150 USD to purchase additional pigs and feed for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Юнусов Саид проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 53 года , женат  и имеет четверых детей. Имеет высшее образование , работает учителем в средней школе. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Said U. lives in Vakhdat. He is 53 years old and is married with 4 children. He has a university diploma and works as a school teacher. He would like to get a loan in order to increase the number of livestock. He would be able to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana L. is in the business of selling onions, rice and beans and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Diana is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits earned from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her food selling business

loans.name: Thuc

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Thực  tham gia Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 1995. Gia đình chị có 3 con, chồng chị không may mất sớm, chị đang sống cùng 1 người con tại Thị Xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc.  Hiện tại chị Thực đang kinh doanh các loại rau ,củ , quả  tại chợ  Xuân Hoà thị xã PhúcYên  tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Kinh doanh cũng là công việc đem lại  nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia dình chị  với mức thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Thuc has been a member of TYM fund since 1995. Her family consists of 3 children; her husband unfortunately died early. She currently resides with 1 child in Phuc Uyen District in the town of Vinh Phuc. She has a business selling a variety of vegetables & fruits at Xuan Hoa Market in Phuc Uyen District in the town of Vinh Phuc. Her business is the main source of income for her family with monthly income of 287 USD. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 1150 USD to invest in her family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nghia

texts.vi: Chị Đỗ Nhân Nghĩa năm nay 30 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2006. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị đều đang kinh doanh và có nghề làm vòng hoa. Bên cạnh đó gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn gà để tăng thu nhập của gia đình. Với mức thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng  kinh tế gia đình chị nghĩa đang ngày càng ổn định hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm hoa phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh.
texts.en:
Ms. D. Nhan Nghia is 30 yrs old, and joined TYM fund in 2006. Currently, she and her husband have a business making and selling flower wreaths. In addition, they also raise pigs and chickens to supplement their income. With monthly income of 350 USD, her family's economic situation is becoming more stable. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 525 USD to purchase additional flowers for her business

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane A. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil, beans and maize flour and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Jane is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits that she earns from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her food selling business

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.ru: Михтоджев Мошариф жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 28 лет , замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Училась в швейном лицее. Сейчас занимается пошивом базарных сумок , которые реализует  на базаре. Муж уехал в Россию на заработки. Теперь ей одной приходится обеспечивать свою семью. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить материал. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mosharif M. lives in Vakhdat. She is 28 years old and is married with one child. She studied at a lyceum for tailors and makes a living by making shopping bags and selling them at the market. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia, and Mosharif is the only breadwinner. She plans to use the loan for purchasing fabric. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Tam

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Tâm  38 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2000. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Tâm là từ  kinh doanh hàng nước giải khát và dịch vụ Internet . Với sự hỗ trợ của chồng công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị đang ngày càng phát triển hơn đem lại cho gia đình chị Tâm thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm nước lọc bán  và  mua thêm máy tính để phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh Internet của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Tam is 38 yrs old, and joined TYM fund in 2000. Currently, her main source of income is her refreshment shop and Internet Cafe. With the help of her husband, her business is expanding every day bringing average monthly income of 345 USD. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 1150 USD to purchase bottled waters to sell and to purchase additional computers for her Internet Cafe.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen U. is currently in the business of selling maize flour, bread and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Hellen is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits earned from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her food selling business
